column3: Lore
column4: DescriptionGame
column5: DescriptionLore2
column7: DescriptionLore

column3: Favored by ambitious Noxian aspirants, each strike is a calculated risk, a chance to rise through the ranks by any means necessary.
column4: Grants gold on hit and bonus gold upon reaching 100 stacks, sacrificing the item.
column5: A pact with a lesser greed spirit. For each foe struck, gain 1 silver. Once 100 silver is earned, the spirit consumes the item, granting the wielder a gem worth 300 silver.
column7: This wicked-looking dagger is favored by those who seek power at any cost. When you hit a creature with this magic weapon, you can choose to gain temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt. However, until the end of your next turn, you have disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws.

column3: Associated with the celestial realm of Targon, possibly used by mortals blessed with celestial power or even the Aspects themselves.
column4: Grants a shield after dealing champion damage, preventing damage.
column5: The Time Chain has two ends. As an action, choose two targets to chain. The targets must make a DC 25 Wisdom save or be tethered by time. If either succeeds the save, neither are tethered. When you are able to tether two creatures, they're bound through the celestial realm and the chain disappears from the material plane, existing as a tether in the celestial realm. While a creature is bound, it cannot die if the other creature is alive. All magic performed by a bound creature is felt by its tethered partner, that can choose to immediately dispell it at any point during the duration of the magical effect.
column7: This shimmering chain, crafted from celestial starlight, allows the wielder to manipulate the flow of time in a limited fashion. As an action, you can target one creature within 30 feet. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be slowed for 1 minute. While slowed in this way, the target's speed is halved, it has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, and it can't use reactions. You can use this ability three times, and regain all expended uses after a long rest. Additionally, the chain grants advantage on saving throws against effects that would alter your position in the timeline or otherwise erase you from existence.

column3: Commonly used by ambitious Noxian mages, seeking to amplify their power through dark pacts and esoteric knowledge.
column4: Grants Ability Power and Mana. Stacks bonus Ability Power on champion kill or assist. Loses stacks on death.
column5: Wearer gains +1 to cast spells, maximum +10. On a kill, gain +2 temporary hp. Upon death, lose all bonuses and suffer -1 to hit for 1d4 turns.
column7: This obsidian seal pulses with a malevolent energy. While you wear this seal, your spell attack bonus and spell save DC each increase by 1. Additionally, whenever you reduce a hostile creature to 0 hit points with a spell while wearing the seal, you gain 5 temporary hit points. However, if you are reduced to 0 hit points while wearing this seal, you must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or become cursed. While cursed, you are compelled to serve a dark entity, as determined by the DM, and cannot willingly act in a way that would displease it.

column3: Favored by novice duelists in Demacia, it is a simple but effective blade. Used often by young soldiers in training exercises.
column4: Provides attack damage, health, and lifesteal, enhancing early-game combat.
column5: Grants +1 to hit, +1 to damage. On a critical hit, heal 1d4 hit points. Breaks if wielder is reduced to 0 hit points in a single blow.
column7: This simple, yet effective blade grants +1 to attack rolls and damage rolls made with it. Additionally, you regain 5 hit points after reducing a creature to 0 hit points with this weapon.

column3: Commonly used by Demacian soldiers, its protective qualities are well-regarded. Some suspect Galio's magic is infused, granting the bearer tenacity.
column4: Grants health, health regeneration, and damage reduction from champion attacks.
column5: Wearer gains +8 hit points and regenerates 1 hit point per turn. Reduce damage from targeted attacks by 1, stacks up to 2 times. Shield Crumbles if wearer is Evil Alignment.
column7: While holding this shield, you have a +1 bonus to AC. In addition, as a reaction when you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a saving throw to take only half damage, you can use this shield to instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail. You can't use this reaction if you are incapacitated.

column3: Forged in the icy heart of the Freljord, it whispers tales of forgotten iceborn warriors and their relentless battles against the void.
column4: +150 Health, +10 Attack Damage, 10% Life Steal.
column5: Wearer gains +1 to hit when HP is below 50%. Whenever you deal the killing blow on an enemy, heal 1d4 HP.
column7: This hammer deals an extra 1d6 cold damage on a hit. Once per day, as an action, you can slam the hammer into the ground, creating a 15-foot radius circle of difficult terrain centered on you for 1 minute. Creatures starting their turn in the difficult terrain must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or have their speed reduced by half until the end of their turn.

column3: This orb may be tied to ancient Ionian spirit magic, possibly used to protect against malevolent entities or channel inner power.
column4: Grants ability power, health, and mana. Taking damage grants a shield.
column5: Wearer gains +2 to saves versus magical attacks. If damage would reduce the wearer to 0 hit points or less, they are instead reduced to 1d4 hit points and gain temporary AC 18 for 1 round.
column7: This orb pulses with ancient Ionian spirit magic. While holding the orb, you gain advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can expend a charge to unleash a warding burst. All creatures within 15 feet of you must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be pushed 10 feet away from you and be unable to move closer to you until the end of your next turn. The orb has 3 charges, and it regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

column3: Associated with Ixtal's control over elemental magic and its protective stance, shielding the region from outside threats.
column4: Provides a shield and tenacity after using a bush.
column5: User gains +2 to AC and saves vs. fear for 1d4 rounds after contact with natural foliage.
column7: This seedling resonates with Ixtali elemental magic. As an action, you can plant the seedling in fertile ground. Over the next 24 hours, the seedling grows into a Mosstomper plant that acts as a guardian. The Mosstomper is a Large plant with AC 15 (natural armor), 50 hit points, vulnerability to fire damage, immunity to poison and psychic damage, and the following actions: Slam (Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) bludgeoning damage) and Entangling Roots (The Mosstomper targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or become restrained. A creature can use its action to make a DC 14 Strength check, freeing itself or another restrained creature within reach on a success. The plant lasts for 7 days or until destroyed.

column3: Often found near places of great celestial influence, this tear resonates with the magic of the Aspects and the stars.
column4: Grants bonus mana and mana regeneration, scaling with mana spent.
column5: Wearer gains +1 to cast spells. Each spell cast imposes a cumulative -1 penalty to subsequent castings until a short rest, then penalty resets.
column7: This crystalline tear shimmers with celestial energy. While you possess this tear, your maximum mana is increased by 20. Furthermore, once per long rest, when you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that expends a spell slot, you can regain a number of mana equal to the level of the spell slot expended.

column3: A popular drink amongst the hardy folk, rumored to contain a secret blend of frost berries and melted glacier ice. Associated with the Winter's Claw tribe.
column4: Restores health and grants temporary movement speed boost.
column5: Quaffing it heals 1d6 hp and grants +1 to Move rolls for 3 turns. Chance of frostbite if consumed in warm climates: take 1 cold damage per turn.
column7: When you drink this juice, you gain 1d6 temporary hit points. Additionally, you have advantage on saving throws against the effects of extreme cold for 1 hour. This icy beverage is especially popular amongst the hardy folk of the Freljord, rumored to contain a secret blend of frost berries and melted glacier ice, and is associated with the Winter's Claw tribe.

column3: Favored by Noxian siege engineers and frontline soldiers, it grants size and resilience. Could be associated with the Black Rose through magical augmentation.
column4: Grants increased size, tenacity, and damage reduction against champions.
column5: Drink and grow mighty as an Ogre! But the concoction is unstable. Roll a d6, on a 1, suffer permanent size increase after the draught wears off! On a 6, shrink uncontrollably!
column7: For 1 hour after drinking this elixir, your size increases by one category (Medium becomes Large, etc.), and you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your level. While enlarged in this way, your Strength score becomes 20. If your Strength is already 20 or higher, the elixir has no effect on this score. Once the elixir's effect ends, your size returns to normal, and any unused temporary hit points are lost. Favored by Noxian siege engineers and frontline soldiers, it's rumored that the Black Rose has a hand in the magical augmentation required to make it.

column3: Favored by arena combatants and bloodthirsty warlords seeking an edge in battle. Often used in the fighting pits of Noxus.
column4: Grants attack damage, spell vamp, and empowers basic attacks on hit.
column5: Upon consumption, grants +2 to hit and damage rolls. On a critical hit, regain 1d4 hit points. Lasts 5 turns. Afterwards, suffer -1 to hit rolls for 1 turn.
column7: Upon consuming this elixir, you gain the benefits of the *haste* spell for 1 minute. Additionally, for the duration, you have advantage on attack rolls, but at the end of each of your turns, you must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or attack the nearest creature (determined randomly if multiple creatures are equally near). Favored by arena combatants and bloodthirsty warlords seeking an edge in battle, the Elixir of Wrath is often used in the fighting pits of Noxus.

column3: Commonly used by wandering monks and martial artists in Ionia to recover from strenuous training and meditation. Also popular among assassins.
column4: Restores Health over time. Refills at the fountain.
column5: Quaffing this potion restores 1d6 hit points over 3 rounds. The vial refills with use, but only in areas of natural power. (Example: Sacred Groves)
column7: This small, unassuming flask magically refills itself with a revitalizing concoction. As an action, you can drink this potion to regain 2d4 + 2 hit points. The potion refills immediately after being emptied.

column3: Used by sentinels to sweep for the Black Mist. It reveals hidden dangers and wards off the spectral tendrils of the Ruination.
column4: Temporarily reveals invisible enemy units and disables enemy wards. Useful for scouting and clearing vision.
column5: Grants the user brief glimpses into the ethereal plane, revealing hidden creatures and magical sigils. Grants advantage on saves vs. illusions and enchantments.
column7: This crystal lens allows you to perceive hidden threats. As an action, you can hold the lens and focus on a point within 30 feet. For the next minute, you can see any invisible or obscured creatures and objects in that area. Additionally, any magical wards or traps in the area are revealed to you, appearing as faint shimmering outlines. Once used, the lens cannot be used again until the next dawn.

column3: Likely brewed by a Bilgewater alchemist, exploiting vulnerabilities for profit. Associated with the unscrupulous underworld.
column4: Grants bonus gold on hit but reduces damage dealt to champions.
column5: Grants +1d4 gold per successful attack, but imposes a -1 penalty to hit rolls against formidable foes. Represents a risky gamble for short-term gains.
column7: Upon consumption, this shimmering golden elixir bestows a touch of greed. For the next hour, you have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks made to discern the motivations of creatures, and you gain a +2 bonus to Charisma (Persuasion) checks made to bargain or negotiate. However, you also become noticeably more covetous, and must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be compelled to attempt to acquire any valuable item you see, regardless of the consequences. This effect ends if you are reduced to 0 hit points or if the elixir's duration expires.

column3: Brewed by monks in remote monasteries, it is said to unlock hidden potential within the imbiber. It may be connected to the spirit realm.
column4: Grants bonus true damage and increased ability power.
column5: Upon imbibing, the character must immediately roll a saving throw (Wisdom). On a success, +1 to cast spells and damage, bypassing armour. On a failure, summon a chaotic extra-planar entity.
column7: When you drink this elixir, you gain the benefits of a short rest. Additionally, roll a d4. You gain a bonus equal to the number rolled on one attack roll, ability check, or saving throw you make within the next hour. You can choose to apply the bonus after you roll the d20, but before the outcome is determined.

column3: Poro-Snax are a Freljord delicacy, irresistibly delicious to Poros, the fluffy creatures of the Howling Abyss. Legends say they contain magical warmth.
column4: Feeds a Poro, causing it to grow larger and grant a temporary visual effect.
column5: A handful of Snax charms any beast, and may ward off the chill of a magical blizzard. Consuming a whole bag grants temporary advantage on saves vs. cold damage.
column7: As an action, you can offer a Poro-Snax to a beast of your choice that can see and hear you. The beast must succeed on a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you for 1 minute. While charmed in this way, the beast will follow your simple commands and defend you. A beast charmed in this way cannot be affected by another Poro-Snax until it finishes a long rest. If no beast is in sight, consuming the snax grants you advantage on your next Animal Handling check within the next 10 minutes.

column3: Baked by a famed Demacian baker. It's rumored to have been blessed by a mage to keep soldiers going during long campaigns.
column4: Restores health and mana upon consumption.
column5: When consumed, heals 2d8 hit points and removes one level of exhaustion. This biscuit never spoils and can sustain one lost in the wild.
column7: As an action, you can consume this biscuit. When you do, you regain 4d4 hit points and are cured of one level of exhaustion. The biscuit crumbles to dust after being eaten.

column3: Favored by Noxian arena combatants, these greaves enhance speed, essential for dodging brutal attacks and exploiting fleeting openings in battle.
column4: Increases attack speed and grants a moderate amount of movement speed.
column5: Wearer gains +2 to initiative and attack rolls. Movement in combat is doubled. Upon a failed save vs. magic, wearer flies into a berserker rage.
column7: While wearing these greaves, your walking speed increases by 10 feet. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can enter a berserker rage. While raging in this way, you gain advantage on Strength-based attack rolls and saving throws, and you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. At the end of each of your turns while raging, you must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or suffer one level of exhaustion. This rage lasts for 1 minute or until you are incapacitated. You can use this feature once, and regain its use after finishing a long rest.

column3: Favored by Ionian monks and messengers, these boots whisper of haste and a light step, essential for traversing vast landscapes.
column4: Increases movement speed and reduces the effect of slows.
column5: Wearer moves swiftly (+2 to Move silently checks, +2 to Run checks) and suffers less hindrance from binding magic or terrain.
column7: While wearing these boots, your walking speed increases by 15 feet. In addition, you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks when moving at your normal pace.

column3: Favored by Noxian battlemages, the treads are rumored to have been enchanted by a forgotten hemomancer of the Black Rose.
column4: Reduces the duration of stuns, slows, taunts, fears, silences, blinds, polymorphs, and immobilizes. Grants magic resistance.
column5: Wearer saves against spells and enchantments with a +2 bonus. Furthermore, wearer is resistant to mind-altering effects, such as fear or charm, but is slightly more susceptible to poison damage.
column7: While wearing these treads, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Additionally, you have resistance to poison damage and advantage on saving throws against being poisoned.

column3: Favored by Noxian mages and artificers, enhancing arcane power through specialized construction. Often seen in the Black Rose's inner circles.
column4: Increases magic penetration, allowing spells to deal more damage by bypassing enemy magic resistance.
column5: Wearer's spells ignore some magical defenses. Reduce the target's effective MR by 1 for every 3 levels of the caster. Against creatures with no MR, spells instead inflict +1 damage per die rolled.
column7: While wearing these shoes, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls. Additionally, once per long rest, when you cast a spell that deals damage, you can maximize the damage of one die roll of that spell.

column3: Potentially crafted by monks seeking harmony, reflecting Ionian spiritual beliefs. Could be tied to the Spirit Blossom festival.
column4: Grants bonus Ability Power and Haste, shared with a linked ally, empowering both champions.
column5: Confers +2 to cast spells. If your linked ally is within 30', both gain +2 to cast spells, and any damage they take is reduced by 1. Be careful of range.
column7: While attuned to this amulet, when you cast a spell targeting only one creature, you can choose a second creature within 30 feet of the first. The spell affects both creatures as if they were the original target. If the spell requires a saving throw, each target makes their own save. You can use this property a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

column3: Associated with the spirit magic traditions of Ionia, often used by novice mages to enhance their connection to the spirit realm.
column4: Grants additional Ability Power, increasing the strength of spells and magical abilities.
column5: Those who read from the tome find their spells cast for +1 damage die. But if a 1 is rolled, the spell fizzles as a wild surge.
column7: While holding this book, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DC. In addition, when you cast a spell that deals acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage, you can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to one damage roll of the spell.

column3: Favored by Ionian mages, the wand amplifies the wielder's connection to the spirit realm, enhancing their spells.
column4: Grants +40 Ability Power, increasing the damage of magical abilities.
column5: When held, caster level is increased by 1 for purposes of spell damage. Wild magic surges are slightly more likely.
column7: Wand, very rare (requires attunement by a spellcaster). While holding this wand, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls. In addition, you can expend 1 charge to cast one of the following spells (save DC 17): burning hands, scorching ray, fireball. The wand has 7 charges and regains 1d6 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ash and is destroyed.

column3: Commonly used by Demacian soldiers for basic protection. Often enchanted by mages to enhance its defensive capabilities.
column4: Grants a small amount of armor, reducing physical damage taken from enemy attacks.
column5: Wearer gains +1 AC vs. bludgeoning and slashing attacks. Armor Penalty applies unless STR 13+. If the wearer is attacked by surprise, this armor provides no benefit.
column7: Armor (light armor), uncommon. While wearing this armor, you have resistance to one of the following damage types (choose when you attune to the armor): bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing. Once chosen, the damage type cannot be changed. If the armor is unenchanted, it provides no AC bonus.

column3: Often enchanted by Ionian monks, the Faerie Charm is thought to be infused with the essence of the spirit realm, aiding in meditation.
column4: Provides mana regeneration.
column5: The bearer regenerates 1 MP per turn in addition to their normal regeneration. Advantage on saving throws vs. magical exhaustion. Detect magic emanates from the charm.
column7: Wondrous item, rare. While you possess this charm, you gain advantage on Wisdom saving throws against being charmed or frightened. Additionally, once per day, when you fail a Wisdom saving throw, you can choose to succeed instead.

column3: Commonly used by Demacian soldiers, the Long Sword is a symbol of martial readiness and basic combat training within the kingdom.
column4: Provides a small amount of attack damage, increasing physical damage output.
column5: A Long Sword grants +1 to hit. On a roll of natural 20, wielder inflicts +1 damage. Weapon can be broken on an additional damage die roll.
column7: N/A

column3: Commonly enchanted by magesmiths across Demacia to protect soldiers from rogue mages, or the magic of the Shadow Isles.
column4: Grants magic resistance, reducing damage taken from enemy abilities.
column5: Confers +1 to saves vs. spells and magical effects. If save succeeds, reduce damage by half. May glow faintly in the presence of powerful magic.
column7: While wearing this mantle, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Additionally, you have resistance to force damage.

column3: Often found near ancient wells, rumored to be blessed by the Ice Witch, granting resilience to those who carry them.
column4: Passively grants health regeneration.
column5: Wearer heals 1 hit point per turn. If dropped into potable water, the well or stream heals 1d4 hit points to all creatures within 30 feet when imbibed.
column7: This small, polished bead restores vitality. As an action, you can crush the bead and regain 4d4 hit points. Alternatively, if you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can crush the bead as a reaction. You are instead left with 4d4 hit points. This item crumbles to dust after use.

column3: Often used by aspiring mages and celestial beings, channeling the power of the stars to enhance their arcane abilities, especially those associated with mana.
column4: Grants additional mana, increasing the capacity for spellcasting and ability usage.
column5: Wearer gains +4 to WIL saves vs. magical effects. On a successful save vs. a mana draining attack, gain 1d4 mana points. If the wearer has no mana, they can cast a single spell.
column7: While holding this crystal, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DC. In addition, you regain 1 additional expended spell slot when you finish a short rest. Once you use this ability, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest. This crystal crackles faintly with celestial energy.

column3: Whispers say Aether Wisps are fragments of spirit magic, drawn to places of power or strong emotion within Ionia.
column4: Grants bonus movement speed. Passive effect.
column5: Bestows fleetness of foot. The wielder's movement is subtly enhanced; chance to outrun foes or catch distant prey improves by 10%.
column7: This shimmering wisp grants advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. As a bonus action, you can release the wisp, causing it to hover around you for 1 minute. While the wisp is active, you gain resistance to psychic damage. Once the wisp has been released, it cannot be used again until the next dawn.

column3: Crafted by Ionian artisans, this mirror reflects inner magic, enhancing connection to the spirit realm. Could be associated with the Kinkou Order.
column4: Grants ability haste, mana regeneration, and amplifies healing and shielding power.
column5: Upon gazing, caster gains +1 to cast 'Healing' or 'Charm' spells for (level) turns. Must save vs. WIS or be compelled to reveal darkest secret.
column7: While holding this mirror, you can cast the 'detect magic' spell at will, without expending a spell slot. Additionally, as an action, you can peer into the mirror and attempt to communicate with a spirit. Roll a d20 and add your Wisdom modifier. On a 15 or higher, you establish a brief telepathic connection with a spirit, allowing you to ask it one question. The spirit's answer is cryptic and may be unhelpful. Once used, this feature cannot be used again until the next dawn.

column3: Favored by Noxian arena masters. Barbed armor punishes attackers, reflecting the brutal nature of gladiatorial combat.
column4: Deals magic damage to attackers and applies Grievous Wounds to them for a short duration.
column5: Upon taking damage from a melee attack, the attacker suffers 1d4 damage. If the attack deals piercing or slashing damage, the attacker must make a saving throw or suffer disadvantage on their next attack.
column7: While wearing this armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC. Additionally, whenever a creature hits you with a melee attack, the attacker takes 2 piercing damage.

column3: Favored by Demacian smiths, the Warhammer is a symbol of craftsmanship and martial prowess, often carried by elite soldiers and artisans alike.
column4: Provides attack damage and ability haste, enabling more frequent spell casts and stronger basic attacks.
column5: Confers +1 to hit and damage. Once per day, reroll a failed attack roll. User suffers -1 to charisma checks when wielding (it's intimidating!).
column7: This warhammer grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. In addition, once per day, when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can choose to grant yourself or an ally within 30 feet of you advantage on the next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw they make before the end of their next turn.

column3: Forged with True Ice, it's favored by hardy souls battling the elements and those who value resilience above all else.
column4: Increases health and health regeneration.
column5: Wearer gains +2 to saves versus cold damage and recovers 1d4 hit points after each turn in frigid environments. If broken, may unleash a localized blizzard.
column7: While wearing this bracer, you have resistance to cold damage. As an action, you can touch a creature and grant them 1d6 temporary hit points. You cannot use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.

column3: Potentially linked to ancient Ascended rituals, granting sight beyond mortal limits. Whispers of Azir echo in its embers.
column4: Dealing damage burns enemies, revealing them if they are camouflaged or invisible.
column5: Creatures struck by fire must Save vs. Wisdom or be outlined in spectral fire, visible even through solid objects or magical darkness for 1d4 rounds. Camouflaged creatures are automatically revealed.
column7: While holding these ashes, you can use an action to scatter them, gaining advantage on your next Wisdom (Perception) or Wisdom (Insight) check made within the next minute as whispers of forgotten knowledge guide your senses.

column3: Said to be blessed by ancient spirits of Ionia, this idol is revered for its ability to amplify life energies and connect individuals to the spirit realm.
column4: Increases base mana regeneration and heal and shield power.
column5: Wearer gains +1 to all saving throws vs. spells and magical effects. Once per day, the wearer can attempt to turn undead as a cleric of equal level.
column7: While holding this idol, you can use a bonus action to touch a creature. For the next minute, that creature gains advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. Once used, the idol cannot be used again until the next dawn.

column3: Forged with ice magic, rumored to have originated with the Iceborn. Grants resilience against physical attacks.
column4: Provides armor and mana, reduces cooldowns of abilities.
column5: Grants +2 AC. Those who strike you in melee must SAVE vs. CON 14 or be slowed for 1 round as frost clings to their weapon.
column7: While holding this buckler, you have resistance to bludgeoning damage from nonmagical weapons. Additionally, as a reaction when you are hit by a melee attack, you can cover the attacker in a sheet of ice; they must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or have their speed reduced by half until the end of their next turn.

column3: Crafted by a forgotten Freljordian tribe, it was used by warriors known for chasing down enemies. Bears faint whispers of ancient hunts.
column4: Move speed when near enemies. Gain more move speed when hitting an enemy with an attack.
column5: Grants +1 to chase rolls. On a successful hit, the target must save vs. speed or be slowed (disadvantage on speed-based checks) for 1d4 rounds.
column7: This magical battleaxe whispers tales of the hunt. While attuned, your speed increases by 10 feet when moving towards a hostile creature you can see. Additionally, once per turn when you hit a creature with this axe, you can choose to reduce the creature's speed by 10 feet until the end of your next turn.

column3: Potentially linked to the techmaturgical advancements of Clan Lito or other Ionian inventors seeking to harmonize magic with technology.
column4: Grants bonus magic damage on your next attack after moving.
column5: Grants +1 on a damage roll after moving at least 10ft during the current turn. Requires attunement by a character with the 'tinker' or 'mage' class.
column7: This Ionian device crackles with arcane energy. As an action, you can expend 1 charge to imbue your next weapon attack with magical energy. If that attack hits, it deals an extra 2d6 lightning damage. The alternator has 3 charges, and it regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

column3: Favored by Noxian generals, the Last Whisper ensures their decrees cut through any resistance, solidifying their dominion through force and fear.
column4: Grants armor penetration, allowing attacks to bypass a portion of the target's armor.
column5: Ignores AC. Roll 1d6; on a 6, target's armor permanently degrades by 1 AC due to unseen corrosive whispers.
column7: This Noxian longsword hums with lethal precision. Attacks made with this weapon ignore resistance to slashing damage. Additionally, once per turn when you hit a creature with this sword, you can choose to reduce any temporary hit points the target has by an amount equal to the damage dealt.

column3: Associated with the celestial realm of Targon, offering protection against the void's corrupting influence or the madness of the abyss.
column4: Provides magic resistance, reducing damage from magical sources.
column5: Grants +3 to saves vs. spells and spell-like effects. Wearer ignores the first magical attack each encounter (nullified).
column7: While wearing this cloak, you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, frightened, or possessed. Additionally, you have resistance to necrotic damage and any effect that would alter your form against your will.

column3: Associated with forgotten magics of the Shadow Isles, possibly linked to Mordekaiser's empire or the Black Mist's corruption.
column4: Grants magic penetration. Applies Grievous Wounds on dealing magic damage.
column5: Renders the target vulnerable to magic, inflicting festering wounds that resist healing. Save versus magic or take -1 to future saves until healed magically.
column7: This orb pulses with dark energy. As an action, you can crush the orb, unleashing a wave of necrotic energy in a 30-foot radius. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 8d6 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. For the next minute, any creature that takes necrotic damage from you has disadvantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects. Once used, the orb crumbles to dust.

column3: Crafted with Ionian spirit magic, rumored to have been developed to resist Noxian enchantments during their invasion.
column4: Removes all crowd control effects from your champion. Grants magic resist.
column5: Grants +3 to saves versus spells and illusions. Once per day, the wearer can automatically succeed on a saving throw against an enchantment or binding spell.
column7: While wearing this sash, you can use a bonus action to end one effect that is causing you to be charmed, paralyzed, stunned, petrified or restrained. You can use this property a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

column3: Favored by Ionian archers, enhancing precision and speed. Often used in the defense of sacred groves against Noxian invaders.
column4: Grants attack speed.
column5: Ranged attacks deal +1 damage, and you may fire one additional arrow each round. Requires proficiency with bows. Crafted from enchanted wood.
column7: This masterwork recurve bow, crafted with techniques known only in Ionia, grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. In addition, when you nock an arrow as part of the Attack action, your movement speed increases by 10 feet until the end of your turn.

column3: Commonly used by Demacian scouts, these slingshots are known for their accuracy and reliability in the field. Encourages youthful courage.
column4: Damages a champion from range and grants a small burst of movement speed.
column5: Once per day, hurl a stone with unnatural accuracy. If it hits, briefly gain +2 to your next Agility check to escape or pursue.
column7: This simple slingshot, commonly used by Demacian scouts, grants its wielder advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to track creatures in wilderness environments. In addition, once per day, when you use this slingshot to make an attack, you can reroll the attack roll.

column3: Favored by Noxian assassins and spies, the Serrated Dirk is a tool of treachery and swift, silent kills. Often associated with the Black Rose.
column4: Grants Lethality (armor penetration) and bonus attack damage.
column5: Creature struck must save versus Death or suffer -1 to AC for 1d4 turns. On a hit, next attack roll against target gains +2.
column7: This wicked-looking dagger is a +1 dagger that deals an additional 1d4 poison damage on a hit. Once per day, when you hit a creature with this dagger, you can choose to inflict a wound that bleeds for 1d4 slashing damage at the start of each of its turns. The creature can use an action to staunch the bleeding.

column3: Forged in Demacia, Sheen is rumored to be imbued with the strength of petricite, briefly amplifying the wielder's power after spellcasting.
column4: After using an ability, the next attack deals bonus magic damage.
column5: Upon casting a spell, your next successful hit gains +1 to hit and deals +1d6 elemental damage. Effect fades quickly; use or lose.
column7: This powerful artifact, when held, allows you to channel residual spell energy into your next strike. Immediately after you cast a spell, the next weapon attack you make within 10 seconds deals an extra 2d8 force damage. This effect can only occur once per round.

column3: Forged in Demacia, the sigil represents unbreakable resolve, and defense against magic. It may be tied to the Petricite forests.
column4: Provides armor and magic resist, enhancing survivability against physical and magical damage.
column5: Wearer gains +1 to AC against mundane attacks and advantage on saves versus spells. Furthermore, the sigil negates the first magical attack each day. The sigil crumbles after negating 3 magical attacks.
column7: While holding this sigil, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Additionally, you gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons that are not made of adamantine.

column3: Forged in Noxus, Tiamat whispers promises of destruction, rumored to amplify the bloodlust of its wielder, pushing them towards brutal, overwhelming force.
column4: Deals area of effect damage around the wielder on each attack, amplifying the damage dealt.
column5: Upon a hit, unleash a shockwave (3d6 damage) to all within 5'. Save vs. STR to halve. Continued use corrupts, causing savage urges. On a failed WIS save, attack nearest ally.
column7: This fearsome weapon amplifies the wielder's destructive potential. On a hit, you can choose to deal an extra 3d6 necrotic damage. If you do so, you must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be afflicted with short-term madness, as detailed in the Dungeon Master's Guide.

column3: Favored by Noxian gladiators, the scepter draws strength from struck foes, embodying the empire's brutal and opportunistic nature.
column4: Grants lifesteal, restoring health based on damage dealt to enemies.
column5: Drain 8 hit points from a foe when you hit them with a melee attack. These hit points are added to yours, not exceeding your maximum.
column7: This scepter, when wielded, grants you a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. Once per turn when you hit a creature with this magic scepter, you regain a number of hit points equal to the damage dealt. Additionally, for 1 minute after reducing a creature to 0 hit points with this scepter, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level.

column3: Favored by Demacian sentinels. It is said to be blessed by the Mountain King to make the wearer immovable.
column4: Reduces damage from basic attacks and reduces the attacker's attack speed.
column5: Wearer takes -1 damage from bludgeoning attacks. Foes suffer -2 on attack rolls after striking the wearer for one round.
column7: While wearing this armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC. In addition, as a reaction when a creature you can see within 30 feet of you is forced to move, you can choose to anchor them in place. The creature must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or have its speed reduced to 0 until the end of its turn. You can use this ability three times, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

column3: Favored by Lunari warriors. Provides speed and resilience.
column4: Provides bonus movement speed and health.
column5: Grants +1 to Move Silently in moonlight. Once per day, add +1 to AC vs. ranged attacks if under the open sky.
column7: While wearing this armor, your walking speed increases by 15 feet. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can activate the armor's wings, granting you a flying speed of 30 feet for 1 minute. Once you use this bonus action, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest. Finally, while wearing this armor you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

column3: Whispers say it was forged in the Freljord's coldest depths, resonating with ancient watchers and forgotten ice magic.
column4: Reduces magic resist of nearby enemies and increases magic damage dealt.
column5: Creatures within 20' suffer -2 to saves vs. magic. The wearer's spells inflict +1 damage per die rolled. A chilling aura permeates the area.
column7: While wearing this mask, you have resistance to cold damage. Additionally, enemies within 30 feet of you have disadvantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects that deal cold damage. Once per day, as an action, you can unleash a wave of bitter cold. Each creature within 30 feet of you must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 8d6 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures made of water have disadvantage on this saving throw.

column3: Favored by support champions, particularly those who can heal or shield allies, implying a connection to celestial beings or protectors.
column4: Heals and shields on allies grant them increased attack speed and on-hit damage for a short duration.
column5: Upon shielding an ally, their attacks land with supernatural speed, dealing +1 damage. If target is undead, inflict +1d4 radiant damage. User may suffer temporary blindness after use (1 in 6 chance).
column7: While holding this censer, whenever you cast a spell that heals or grants temporary hit points to an ally, that ally's weapons become wreathed in celestial fire for 1 minute. For the duration, the ally deals an extra 1d4 radiant damage with weapon attacks and gains advantage on concentration saving throws. This effect can only be active on a number of creatures equal to your proficiency bonus at a time.

column3: Associated with the Black Mist and protective enchantments used to ward against its influence.
column4: Grants a spell shield that blocks the next enemy ability.
column5: Blocks one hostile spell. Duration until triggered. Save versus magic each dawn or the veil fades, losing its effect. If the spell would cause permanent damage, the Veil is destroyed.
column7: While wearing this veil, you are immune to the frightened condition. Additionally, the veil begins each day with 3 charges. Whenever you are targeted by a spell or other magical effect, the veil expends one charge and the effect is nullified. If the effect requires a saving throw, you automatically succeed instead. Once all charges are expended, the veil becomes non-magical until the next dawn, at which point it regains 3 charges.

column3: Linked to forgotten rituals of the Shadow Isles, amplifying the user's magic at the cost of their life force. Perhaps Mordekaiser had a use for it.
column4: Increases magic damage dealt, but damages the user each time they cast an ability.
column5: Curse: user's spells do +1d6 dmg. On a cast, user loses 1d4 hp. If reduced to 0 hp via this item, the user is trapped in the Shadow Isles.
column7: While holding this torch, you can cast spells that deal fire damage as if you were 2 levels higher, to a maximum of 20th level. However, each time you cast a spell that deals fire damage while holding the torch, you take necrotic damage equal to the spell's level. This damage cannot be reduced in any way.

column3: Potentially created by a Hemomancer in service to Noxus, it feeds on the life force of its victims.
column4: Deals damage and heals the wielder based on damage dealt. Healing is reduced against minions.
column5: Upon a critical hit, the target must Save vs Death or lose 1d4 HP each round. The wielder gains an equal amount as temporary HP, fading after one turn.
column7: This weapon deals an extra 2d6 necrotic damage to any creature it hits. Whenever you hit a creature with this weapon, you gain temporary hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt (rounded down). These temporary hit points last for 1 minute.

column3: Favored by Noxian gladiators, the Bloodthirster is rumored to be quenched with the essence of fallen foes, empowering its wielder.
column4: Grants lifesteal and overhealing, converting excess healing into a shield.
column5: Heal one hp per successful attack. If you are at full health gain +1 AC until you take damage. Upon reaching 0 hp, the shield absorbs the blow, negating damage and disappearing.
column7: When you reduce a hostile creature to 0 hit points with this weapon, you gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your level. Additionally, for the next minute, your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

column3: Associated with the celestial entities of Mount Targon, possibly used by mortals blessed with celestial power or even the Aspects themselves.
column4: Grants a shield after dealing champion damage, preventing damage.
column5: Negates the next source of damage. Save versus Magic or be immune to the next attack, spell, or hazard. Usable once per dawn.
column7: While holding this divine shield, you gain a +3 bonus to AC. In addition, as a reaction when you or an ally within 30 feet of you is targeted by an attack, you can grant them advantage on the saving throw against that attack. Once you use this reaction, you cannot do so again until the start of your next turn. This shield glows with a soft, ethereal light in the presence of celestials or aberrations.

column3: Associated with celestial beings and cosmic energies from Mount Targon. Enhances movement and magical abilities.
column4: Grants Ability Power, Health, and Haste. Empowers movement speed upon damaging champions with abilities.
column5: Grants +1 to cast spells. After casting a spell, the wearer may move up to their level in feet without provoking attacks of opportunity. This effect lasts for one round.
column7: This belt pulses with cosmic energy. Your walking speed increases by 15 feet. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can channel cosmic energy to empower your spells. For the next minute, whenever you cast a spell that deals damage, you can add your Wisdom modifier to one damage roll of that spell. You can use this bonus action three times, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

column3: Associated with celestial beings and cosmic energies, potentially linked to the Aspect of Twilight or the Celestial Dragon.
column4: Increases ability haste, mana regeneration, and healing and shielding power.
column5: Grants +2 to all Saving Throws against magical effects. Once per day, heal an ally for 1d8 hit points or grant them advantage on their next saving throw.
column7: This crystalline orb resonates with twilight magic. You gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DC. As an action, you can unleash a wave of twilight energy, forcing each creature within 30 feet of you to make a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 6d8 psychic damage and is stunned until the end of your next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't stunned. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

column3: Favored by Noxian duelists, Death's Dance rewards aggression and resilience in battle, embodying the empire's ethos of strength through conflict.
column4: Deals damage over time, heals on takedowns, and reduces incoming damage.
column5: Wounds fester slowly. Upon slaying a foe, regain 1d6 hit points. Incoming damage is lessened, but transferred to a creeping doom. Save versus poison each round or lose 1 hp.
column7: While wearing Death's Dance, you gain a +3 bonus to AC and saving throws. Additionally, when you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. If you do so, you gain temporary hit points equal to half your maximum hit points, and your speed is doubled until the end of your next turn. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

column3: May be tied to the celestial aspects or a forgotten Targonian deity focused on healing and the balance of life energies.
column4: Grants damage and healing based on recent damage dealt. Healing empowers your next damage dealing ability.
column5: Heal a nearby ally, then imbue yourself with the Echo. Next strike deals +1d6 radiant damage. If no ally is near, deal 1d4 damage to yourself.
column7: This sacred amulet holds 5 charges and regains 1d4+1 expended charges daily at dawn. As a bonus action, you can expend 1 charge to unleash a wave of celestial energy. Choose a creature within 30 feet; that creature regains 3d6 hit points and each enemy within 15 feet of that creature takes 1d6 radiant damage. The healing increases to 5d6 and the damage increases to 3d6 radiant damage when you reach 11th level, and to 7d6 healing and 5d6 radiant damage when you reach 17th level.

column3: Favored by assassins and spies, its veil of darkness aids those who prefer to strike from the shadows, concealing their intentions.
column4: Grants a spell shield that blocks the next enemy ability.
column5: Once per day, the wearer can invoke a magical barrier, negating a single hostile spell or effect. The barrier shatters, leaving the wearer vulnerable.
column7: This cloak grants advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in dim light or darkness. As an action, you can pull the hood of the cloak over your head, creating a magical barrier that lasts until the start of your next turn. The barrier blocks the first instance of damage from a single attack or harmful spell that targets you. If the barrier absorbs any damage, the cloak's magic is expended, and it cannot be used again until the next dawn.

column3: Associated with Viktor's experiments and the Glorious Evolution. Could be a prototype created for the Mechanized Infantry.
column4: Gain attack speed and empowers your next attack with bonus damage and a slow.
column5: The wearer gains +3 to hit. On a successful attack, deal +1d6 damage and the target must save vs. paralysis or be slowed (half movement) for 1 round.
column7: While wearing this armor, your Strength score becomes 20 unless it is already higher. The armor has 6 charges. When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend 1 charge to deal an extra 2d6 force damage to the target. The armor regains 1d6 expended charges daily at dawn. If the armor is reduced to 0 charges, roll a d20. On a 1, the hexplate malfunctions and becomes nonmagical.

column3: Said to be blessed by ancient spirits of the Freljord, the Force of Nature resonates with the land's raw, untamed power.
column4: Absorbs incoming magic damage, granting movement speed and reducing future magic damage.
column5: Wearer gains +1 to saves vs. magic. On a failed save, reduce damage by 2, gain +10' movement for 1 round. Upon taking magical damage, the wearer reflects 1d4 force damage.
column7: You gain resistance to cold, lightning, and thunder damage. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can activate the Force of Nature, gaining a +30 feet bonus to your speed and the ability to move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. If you end your turn inside an object, you are immediately shunted to the nearest unoccupied space that you can occupy and take force damage equal to twice the number of feet you moved through the object. This effect lasts for 1 minute. Once used, this bonus action cannot be used again until the next dawn.

column3: Forged by Demacian artisans, rumored to contain a captured spirit, offering protection to its wearer in times of dire need.
column4: Revives wearer upon death with a portion of health and mana after a delay.
column5: Once per day, when reduced to 0 hit points, wearer returns to 50% hit points, but is stunned for 1 round as the spirit attempts to fully take over. Save versus WIS or alignment slowly changes.
column7: When you drop to 0 hit points, you regain hit points equal to half your hit point maximum and are cured of any exhaustion. In addition, hostile creatures within 30 feet of you must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once used, this property of the armor cannot be used again until the next dawn.

column3: Forged in the icy heart of the Freljord, rumored to be linked with ancient Frostguard rituals and imbued with the strength of long-forgotten ice giants.
column4: Grants health, health regeneration, and charges an attack to deal bonus damage based on maximum health.
column5: Wearer gains +3 to CON. Once per day, may unleash a devastating blow dealing extra damage equal to their current HP, but suffer 1d6 damage per 10 HP lost.
column7: While wearing this amulet, your Constitution score increases by 4, to a maximum of 24. Additionally, you gain resistance to cold damage. As an action, you can tap into the amulet's power, granting yourself temporary hit points equal to your level + your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 temporary hit point). You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

column3: Whispers say it resonates with ruined souls, offering warmth, yet promising oblivion. A twisted beacon in the mist.
column4: Deals magic damage to nearby enemies and reduces damage taken from attacks.
column5: Creatures near the wielder take 1d4 damage each round from eerie heat. The wearer gains +1 to AC versus physical attacks, but undead attack at +1 to hit.
column7: This lantern sheds dim light in a 15-foot radius. Undead creatures within the light have disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws against your spells and abilities. As an action, you can intensify the light, increasing the radius to 30 feet and causing all undead creatures within to take 2d6 radiant damage. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. However, each time you intensify the light, you must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or gain one level of exhaustion.

column3: A monument to pride, perhaps tied to the Immortal Bastion. Champions who gain power through notoriety or conquest might be drawn to it.
column4: Grants AD. Kills create a statue; takedowns empower it, granting more AD. Statue expires on death, losing AD.
column5: Upon slaying a worthy foe, gain +1 to hit and damage. Upon death, lose all bonuses, and enemies gain +1 to hit against you. A fitting monument may be erected to avoid complete disgrace.
column7: While wearing this ornate crown, you gain advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks. Whenever you reduce a hostile creature to 0 hit points, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1). These temporary hit points stack, but the total number of temporary hit points you can have from this crown can't exceed your level. In addition, you can cast the spell 'Command' once per long rest, requiring no components.

column3: Favored by frost mages and warriors, the Iceborn Gauntlet channels the chill of the Freljord, offering protection and control over the battlefield.
column4: Empowers auto attacks to create an icy zone that slows enemies.
column5: Upon a hit, target must Save vs. Cold or be Slowed (as per the Slow spell). Furthermore, the ground touched becomes icy and treacherous, requiring a Save vs. Falling each round to avoid being prone.
column7: While wearing this gauntlet, you gain resistance to cold damage. As an action, you can slam the gauntlet into the ground, creating a burst of magical ice. Each creature within 15 feet of you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have their speed reduced by half until the end of your next turn. Additionally, on a hit with a melee weapon attack, you can choose to deal an extra 2d6 cold damage and reduce the target's speed by 10 feet until the end of your next turn.

column3: Favored by warlords, it amplifies damage when allies strike those you've impaired, reflecting Noxian ambition and brutal efficiency.
column4: Immobilizing a champion marks them, dealing bonus damage and empowering allies' damage against the marked target.
column5: Upon a hit, declare one target vulnerable. Allies gain +1 to hit and damage rolls against the vulnerable target for 1 round. Target saves vs. spell or suffers -1 to all saves for 1 round.
column7: While wearing this item, once per turn when you inflict the restrained, stunned, or incapacitated condition on a creature, the next ally to hit that creature with an attack deals an extra 4d6 damage of the same type as the original attack. Additionally, you and allies within 30 feet of you gain advantage on intimidation checks.

column3: Forged in a lost age of Shurima, it whispers of resisting the Void and adapting to any threat. Perhaps tied to the Ascended.
column4: Grants stacking resists. At max stacks, empowers you for damage and even more resists.
column5: Wearer gains +1 AC per round of combat, to a max of +6. Upon reaching +6, wreathes the wearer in dark energy dealing 1d6 necrotic damage to all adjacent creatures on the wearer's turn. AC bonus resets to 0 after combat.
column7: While attuned to this item, at the end of each long rest, choose one damage type. You gain resistance to that damage type until your next long rest. As a reaction when you take damage, you can expend a hit die to gain temporary hit points equal to twice the result of the die roll. These temporary hit points last for 1 minute.

column3: Knights Vow is tied to Demacia's ideals of protection and sacrifice, embodying the unwavering loyalty of its warriors, perhaps Garen or Jarvan IV.
column4: Redirects damage from an ally to the wearer, healing based on damage dealt. Grants bonus armor while near the ally.
column5: Target ally is blessed, taking 1d4 less damage, transferred to the vow-bearer. The vow-bearer heals 1hp per point of damage they deal while the vow remains. While near the ally, +1 AC.
column7: While wearing this armor, when a creature within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can use your reaction to interpose yourself, taking the damage instead. This damage cannot be reduced in any way. You must be able to see the creature taking damage. Additionally, while wearing this armor, you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

column3: Associated with the Black Mist and the Ruination, embodying lingering torment and agony.
column4: Deals bonus magic damage over time, amplified against slowed or immobilized enemies.
column5: Inflicts Agony (save vs. Will or take 1d4 damage/round). Agony intensifies against those Hindered or Bound, doubling the damage. Upon death, the Agony transfers to the nearest living creature.
column7: This dark amulet pulses with malevolent energy. Once per day, as an action, you can curse a creature within 60 feet that you can see. For the next minute, any fire damage or necrotic damage dealt by you to the cursed creature ignores resistance to that damage type, and treats immunity as resistance. Additionally, at the start of each of its turns, the cursed creature takes 2d6 necrotic damage. A creature can only be affected by one instance of this curse at a time.

column3: Forged with celestial power on Mount Targon, it resonates with the strength of the sun and protects against the encroaching darkness.
column4: Provides magic resist and an AoE shield to protect allies from incoming damage.
column5: Bestows a ward against malign spirits. Grants +2 to saves vs. spells for the wearer and those within 30'. Lasts 3 turns. Usable once per day.
column7: This radiant locket, blessed by the sun, radiates an aura of protection. As an action, you can expend 3 of its charges to grant yourself and all allies within 30 feet temporary hit points equal to your level + your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1). Additionally, while wearing the locket, you and allies within 10 feet have advantage on saving throws against being frightened. The locket has 7 charges, and regains 1d6+1 expended charges daily at dawn.

column3: Associated with the ancient Rune Mage, Luden, amplifying magical abilities and arcane echoes within Ionia.
column4: Damaging abilities grant charges. At max charges, the next damaging ability consumes all charges to deal bonus damage to the target and nearby enemies.
column5: Upon casting, roll +INT. On a 10+, unleash a magical barrage dealing 1d6 force damage to all creatures within 10ft.
column7: While attuned to this mystical Ionian artifact, your spellcasting resonates with arcane energy. When you cast a spell that deals damage, choose one creature damaged by the spell. That creature takes an extra 1d6 force damage. You can use this property a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

column3: Forged in Ionia, the Manamune is believed to be connected to the spirit realm, amplifying the wielder's inner energies into potent attacks.
column4: Grants bonus damage based on mana. Converts mana to attack damage and restores mana on hit.
column5: Wielder's attacks deal +1d4 force damage for every 10 points of mana. On a hit, restore 1 mana; if mana is full, +1 temporary hit point instead. Breaks if mana ever reaches 0.
column7: This Ionian blade hums with spiritual energy. While attuned, you can use a bonus action to expend one of your unspent Hit Dice and infuse the blade with that energy. For the next minute, any attack you make with this weapon deals an extra amount of force damage equal to the number rolled on the Hit Die. This property can only be used once per long rest. Additionally, whenever you take damage while holding this weapon, you gain temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus.

column3: Mejai's Soulstealer is likely connected to dark magic practiced in Noxus or learned from the Black Rose.
column4: Grants Ability Power upon champion kills and assists, up to a cap. AP is lost upon death.
column5: Wearer gains +1 to cast dangerous magics. For each foe slain, gain +1 to hit with any magic attack, maximum +25. Upon death, lose all bonuses and roll on the mishap table.
column7: This Noxian artifact hungers for souls. When a creature dies within 30 feet of you, you gain 1 Soul Charge. You can have a maximum number of Soul Charges equal to your level. As a bonus action, you can expend any number of Soul Charges to gain a bonus to your spell attack rolls and saving throw DCs until the end of your turn. The bonus equals +1 for every 5 Soul Charges expended (minimum +1). If you are reduced to 0 hit points, you lose all Soul Charges.

column3: Associated with the aspect of protection, embodying resilience against malevolent forces. Connected to celestial beings watching over Runeterra.
column4: Removes all crowd control effects from an ally and grants them temporary immunity to disables.
column5: Touch a creature to instantly remove paralysis, sleep, or charm. Furthermore, the target saves against all further such effects for the next turn.
column7: While holding this amulet, you gain advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. As an action, you can touch one creature within 30 feet of you and end one condition afflicting it. The condition can be blinded, deafened, paralyzed, poisoned, or stunned. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until the next dawn.

column3: Associated with forbidden Noxian magics and necromancy, potentially linked to dark arts practiced in the empire's underbelly.
column4: Applies Grievous Wounds to enemies hit by abilities, reducing healing.
column5: Creatures struck by magic from this tome suffer -2 on all saves vs. death magic and healing spells restore only half HP. Undead take double damage.
column7: This heavy tome pulses with necrotic energy. While holding it, your spell attacks deal an extra 1d6 necrotic damage. Whenever you deal necrotic damage to a creature with a spell, that creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the end of your next turn. While poisoned in this way, the creature cannot regain hit points.

column3: Linked to Ryze and the World Runes, resonating with immense magical power and potential.
column4: Grants bonus damage and mana-based scaling on-hit and with abilities.
column5: Upon attunement, weapon deals +1d6 force damage. Expend mana (1 point) to deal +1d6 force damage with an attack. Chance of attracting unwanted magical attention.
column7: This weapon crackles with potent, latent energy. While attuned to this weapon, you can use a bonus action to activate its Muramana ability. While active, your weapon attacks deal an extra 1d8 force damage. If you expend a spell slot while Muramana is active, the extra damage increases to 2d8 force damage until the end of your turn. This ability lasts for 1 minute, or until you choose to deactivate it as a bonus action. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

column3: Associated with Ionian assassins seeking perfect form, possibly linked to the Spirit Blossom festival's transience.
column4: Abilities reduce other ability cooldowns on-hit, empowering future casts.
column5: Swift action to reduce next spellcasting time by 1 round. On critical, caster may Disappear as per the spell, but lasts only 1 round (1-in-6 chance each round).
column7: This +2 shortsword hums with barely contained energy. Once per short rest, when you take the Attack action on your turn, you can choose to teleport to an unoccupied space within 30 feet after each attack made as part of that action, before making the next attack. If you do so, your movement does not provoke opportunity attacks until the end of the turn. Additionally, when you score a critical hit with this weapon, the target must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be stunned until the end of its next turn.

column3: Forged in the forges of Noxus, rumored to be quenched in the blood of fallen enemies, possibly a favored item by Darius.
column4: Grants bonus health, attack damage and size, increased damage based on missing health, and bonus healing.
column5: Wearer gains +3 Hit Points. When below half HP, do +1 damage. When HP is critical, do +2. Chance to instill fear in weaker foes. Requires attunement and a Strength score of 13.
column7: This suit of +2 plate armor is forged of blackened steel and emanates an aura of menace. While wearing this armor, you gain the following benefits: You have advantage on Strength saving throws and Strength (Intimidation) checks. When a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to force the creature to make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes necrotic damage equal to your level. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

column3: Crafted in Noxus, it whispers promises of dominance, potentially tied to blood magic or the Crimson Circle.
column4: Deals AoE damage around the user and empowers the next attack to deal more damage to low health enemies.
column5: Strike the ground to deal 2d6 damage to all within 10ft (save for half). Next attack deals +1d8 damage and, if target is below 25% HP, they must save vs. death or die instantly.
column7: This +3 greataxe pulses with dark energy. While wielding this weapon, you gain a +10 bonus to damage rolls against creatures that are not constructs or undead. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can expend one hit die and cause the axe to deal an extra 2d6 necrotic damage on a hit until the end of your turn. Any creature reduced to 0 hit points by this axe has its life essence violently ripped away, preventing resurrection unless the body receives a *Wish* spell or similar magic. You can use this bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

column3: Crafted by the Iceborn of the Freljord, it is said to ward off the most savage blows.
column4: Reduces damage from attacks and slows nearby attackers.
column5: Grants a 1-in-6 chance to negate any physical blow. On a failed save, attackers within melee range must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be slowed (attacks made at -2 penalty) for 1 round.
column7: While wearing this armor, you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, as a reaction when you are hit by an attack, you can force the attacker to make a DC 15 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the attacker's speed is halved until the end of their next turn.

column3: A brutal weapon favored by Noxian warriors. It is rumored to have been wielded by powerful warlords, amplifying their destructive potential in battle.
column4: Deals area of effect damage and grants lifesteal, enhancing sustain and wave clear.
column5: Cleave: Enemies within 10' take 1d6 damage. Life Drain: User heals 1hp per successful attack. On a critical hit heal 1d4 in addition. Wielder must save vs. CHA or become blood thirsty (-1 to CHA rolls).
column7: This magical greatsword grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can choose to deal an extra 3d6 necrotic damage to the target. If you do, you gain temporary hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt. You can use this property a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

column3: Implies a connection to hemomancy or the Black Rose, enhancing their life-draining magic and dark influence.
column4: Damage is converted to true damage, and healing is granted based on damage dealt.
column5: Wearer gains +1 to hit and damage. On a hit, regain 1d4 hit points. Prolonged use turns flesh pallid; must SAVE vs DISEASE each day or lose 1d6 CON.
column7: This rod grants a +3 bonus to spell attack rolls and saving throw DCs. Whenever you cast a spell that deals damage, you regain hit points equal to 1d4 + the level of the spell. In addition, spells you cast ignore resistance to necrotic damage and treat immunity to necrotic damage as resistance.

column3: Crafted by an unknown Ionian smith, it is said to channel the storm's fury through multiple projectiles, embodying Ionian balance.
column4: Fires bolts at nearby enemies on attack, dealing reduced damage but applying on-hit effects.
column5: The wielder's attack splits, striking two additional targets within range. Each secondary strike deals less damage, but may inflict status effects.
column7: This elegant bow, crafted in Ionia, hums with latent energy. When you make a ranged attack with this weapon, you can target up to three creatures within 30 feet of each other. Make a separate attack roll against each target. On a hit, the attack deals normal damage. This property can be used a number of times equal to your Dexterity modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

column3: Associated with celestial beings and immense magical power, rumored to be linked to the Aspect of Magic.
column4: Grants ability power, mana, and a shield based on mana.
column5: Wearer gains +1 to cast spells. Expend mana to create a shimmering shield, AC 16, absorbs 1d6 damage. Shield lasts 3 rounds.
column7: Wondrous item, requires attunement by a spellcaster. This shimmering amulet grants you a reservoir of magical energy. You gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier x your level in a spellcasting class. These temporary hit points last for 1 hour. Once per long rest, when you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you can choose to expend any number of these temporary hit points to cast the spell as if using a spell slot one level higher for every 10 temporary hit points spent (maximum of 5th level). For example, you could spend 20 temporary hit points to cast a 3rd level spell using a 5th level spell slot.

column3: Likely named after a Freljordian hero or ice witch, this weapon embodies the harsh, unforgiving nature of the frozen north and its tenacious inhabitants.
column4: Provides armor penetration and slows enemies hit by abilities.
column5: Attacks bypass armor as if it were ice. Upon being hit, enemies must Save vs. Cold or suffer -2 to movement speed for 1d4 rounds.
column7: This weapon, forged in the icy heart of the Freljord, is perpetually cold to the touch. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, the target’s speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of your next turn. In addition, when you score a critical hit with this weapon, the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of your next turn.

column3: Said to amplify the voices of Targonian Aspects, channeling celestial power into a harmonious battle cry.
column4: Grants movement speed and empowering damage to nearby allies upon activation.
column5: Once per day, emits a pulse. Allies gain +2 to initiative and deal +1 damage for the next round. Undead flee.
column7: While holding this rod, you can use a bonus action to unleash a celestial battle cry. For the next minute, you and all allies within 30 feet gain the following benefits: Your movement speed increases by 10 feet, and once on each of your turns, you can deal an extra 1d6 radiant damage when you hit a target with an attack.

column3: Forged by a Shojin monk, it amplifies inner strength. It is possibly related to the spirit realm and martial prowess of Ionia.
column4: Grants bonus attack damage, health, and ability haste. Abilities grant bonus movement speed and attack speed.
column5: Wearer gains +2 to hit and damage. After casting a spell, move more quickly and strike with supernatural speed for 6 seconds. Save versus WIS or be stunned for 1 round after spell cast.
column7: This spear grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can expend a Ki point (if you have any) to regain hit points equal to the damage dealt. Alternatively, you can use a bonus action to focus your inner strength; for the next minute, your weapon attacks deal an additional 1d8 force damage.

column3: Said to be imbued with the essence of a tranquil river spirit, favored by Ionian monks for meditation and empowering allies.
column4: Heals or shields grant bonus Ability Power and Haste to the user and their ally.
column5: Upon casting a spell that heals or protects, the target's next spell is empowered. The target can cast spells faster or produce a more powerful effect as determined by the GM.
column7: This staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff that grants a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls. As an action, you can touch a willing creature and grant them 'flowing water'. For the next minute, whenever the target casts a spell that restores hit points to another creature, that creature also gains temporary hit points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of 1).

column3: Potentially crafted by a Demacian artisan for elite warriors, it symbolizes resilience and the will to endure even mortal wounds.
column4: Provides a shield when taking heavy damage, and boosts size and strength.
column5: Wearer gains +2 on saves vs. massive damage. Upon failing a save, briefly become giant-sized, gaining +1d6 to hit and damage for 1d4 rounds.
column7: This imposing gauntlet grants +2 to Strength and Constitution. As a reaction when you are reduced to 0 hit points, but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. If you do so, you gain temporary hit points equal to half your hit point maximum. These temporary hit points last for 1 minute. Once used, this property of the gauntlet cannot be used again until the next dawn.

column3: Favored by Noxian warmasters, it allows brutal warriors to close the gap and deliver devastating blows. Associated with aggressive, conquering forces.
column4: Deals damage and slows enemies on cast, while granting movement speed.
column5: Once per day, user may move their speed x3. If the user attacks, all targets hit must save vs STR or be slowed for 1d4 turns. Damage inflicted is +1 die type.
column7: This weapon grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. As an action, you can unleash a wave of force in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone and their speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of your next turn. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

column3: Forged in the heart of Targon, it is associated with celestial beings, granting resilience in the face of overwhelming odds.
column4: Deals continuous magic damage to nearby enemies and enhances defensive stats.
column5: Grants a constant aura of searing heat. Those nearby suffer 1d4 fire damage per round. User gains +2 to AC, and saves versus fire. Armor check penalty increased by 1.
column7: While wearing this armor, you gain resistance to fire damage. Additionally, any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of you takes 1d6 fire damage. The armor emits bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. As an action, you can intensify the flames, causing creatures within 5 feet of you to take 2d6 fire damage instead of 1d6, and increasing the bright light radius to 15 feet and dim light to 30 feet. This intensified effect lasts for 1 minute, and you can't use this ability again until you finish a short or long rest.

column3: Favored by those who extract a toll of blood and tears, The Collector is seen among the Black Rose's inner circle.
column4: Grants bonus attack damage, critical strike chance, and lethality. Executes enemies below a health threshold, granting bonus gold.
column5: On a successful attack, the target must make a saving throw or be reduced to 0 HP if already below 5 HP. If the target dies, the wielder gains 1d4 gold.
column7: This dagger is perpetually slick with a dark, viscous fluid. Once per turn when you hit a creature with an attack using this dagger, you can choose to deal an extra 2d6 necrotic damage to the target. If you do so, you regain hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt. In addition, the first time you reduce a hostile creature to 0 hit points with an attack using this dagger, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level. These temporary hit points last for 1 hour.

column3: Crafted from the remains of a monstrous sea creature, perhaps related to Nagakabouros or a powerful Kraken from the depths.
column4: Deals additional damage based on the wielder's maximum health, amplified on subsequent attacks.
column5: Upon a successful hit, make a DC 15 Strength check. On a success, push the target 1d4 x 5 feet and deal an additional 1d6 damage per point of Strength bonus.
column7: This massive, grotesque weapon is crafted from the solidified heart of a monstrous sea creature. While attuned to this weapon, your Strength score increases by 4, to a maximum of 24. You can use a bonus action to activate the Hydra's Might. For 1 minute, your melee weapon attacks deal an extra 1d8 bludgeoning damage, and you can use your reaction when a creature within 15 feet of you hits you with an attack to force the attacker to make a DC 18 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the attacker takes bludgeoning damage equal to your Strength modifier + your proficiency bonus. You can use Hydra's Might three times, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

column3: A weapon favored by Demacian champions, rumored to be blessed by the ancient kings, enhancing the wielder's capabilities.
column4: Provides balanced stats, empowering attacks with bonus damage, attack speed, and movement speed on hit.
column5: On a hit: roll 1d6. 1-2: +1 to hit; 3-4: +1 damage; 5-6: +10' movement. Effects last until the end of your next turn.
column7: This gleaming weapon pulses with arcane energy. You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
