Whenever you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, roll a d6. On a 1-2, your speed increases by 15 feet until the end of your turn. On a 3-4, you regain 1d6 hit points. On a 5-6, the target must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of your next turn. Once you use this property, you can’t use it again until the start of your next turn.

column3: The despair resonates with the Black Mist, amplifying the anguish of tormented spirits and spreading sorrow. Possibly linked to a powerful wraith.
column4: Deals magic damage in an area and heals the wearer for a portion of the damage dealt.
column5: Wearer emits a 10' aura of despair. Those within suffer -1 to morale. Upon striking a foe, heal 1d4 HP. Undead within the aura are strengthened.
column7: This artifact pulses with necrotic energy. When a creature within 30 feet of the artifact fails a saving throw, you can use your reaction to inflict one level of exhaustion on that creature. Additionally, undead creatures within 60 feet of the artifact have advantage on saving throws against being turned or frightened.

column3: Said to be forged from the sands of the void itself. The staff hums with an unknown energy.
column4: Grants magic penetration, increasing damage against enemies with magic resistance.
column5: Bypass magical wards and defenses as if they weren't there, channeling raw void energy to melt through enchantments. Save vs. Magic or be disintegrated.
column7: Staff, Very Rare (Requires Attunement by a Spellcaster). This staff crackles with eldritch power drawn from the void. While holding this staff, your spell attack rolls ignore resistance to necrotic damage. Additionally, once per day, you can cast the spell 'Blight' without expending a spell slot. When you cast 'Blight' in this way, its damage type becomes force.

column3: Said to be forged in the ice, it is associated with great strength and endurance, possibly linked to ancient frost giants or Ornn's forge.
column4: Passively grants health regeneration based on a percentage of maximum health and grants a large amount of health.
column5: Wearer gains +3 to saves versus exhaustion. If reduced to 0 hit points, heal 1d6 hp per round for the next 10 rounds. Must make a DC 15 CON save at the end, or gain one level of exhaustion.
column7: Armor (Plate), Legendary (Requires Attunement). While wearing this armor, your hit point maximum increases by 40. Additionally, at the start of each of your turns, you regain hit points equal to 5 + your Constitution modifier if you have at least 1 hit point. This regeneration does not function if you have taken fire or radiant damage since the end of your last turn.

column3: Said to be forged in Ionia, the blade whispers false promises and subtle doubts, eroding the will of its victims.
column4: On-hit magic damage and magic resist increase. At low health, further boosts magic resist.
column5: Blade whispers, victim SAVES vs. WIS or takes -1d4 to hit and damage. Gain +1 AC vs. magical attacks. If HP < 25%, AC bonus becomes +3.
column7: This Ionian blade whispers insidious suggestions. Any creature you hit with this weapon must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or have disadvantage on the next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw it makes before the end of its next turn.

column3: Favored by Ionian archers, rumored to be crafted with wood from the spirit realm, enhancing the wielder's connection to the land.
column4: Empowers ranged attacks with bonus damage and increased critical strike chance against distant targets.
column5: Ranged attacks deal +1d6 damage. On a critical hit, the target must Save vs. Magic or be rooted in place for 1 round. Usable by elves and humans.
column7: These arrows are crafted from wood rumored to be from the spirit realm. When you fire one of these arrows, you can speak a command word to imbue it with elemental energy (acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder). The arrow deals an extra 2d6 damage of the chosen type, and the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of your next turn.

column3: Forged in the icy heart of the Freljord, linked warriors enhance each other's power in battle. Often used by pairs of bloodsworn siblings.
column4: Grants Armor, Magic Resist, Ability Haste and Mana. Casting your ultimate empowers your ally, granting them on-hit damage and slows enemies.
column5: Bonds two warriors. When one casts a mighty spell, the other gains +1 to hit and deals +1d4 frost damage for 8 rounds. Foes struck are slowed (save vs. paralyze or 1 round penalty to initiative).
column7: While wearing this Freljordian armor, you can use a bonus action to forge a bond with one willing creature you can see within 30 feet. The bond lasts for 1 minute or until you are more than 30 feet apart. While bonded, whenever you hit a creature with an attack, the bonded creature gains temporary hit points equal to half the damage dealt. Additionally, the bonded creature's attacks deal an extra 1d6 cold damage.

column3: Bound to a chosen ally, granting mutual strength and protection. Represents a pact made with potentially dark consequences tied to the Shadow Isles.
column4: Binds you to an ally, granting effects based on proximity. Grants damage and survivability based on the oath.
column5: The spear binds the wielder to another; when near, both gain +1 to hit and damage. When the bound ally dies, the wielder must save vs. death or become a wraith.
column7: This spear magically binds to one willing creature, forming a symbiotic link. While bound, you and the chosen ally gain a +2 bonus to AC and saving throws as long as you are within 30 feet of each other. If either of you drops to 0 hit points, the other can choose to take the damage instead. However, severing the bond requires a Wish spell or similar magic, and the ally may suffer unforeseen consequences tied to the Shadow Isles, determined by the DM.

column3: Favored by the Buhru during Nagakabouros's rites. Some say prayers focused through it reach the Bearded Lady faster.
column4: Temporarily grants bonus attack range and attack speed after using an ability.
column5: Once per day, after casting a spell, the wielder's ranged attacks gain +1 to hit and +1 damage for the next round. Missed attacks curse the wielder for one round, causing -1 to hit.
column7: This ornate firearm grants advantage on Wisdom (Religion) checks made to beseech or understand Nagakabouros. Once per long rest, you can expend a spell slot of 1st level or higher while firing this weapon to send a prayer to the Bearded Lady. The prayer's effect is determined by the DM, but it might grant a blessing, advantage on a future roll, or a subtle nudge of fate.

column3: Mimics the appearance of a scarecrow. Could be linked to Fiddlesticks, a primal demon.
column4: Places a controllable hallucination that resembles you. If an enemy gets close, the hallucination vanishes.
column5: Appears as a perfect, immobile double. Upon contact, it vanishes in a puff of smoke; target must SAVE vs. WIS or believe the player still stands there for 1d4 turns.
column7: As an action, you can place this Small object on the ground. For the next hour, creatures within 30 feet have disadvantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks made to detect your lies or deceptions. Additionally, if Fiddlesticks is within 1 mile of the effigy, the effigy causes creatures within 30ft to make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

column3: Turrets were likely enchanted by mages during the Rune Wars, a last bastion of defense during sieges.
column4: Grants bonus armor and magic resistance to turrets while nearby allies are present.
column5: Turret becomes harder to hit with ranged attacks while allies stand near. Grants +2 AC versus ranged, only when allies are adjacent to the turret. If no allies are present, AC is reduced by 2.
column7: While wearing this armor, you gain a +2 bonus to AC against ranged attacks. Additionally, you have advantage on saving throws against being knocked prone by a ranged attack or effect. Finally, any critical hit against you from a ranged attack becomes a normal hit.

column3: Favored by winter hunters, enhancing their connection to the land and the hunt. Perhaps tied to a forgotten Ice Witch.
column4: Empowers movement speed and damage after using an ability.
column5: After casting a spell, gain +1 to hit and damage rolls for 1d4 rounds. Movement is doubled, but armor class is reduced by 2.
column7: While attuned to this item, you gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to track creatures in snowy or icy terrain. Additionally, as an action, you can cast the Hunter's Mark spell without expending a spell slot. Once you use this ability, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest. Finally, you gain resistance to cold damage.

column3: The Overcharged item pulses with raw magical energy, reminiscent of Ionian spirit magic and potentially linked to the First Lands' ley lines.
column4: Temporarily grants bonus movement speed and damage upon casting a spell.
column5: Once per day, after casting a spell, the wielder moves with unnatural swiftness (+3 to Movement) and their next attack deals +1d6 damage. However, there is a 1-in-6 chance of magical feedback (take 1d4 damage).
column7: While holding this item, you can use a bonus action to imbue your next attack or spell with volatile energy. If the attack hits or the spell affects a creature, the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take an additional 2d6 lightning damage and become stunned until the end of your next turn. Once you use this ability, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

column3: Likely forged by Demacian armorers, possibly enchanted by mageseekers for defensive fortifications around the kingdom.
column4: Greatly increases turret armor and magic resistance, reducing damage taken from champions.
column5: Turret gains +3 AC, +2 to saves vs. magic. Ranged attacks against it suffer -2 penalty. When HP is reduced to 0, it becomes inert rubble.
column7: While wearing this armor, you gain a +2 bonus to AC against ranged attacks. Additionally, any critical hit you suffer while wearing this armor becomes a normal hit.

column3: Potentially developed by Demacian artificers to bolster their war efforts against foreign mechanized threats or the Black Rose.
column4: Grants a shield when taking damage below a health threshold; also grants size and damage.
column5: Once per day, when reduced to 5 hit points or less, gain 3d6 temporary hit points. In addition, the wielder's size increases by one category, and melee attacks deal +1d4 damage for 1 round.
column7: You can use an action to activate this device, creating a 30-foot radius sphere of shimmering energy centered on you. For 1 minute, or until you use an action to end it, you and any allies within the sphere gain a +4 bonus to AC and saving throws against effects that would move or knock them prone. Once used, this device cannot be activated again until the next dawn.

column3: Said to be woven from captured starlight, favored by Lunari mystics seeking solace from the sun's glare.
column4: Grants magic resistance and reduces damage from area-of-effect abilities.
column5: Advantage on saves vs. radiant damage and spells that affect an area. Wearer is immune to mundane blindness, but suffers disadvantage in direct sunlight.
column7: While wearing this cloak, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and effects that deal radiant damage. Additionally, once per long rest, you can cast the Darkness spell (requiring no components) centered on yourself; while this darkness persists, you can see through it as if it were dim light.

column3: Favored by Noxian gladiators, Cruelty is often seen in the arena, and is associated with might makes right.
column4: Deals bonus damage based on enemy health and grants bonus movement speed.
column5: On a hit, deal +1d6 damage per HD of the target. If the target is slain, gain +1 to movement until the end of the encounter.
column7: This weapon grants advantage on attack rolls against creatures that are frightened. In addition, whenever you score a critical hit with this weapon, the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of its next turn.

column3: Favored by Noxian arena fighters, this weapon is said to bring swift ends to even the most formidable foes. For the glory of Noxus!
column4: Deals bonus damage to low-health targets, ensuring a quick kill and preventing escapes.
column5: On hit, a creature with less than 2 HD must save vs. Death Ray or be instantly slain. Otherwise, deals +1d4 damage.
column7: This magical greatsword scores a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20. When you score a critical hit with this weapon, the target must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or have their maximum hit points reduced by an amount equal to the damage dealt. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The greatsword deals an additional 2d6 slashing damage to any target that has less than half of its maximum hit points.

column3: Whispers claim it's linked to a forgotten Shadow Isles ritual, binding a spirit's essence to objects.
column4: Deals magic damage over time and grants bonus armor and magic resist.
column5: Curse a foe's body and soul with burning agony (1d4 damage per round, save vs. spell each round). Gain +1 AC and +1 to saves vs. magic.
column7: While holding this item, you gain resistance to necrotic damage and your Constitution score increases by 2, to a maximum of 22. As a bonus action, you can unleash a shadowy tendril to strike a creature within 30 feet of you. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 3d6 necrotic damage and become poisoned until the end of your next turn. You can use this bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

column3: Favored weapon of a forgotten ice tribe, tipped with a diamond formed under immense glacial pressure. Used to pierce the hearts of mammoths and gods alike.
column4: +80 Attack Damage, +10% Critical Strike Chance, Unique Passive: Empowered attacks deal bonus damage and slow enemies.
column5: On a successful hit, roll a d6. On a 5-6, the target must save vs. paralysis or be slowed (move at half speed) for 1 round. Against creatures of ice, the spear deals double damage.
column7: This spear is a magic weapon that grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls. When you hit a creature with this spear, the diamond tip deals an extra 2d6 piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

column3: Forged in the heart of a celestial dragon, Dragonheart is imbued with cosmic fire, resonating with the Solari faith atop Mount Targon.
column4: Grants health regeneration and armor, empowering the wearer with draconic resilience in battle.
column5: Wearer gains +2 to AC. When damaged, roll 1d6. On a 6, exhale a cone of fire (1d6 damage, save for half) once per day.
column7: This amulet is a holy (or unholy, depending on the celestial dragon) symbol and requires attunement. While attuned, you have resistance to fire damage and your spells that deal fire damage deal an additional 1d8 fire damage. As an action, you can expend 3 charges to unleash a wave of celestial fire in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 6d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This item has 7 charges and regains 1d6+1 expended charges daily at dawn.

column3: Potentially named after a renowned Demacian healer or saint, it symbolizes resilience and recovery against overwhelming odds.
column4: Grants health, mana regeneration, and reduces crowd control duration.
column5: Wearer heals 1d6 hp per turn and recovers from paralyzation, if save is made. Charm attempts suffer -2 penalty against wearer.
column7: This amulet is a holy symbol and requires attunement. While attuned, as a bonus action you may touch a creature and expend a hit die plus your Wisdom modifier to heal them, and they are cured of one disease or condition from the following list: blinded, deafened, paralyzed, or poisoned. The number of hit points restored is equal to the number rolled plus your Wisdom modifier (minimum of one hit point). Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until the start of your next turn. This amulet has 3 charges, and it regains all expended charges daily at dawn. Additionally, once per long rest, when you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can expend a charge to instead drop to 1 hit point.

column3: Potentially created by a Freljordian Ice Witch. Grants slowing and immobilizing effects, resembling Lissandra's magic.
column4: Deals damage in a cone, slowing enemies. Immobilizes enemies in the center.
column5: Cone of frost deals 3d6 cold damage, slowing (Save vs. magic to negate). Center target must Save vs. magic or be held fast, paralyzed by ice for 1d4 rounds.
column7: This staff, potentially crafted by a Freljordian Ice Witch, allows you to cast the spell *Hold Person* once per day. Additionally, as an action, you can cause a 20-foot cone of freezing air to emanate from the staff. Creatures in the cone must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have their speed reduced by half until the end of their next turn. On a failed save, creatures also take 2d6 cold damage.

column3: Forged in the heart of Noxus, the Force of Entropy embodies the empire's relentless pursuit of power, twisting magic to dominate foes.
column4: Deals bonus damage and grants movement speed when hitting enemy champions.
column5: On a hit, touch infuses the target with entropy. Save vs. Death or take 1d6 damage and move last next round. On subsequent hits, the entropy spreads, affecting another target.
column7: This weapon, forged in the heart of Noxus, pulses with dark energy. Once per day, when you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, you can choose to inflict an additional 4d6 necrotic damage. If you do so, the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have disadvantage on Strength and Dexterity ability checks and saving throws until the end of their next turn.

column3: The Galeforce is rumored to be crafted by ancient Ionian windspeakers, channeling storms into a single, deadly gust.
column4: Active: Dash a short distance and fire projectiles at the nearest enemy.
column5: Whistle and a roaring wind propels you. Save versus Wind or be blown 2d6 * 10' in a random direction. Attack at +4 after, dealing 1d6 wind damage.
column7: This light crossbow, rumored to be crafted by ancient Ionian windspeakers, allows you to cast the spell *Gust of Wind* as a bonus action. The spell save DC for this effect is 15. Once per day, as an action, you can also unleash a powerful gust of wind that allows you to teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

column3: Forged in Demacia, rumored to be infused with petricite, enhancing the wearer's resilience. Used by sentinels during the Ruination.
column4: Increases armor and magic resist. Activate to gain a large shield, increased by nearby enemies.
column5: Wearer gains +2 to AC, but suffers -1 on DEX saves. Once per day, can turn to stone for 1d4 rounds, gaining +8 AC and advantage on STR checks.
column7: While wearing this armor, you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons. As an action, you can fortify the Stoneplate, granting you temporary hit points equal to your level. While fortified, your speed is halved, and you have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws. This effect lasts for 1 minute or until you are reduced to 0 hit points. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

column3: Crafted by a forgotten Noxian hemomancer, it amplifies blood magic. Linked to dark pacts made in the empire's early days.
column4: Grants bonus health and ability haste, amplifying healing and damage based on missing health.
column5: Wearer gains +2 to hit when bleeding, +4 if the target is also suffering blood loss. All blood magic spells gain +1 to cast.
column7: While wearing this helm, whenever you cast a spell that deals necrotic damage, you regain hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt. In addition, as a bonus action, you can expend one Hit Die to regain hit points equal to the number rolled + your Constitution modifier. You can't use this bonus action if you have 0 hit points. Once you use this bonus action, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

column3: Forged with celestial energies, rumored to resonate with the aspects of Targon, offering vitality and strength to its wielder.
column4: Grants ability haste, magic resist, and health, while also reducing ultimate cooldown.
column5: Wearer gains +2 to saves vs. magic. Once per day, wearer may re-roll any saving throw, accepting the second result. Grants advantage when resisting exhaustion.
column7: While wearing this locket, you gain a +2 bonus to Strength and Constitution saving throws. Additionally, as a reaction when you or an ally within 30 feet is reduced to 0 hit points, you can expend a Hit Die. Roll the die and add your Wisdom modifier to the result. The target regains hit points equal to the total. You can't use this reaction if you have 0 hit points. Once you use this reaction, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

column3: Whispers say Volibear's followers craft these rods, believing they channel the storm's fury. Some bear faint claw marks.
column4: Periodically emits chain lightning, damaging nearby enemies.
column5: Creatures struck by the rod's lightning must SAVE vs. Magic or be stunned for 1 round. Rod discharges 3 times/day. User vulnerable to lightning.
column7: While holding this rod, you have advantage on saving throws against lightning damage. Once per day, when you are hit by a lightning attack, you can use your reaction to absorb the lightning. For the next minute, your melee weapon attacks deal an extra 1d6 lightning damage. Some rods bear faint claw marks, indicating a possible connection to Volibear.

column3: Associated with the Lunari of Targon, harnessing lunar magic. Could be connected to champions like Diana or Aphelios.
column4: Provides magic resist and ability haste. Grants bonus movement speed after dealing spell damage.
column5: Confers Advantage on saves vs. magical effects. Once per dawn, user may move at double speed for one turn after casting a spell.
column7: This blade hums with lunar energy. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. While attuned to this weapon, you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. Once per long rest, as a bonus action, you can invoke the lunar power, causing the blade to shed bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. While lit this way, the next attack you make before the end of your turn deals an extra 3d6 radiant damage. This weapon is strongly associated with the Lunari of Targon.

column3: Favored by Noxian assassins, Prowler's Claw is linked to swift, brutal ambushes, embodying Noxus's aggressive military doctrine.
column4: Dashes through enemies, dealing damage and increasing damage dealt for a short duration after the dash.
column5: Grants the wearer one use of Dimension Door, but only to attack. After teleporting, the next attack deals +2 damage for 1d4 rounds.
column7: This wicked claw grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. As a bonus action, you can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. If you teleport behind a creature and make a melee attack against it on the same turn, that attack has advantage and deals an extra 2d6 piercing damage, favored by Noxian assassins for swift and brutal ambushes.

column3: Forged in the heart of the Immortal Bastion, rumored to be imbued with a fragment of a long-dead fire mage's soul.
column4: Deals magic damage to nearby enemies every second, increased damage to minions and monsters.
column5: Creatures within 10' take 1d6 fire damage each round. Undead take double damage. Cloth and paper ignite instantly. Save versus fire or be set aflame for 1d4 rounds.
column7: While wearing this cloak, you have resistance to fire damage. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can unleash a wave of heat. Each creature within 15 feet of you must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 3d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. You can use this bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

column3: Forged with celestial energies, it echoes the will of the Aspects, reshaping the world around the wielder. Associated with mountain forges.
column4: Deals bonus damage based on the target's current health and shreds armor.
column5: Upon striking a foe, roll a d6. On a 6, permanently reduce their armor by 1. If armor reaches 0, the next attack deals double damage. Represents Celestial judgment.
column7: This maul hums with celestial energy. As an action, you can strike the ground, creating a localized distortion in reality. Each creature within a 20-foot radius must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or be teleported to a random location within 60 feet of you. The destination is determined by the DM. Additionally, the ground in the area becomes difficult terrain for 1 minute. Once used, this property cannot be used again until the next dawn.

column3: A blade forged in the heart of Noxus, whispering promises of power to those who dare to seize the throne. Associated with Darius.
column4: Gain bonus damage and movement speed after killing an enemy champion. Killing the champion with the highest killstreak grants additional bonuses.
column5: Upon slaying a foe, gain +1 to hit and damage rolls for 1d4 turns. Slaying a 'king' (highest level creature) grants permanent +1 to charisma and advantage on saves vs. fear.
column7: This +2 greatsword deals an additional 2d6 necrotic damage to any creature with the title of 'King', 'Queen', 'Emperor', or similar sovereign rank. If the wielder reduces a creature with such a title to 0 hit points with this weapon, the wielder gains advantage on all attack rolls and saving throws for the next minute. This advantage ends early if the wielder attacks a creature other than the next highest-ranking individual present.

column3: Ancient Freljordian magic, possibly tied to the Iceborn or forgotten rune mages, is imbued within the Runecarver's enchantments.
column4: Empowers basic attacks with bonus damage and slows enemies. Periodically grants a shield after casting an ability.
column5: Weapon deals +1d4 frost damage, slowing targets (Save vs. Paralysis). After casting a spell, gain 3 temp HP (1 round duration).
column7: Weapon (any axe), very rare (requires attunement). This axe scores a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20. When you score a critical hit with this weapon, the target takes an extra 2d6 cold damage and must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be restrained until the end of your next turn.

column3: Forged in the heart of Mount Targon, rumored to have been touched by the fire of a fallen Aspect.
column4: Provides health, armor, and a damage aura to nearby allies, while reducing damage taken.
column5: Wearer becomes a beacon of resilience. Allies within 30' gain +1 AC and +1 on saves vs. fear. Incoming attacks are slightly less effective on the wearer.
column7: Armor (shield), very rare (requires attunement). While holding this shield, you have resistance to fire damage. As a reaction when you are hit by a melee attack, you can cause the attacker to take 2d6 fire damage. The shield has 3 charges and regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

column3: Favored by those ascending Mount Targon, it is said to bear the protective blessings of the celestial peak, aiding pilgrims in their journey.
column4: Grants movement speed, health regeneration, and cooldown reduction to nearby allies when activated.
column5: Once per day, grants +1 to AC to the party within 30ft for 1d4 rounds. The talismanbearer must make a DC 13 Wisdom save or be compelled to move towards the nearest high peak.
column7: Wondrous item, very rare (requires attunement). While wearing this talisman, you have advantage on saving throws against exhaustion and the effects of extreme altitude. Additionally, once per day, when you fail a saving throw, you can choose to succeed instead.

column3: Favored by Noxian assassins, this blade channels twilight magic, granting temporary invisibility and armor penetration, aiding in covert operations.
column4: Grants invisibility after using a dash or blink. The next attack deals bonus damage and reduces armor.
column5: Upon command word, user vanishes into shadows for 1 round. First attack from shadows deals +1d6 damage and reduces target AC by 2 for 1 round.
column7: This Noxian blade hums with twilight magic. As a bonus action, you can expend 1 charge to become invisible until the end of your next turn. Additionally, attacks made with this weapon ignore resistance to piercing and slashing damage. This weapon has 3 charges and regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dusk.

column3: Favored by assassins in the Leblanc's Black Rose cabal, this blade whispers secrets of shadow magic and swift strikes.
column4: Grants lethality and movement speed, enhancing burst damage and mobility for assassins.
column5: On a hit, target saves vs. Death at -2 or age 1d4 years. Grants +2 to Surprise checks. On a miss, user is briefly visible to ethereal beings.
column7: This blade whispers secrets of shadow magic. While attuned to this weapon, you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. Additionally, once per short rest, when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can expend a Hit Die to deal extra necrotic damage equal to the result. The target must also succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have disadvantage on the next saving throw they make before the end of their next turn.

column3: Forged atop Mount Targon, imbued with celestial magic. Grants power to those who channel the stars, favored by the Aspect of Magic.
column4: Grants bonus ability power, mana regeneration, and cooldown reduction. Empowers spells with celestial energy.
column5: As a reaction, discharge a surge of celestial energy. Foes within 30' take 1d6 force damage per caster level; save for half. On a natural 1, the caster is stunned for 1 round.
column7: Forged atop Mount Targon, this item pulses with celestial magic. While holding this item, your spell save DC increases by 2. Additionally, once per long rest, when you cast a spell that deals radiant damage, you can maximize the damage dice of that spell.

column3: Favored by ascetics seeking enlightenment, some say the items whisper guidance from beyond the stars, a gift from the celestial Aspect.
column4: Provides gold and vision, enhancing support abilities and granting wards.
column5: Confers +1 to Wisdom saves. Once per day, cast 'light'. Sacrifice a point of HP to see through the eyes of a distant creature, as per the 'clairvoyance' spell.
column7: While holding this item, you gain advantage on Wisdom saving throws. Additionally, once per long rest, when an ally within 30 feet of you fails a saving throw, you can choose to have them succeed instead. The item then cannot be used again until you finish a long rest.

column3: Forged in the heart of Mount Targon, imbuing the wielder with celestial power and the might of the Aspects.
column4: Grants bonus stats and an additional unique effect based on the equipped champion.
column5: Upon attunement, roll a d6: 1-3 bestows a boon, 4-6 inflicts a curse. Boons are potent, curses dire. Cannot be removed except by a wish.
column7: While attuned to this item, you gain resistance to one damage type of your choice. As an action, you can change the damage type. In addition, once per day, you can cast a spell of 5th level or lower without expending a spell slot. The spell must be from the cleric or paladin spell list.

column3: Forged in Noxus, these chains may bind even the mightiest foe, turning their own strength against them, a tool for assassins and duelists.
column4: Designate a nemesis to take reduced damage from and deal less damage to your allies.
column5: Curse a creature. They deal -1d4 on attack rolls against the party, and all damage they inflict on the wielder is halved. Save versus spell each dawn to break the chains.
column7: As an action, you can target one creature you can see within 30 feet and attempt to bind them with these spectral chains. The target must succeed on a DC 18 Strength saving throw or be restrained. While restrained in this way, the target has vulnerability to all damage dealt by you. At the end of each of its turns, the target can repeat the saving throw, freeing itself on a success. The chains dissipate if you are ever more than 60 feet away from the target or if you are incapacitated.

column3: Associated with Demacian military, possibly named after a revered general or hero known for resilience and tactical prowess.
column4: Grants attack damage based on a percentage of maximum health, and armor.
column5: Wearer gains +1 to hit for every 10 hit points, and are considered AC 3 vs bludgeoning attacks. Upon dropping to 0 hp or below the wielder may chose to take a level of exhaustion to stay at 1 hp.
column7: This legendary greatsword, once wielded by a celebrated Demacian general, grants its wielder unparalleled resilience. While wielding Atma's Reckoning, you gain a +3 bonus to AC. Additionally, whenever you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can choose to drop to 1 hit point instead. If you do so, the sword absorbs the remaining damage, gaining a cumulative +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls for each 10 points of damage absorbed in this way, up to a maximum of +5. These bonuses last for 1 minute.

column3: Harrowing relics from the Shadow Isles. Grants the wearer the ability to hunt souls.
column4: Provides movement speed and bonus damage when near enemy champions.
column5: Wearer moves at +50% speed toward undead. Deal +1d6 damage to corporeal undead, but suffer -1 on saves vs. incorporeal undead.
column7: These spectral boots, crafted from the essence of tormented souls on the Shadow Isles, allow the wearer to tread where the veil between worlds is thin. While wearing Ghostcrawlers, you can cast the Etherealness spell once per long rest. Additionally, you gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to track undead creatures and deal an extra 2d6 necrotic damage to undead with your weapon attacks.

column3: Favored by novice assassins in Noxus. Its dark steel may originate from a mine near the Immortal Bastion, known for imbuing weapons with lethal sharpness.
column4: Grants lethality and attack damage. Passively grants bonus movement speed when out of combat.
column5: Wearer gains +1 to hit and damage rolls against unaware foes. Move silently as a thief 7/10 in wild zones.
column7: This dark steel dagger, a common tool among Noxian assassins, whispers promises of swift and silent demise. You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls made while hidden. If you hit a creature that is surprised with this dagger, the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, the target is also paralyzed.

column3: Forged in the heart of Noxus, rumored to have been used in dark rituals within the Immortal Bastion. Possibly tied to demonic pacts.
column4: Increases magic damage and provides bonus health regeneration based on mana spent.
column5: User's spells become infused with hellfire (1d6 fire damage). Spending mana heals 1hp, but risks demonic attention (GM roll on excessive use).
column7: This wicked-looking handaxe radiates a palpable heat. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, when you hit a creature with this hatchet, it takes an extra 1d6 fire damage. If the target is a creature of good alignment, it takes an extra 2d6 fire damage instead. Once per day, you can speak the hatchet's command word to cause flames to erupt from the blade. For the next minute, any creature that touches the blade or is hit by it takes an additional 1d4 fire damage at the start of each of its turns. This effect ends early if you sheath or drop the hatchet.

column3: Associated with Ionian monks seeking enlightenment through heightened reflexes and spiritual clarity. Legends say it enhances connection with the spirit realm.
column4: Grants temporary increased movement speed and attack speed.
column5: Drink and for 1d4 rounds, double movement. Roll a d6. On a 1, the character is confused, believing they are fighting an old enemy.
column7: When you drink this shimmering, ethereal juice, you gain the benefits of the Haste spell for 1 minute (no concentration required). In addition, your Wisdom score increases by 2 for the duration. This increase can exceed your normal maximum. Once the effect ends, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of exhaustion.

column3: Likely brewed by Ionian monks seeking enlightenment, or perhaps a product of the Spirit Blossom festival's magic.
column4: Restores a small amount of health and mana over a short duration.
column5: Drink and recover 1d4 hit points and 1d4 mana (or equivalent) over the next turn. There is a 1 in 6 chance of vivid hallucinations for 1d3 turns thereafter.
column7: When you drink this vibrant, life-infused juice, you regain 4d4 + 4 hit points. For the next hour, you have advantage on Constitution saving throws. In addition, if you are reduced to 0 hit points within the next hour, you immediately regain 1 hit point instead, unless you die outright.

column3: Whispers say it's tied to a forgotten Ionian spirit, capable of disrupting the minds of even the most disciplined monks.
column4: Reduces the target's magic resistance and movement speed for a short duration.
column5: Creature suffers -2 to saves vs. mind-affecting spells and moves at half speed for 1d4 rounds. Save vs. Spells negates movement penalty.
column7: While holding this rod, you can use a bonus action to target one creature within 30 feet. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or become bewildered. While bewildered, the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws, and another creature has advantage on attack rolls against it. At the end of each of its turns, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to this rod's effect for the next 24 hours.

column3: Forged in the Shadow Isles, it whispers promises of power and oblivion, corrupting the wielder's soul.
column4: Grants lifesteal and an active ability that slows enemies and steals their movement speed.
column5: Wielder heals HP equal to damage dealt by melee attacks. Once per day, target must SAVE vs. Death or suffer -2 to movement for 1d4 rounds. If the SAVE is failed, wielder gains +2 movement for the same duration.
column7: This shadowy scimitar deals an extra 1d8 necrotic damage on a hit. When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this weapon, you gain temporary hit points equal to the creature's Constitution modifier (minimum of 1). These temporary hit points last for 1 hour. However, each time you gain temporary hit points from this weapon, you must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or gain one level of exhaustion.

column3: Crafted by a forgotten Ionian order, it resonates with the Spirit Blossom Festival, amplifying spiritual connections and ancestral echoes.
column4: Heals allies and empowers attacks after casting your ultimate.
column5: Upon uttering a prayer with this sword, restore 1d6 hit points to the nearest ally. For the next round, your attacks deal +1 damage and spirits whisper warnings, granting +1 to AC.
column7: This longsword deals an extra 1d6 radiant damage to undead and fiends. While attuned to this weapon, you can cast the 'speak with dead' spell once per day without using a spell slot. Additionally, you have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks when interacting with spirits or creatures from the Feywild.

column3: Favored by Ionian mages, rumored to enhance natural magic. Some believe it once belonged to a powerful spirit.
column4: Grants Ability Power. Upon taking fatal damage, become untargetable and invulnerable for a short duration.
column5: Wearer gains +3 to magic damage rolls. Once per day, when reduced to 0 hp, become ethereal for 1d4 rounds; attacks pass through, but wearer cannot act.
column7: While wearing this hat, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DC. Additionally, once per day, when you cast a spell of 3rd level or lower, you can cast it as if using a spell slot one level higher.

column3: Said to resonate with the raw magic of the Freljord, amplifying the wielder's power and weakening magical defenses.
column4: Grants magic resist and reduces magic resist of nearby enemies.
column5: Creatures within 20' suffer -2 to saves versus magic. Wielder gains +2 to saves versus magic, negating magic missiles outright on a successful save. A palpable hum emanates when near the magically sensitive.
column7: This scepter has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more charges to create a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you can see within 60 feet. Each creature in that area has disadvantage on saving throws against spells you cast. This effect lasts for 1 minute or until you lose concentration (as if concentrating on a spell). The DC to maintain concentration is 10, and for each charge you maintain concentration beyond the first round, the DC increases by 2. The scepter regains 1d6+1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the scepter crumbles into dust and is destroyed.

column3: Symbol of the Dauntless Vanguard, it bolsters nearby allies. Bearer is emboldened by a golden glow and gains unnatural resilience.
column4: Nearby allies gain magic resist and armor. Grants the user bonus armor, magic resist, and ability haste.
column5: Confers +1 to saves vs. spells and +1 AC to self and allies within 30'. Upon a critical failure, the Aegis shatters, losing its magical properties.
column7: While holding this shield, you and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws. This bonus increases to +2 at level 10 and +3 at level 15. Additionally, as a reaction when a friendly creature within 30 feet of you is hit by an attack, you can grant that creature resistance to the damage dealt by the attack. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

column3: Likely originated in Shurima, where currency was tied to celestial favor and desert survival.
column4: Periodically grants gold and mana upon nearby enemy minion death.
column5: Upon receiving this coin, roll a d6. On a 1, attract unwanted spirits. On a 6, gain advantage on a future saving throw against starvation or thirst.
column7: This coin, likely originating from Shurima, feels warm to the touch and depicts imagery of the sun and desert. As an action, you can flip the coin. On a heads, for the next minute, you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. On a tails, you can summon enough water to fill a single waterskin. Once the coin is flipped, it cannot be flipped again until the next dawn.

column3: The Arcane Helix hums with Ionian spirit magic, resonating with the land's ancient energies and possibly influencing spirit blossom festivals.
column4: Periodically empowers the next attack, dealing bonus magic damage and healing the user.
column5: Heal 1d4 hp and deal 1d4 arcane damage on a successful melee attack. Must recharge for 1 turn after use, leaving you vulnerable.
column7: This intricate helix pulses with arcane energy, resonating with the wild magic of the Feywild. While holding the helix, you gain advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks related to the Feywild or spirits. As an action, you can expend 1 charge to cast the 'faerie fire' spell (save DC 15). The helix has 3 charges and regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

column3: Favored by Ionian monks seeking enlightenment, the staff amplifies inner energies. It is rumored to resonate with the spirit realm.
column4: Grants mana, ability power, and mana regeneration, converting mana into additional ability power.
column5: The wielder's spells are louder and brighter. Failed spellcasting risks summoning an imp from the outer planes. Spending mana risks a point of fatigue.
column7: This staff, crafted from a light, resonant wood, seems to hum with spiritual energy. While holding this staff, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DCs. Additionally, once per long rest, when you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you can regain a number of hit points equal to the spell's level.

column3: Said to be blessed by the celestial Aspect of Magic, granting its wielder immense magical power and spiritual insight.
column4: Grants mana regen, AP, and MR. Provides bonus healing/shielding based on damage dealt.
column5: Wielder gains +2 to WIS saves vs. enchantment. Healing spells also grant a shield equal to damage dealt, but makes the wielder vulnerable to psychic attack if the target is evil.
column7: While holding this unholy grail, you gain a +3 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DC. Additionally, when you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that restores hit points to a creature, you regain a number of hit points equal to half the spell's level + your spellcasting ability modifier.

column3: Associated with the Black Rose, granting its user immense power, but at a terrible cost. Could be related to forbidden hemomancy rituals.
column4: Increases ability power and grants bonus damage to low-health enemies, amplifying kill potential.
column5: On a hit, if the target has less than 2 HD, they must save versus death or die. The wielder loses 1 max HP permanently after each usage.
column7: When you cast a necromancy spell of 1st level or higher, roll a d6. On a 1, you take necrotic damage equal to the spell's level. Otherwise, the spell's damage or healing is increased by 2 for each of its dice and the range of the spell is doubled. This augment functions once per long rest.

column3: Potentially created by a forgotten aspect of Targon, granting immense arcane power. It's linked to celestial beings enhancing mortals.
column4: Abilities deal bonus damage. Grants Ability Power on champion level up. Provides bonus magic damage.
column5: Grants the user temporary access to the celestial realm. 1-in-6 chance of attracting the attention of a powerful entity, resulting in a boon or a curse.
column7: This celestial augment grants you advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks. As an action, you can expend a spell slot to gain a number of arcane power dice (d4s) equal to the spell slot's level +1. For the next minute, once per turn, you can add one of these dice to an attack roll, saving throw, or ability check. Any unused dice are lost when the minute ends.

column3: Associated with Ionian monasteries, used for meditation and healing rituals. Perhaps a connection to the Kinkou Order or the Wuju Style.
column4: Restores a small amount of health and mana over time. Grants temporary bonus to magic resistance.
column5: Drink: Restore 1d4 hit points and 1d4 mana points. Advantage on saves vs. enchantment spells for 1 turn. Tea leaves can be used to detect poison in food/drink (6 in 6 chance).
column7: This bag contains rare Ionian tea leaves, imbued with subtle healing properties. As an action, you can brew a cup of tea and drink it. Doing so restores 2d4 hit points and grants advantage on Wisdom saving throws for 1 hour. The bag contains enough tea for 5 uses.

column3: A common sidearm in Bilgewater, often enchanted for extra punch. Used by bounty hunters and gang members alike.
column4: Deals damage and slows a target champion. Grants some lifesteal on hit.
column5: On a hit, target must make a DC 13 Fortitude save or be slowed for 1 round. User heals 1d4 hit points when dealing damage with the blade.
column7: This cutlass, common in Bilgewater, is a magic weapon that grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can expend one of its charges to deal an extra 2d6 necrotic damage. The cutlass has 3 charges and regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

column3: Favored by Ionian monks and assassins, the Blink Dagger is rumored to be crafted with magic allowing for short-range teleportation.
column4: Instantly blink a short distance. Cannot be used for a few seconds after taking damage.
column5: Upon command, user vanishes and reappears up to 30' away. A strong blow disrupts the magic; user must SAVE vs. Spells or ability fails and renders them stunned for 1 round.
column7: As an action, you can activate this dagger to teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. The dagger can be used in this way three times, and regains all expended uses at dawn. If you are wearing light or no armor, the range of the teleport increases to 60 feet.

column3: Forged in Noxus, rumored to contain blood magic, grants the wielder a shield based on damage dealt; possibly connected to Vladimir.
column4: Grants a shield based on damage dealt to enemy champions. Provides attack damage and lifesteal.
column5: Upon striking a foe, gain temporary HP. This HP vanishes quickly. Save vs. Death when HP is reduced to 0, gain a lesser effect instead.
column7: While holding this shield, you gain a +2 bonus to AC. Whenever you deal damage to a creature with a melee attack, you gain temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt, up to a maximum of 15. These temporary hit points last for 1 minute. Once the shield grants temporary hit points, it can't do so again until the next dawn.

column3: Favored by assassins. The necklace is rumored to contain the souls of those Rengar has hunted. Thus, it's influence waxes and wanes with each kill.
column4: Grants bonus attack damage and movement speed upon takedowns. Upgrades with more kills.
column5: Confers +1 to hit and damage rolls against creatures of the slain type. Further, wearer adds +1 to speed factor for each kill. However, should the wearer be slain, their soul is forfeit.
column7: This necklace has 3 charges and regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn. When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with an attack, you can expend 1 charge to gain one of the following benefits: Advantage on your next attack roll against a creature, Resistance to one damage type until the end of your next turn, or increase your speed by 10 feet until the end of your next turn.

column3: Simple footwear, common across Runeterra. But in Ionia, some believe even the road you walk shapes your destiny.
column4: Slightly increased movement speed.
column5: Wearer's base movement is increased by 20'. Decrease encounter distance by 1d4 x 10' due to increased travel speed. Save vs. surprise on even-numbered turns.
column7: While wearing these boots, your walking speed increases by 5 feet. Additionally, you have advantage on Dexterity saving throws against effects that would reduce your speed.

column3: Likely crafted by a Hemomancer in Noxus, perhaps to sustain their power in combat, or to drain power from the enemies in order to grant it to its wielder.
column4: Damaging champions heals you. Healing is increased based on missing health. Grants attack damage and ability haste.
column5: On a successful hit, recover 1d4 hit points. If below half hit points, recover 1d6 instead. The wielder gains +2 on attack rolls and initiative.
column7: Weapon (any), very rare (requires attunement). While wielding this weapon, you can use a bonus action to target one creature within 30 feet. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take 2d6 necrotic damage, and you regain hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

column3: Forged on Targon, it is said to protect against celestial wrath, favored by the Solari for its protective properties.
column4: Grants health, armor, magic resist, and damage reduction for nearby allies upon taking damage.
column5: Wearer gains +3 to AC. When struck, allies within 10' gain +1 AC against the same attack type until the end of their next turn. Mountain's wrath lingers!
column7: Shield, very rare (requires attunement). While holding this shield, you have resistance to radiant damage and your AC increases by 2. As a reaction when you or a creature within 30 feet of you is targeted by a spell or effect that deals radiant damage, you can grant advantage on the saving throw against that effect.

column3: Favored by ambitious captains, this trinket whispers promises of swift voyages and plunder from distant shores.
column4: Increases movement speed out of combat. Grants temporary movement speed boost when near turrets.
column5: Wearer moves swiftly when not threatened. Nearby friendly structures hasten the wearer's advance for one turn, but cannot move in the subsequent round.
column7: Wondrous item, rare (requires attunement). While attuned to this trinket, you have advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to navigate at sea. Additionally, you can cast the spell 'Control Water' once per day. When you cast Control Water using this item, you can only choose to create a whirlpool or part the sea. You regain the ability to cast Control Water in this way at dawn.

column3: Associated with the Crimson Circle, a secret society within Noxus known for their hemomancy and blood rituals.
column4: Provides omnivamp and bonus attack damage that scales with missing health.
column5: Wearer gains HP on a hit; below 50% HP, deal +1d6 damage. On a critical hit, regain 1d4 lost HP. But at 0 HP, you must continue to feed the item!
column7: While attuned to this weapon, whenever you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with it, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level. Additionally, you can cast the *Vampiric Touch* spell at 3rd level once per long rest without requiring material components. The weapon deals an extra 1d6 necrotic damage on a hit if you are below half your maximum hit points.

column3: Crafted by Ionian monks seeking inner peace, it's rumored to be associated with the spirit realm and moments of perfect clarity.
column4: Grants temporary immunity to crowd control effects and reduces incoming damage for a short duration.
column5: Negates all incoming hostile magic. The wielder is filled with unnatural speed as if blessed by the wind spirit. If wearing heavy armor, the next round's speed stat is treated as if unarmored.
column7: This item grants advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks and Intelligence (Investigation) checks. Once per long rest, as an action, you can enter a meditative state for 1 minute. During this time, you gain truesight out to a range of 30 feet and resistance to psychic damage. Maintaining this state requires concentration, as if concentrating on a spell.

column3: Forged atop Mount Targon, it resonates with celestial energies, offering solace and balance to its wielder, reminiscent of the Aspect of Harmony.
column4: Restores mana based on health spent, providing sustain in lane.
column5: Grants advantage on saves vs. magical effects. Once per day, regain 1d6 lost hit points per level if your hit points are below half.
column7: While holding this chalice, you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. As an action, you can pour liquid into the chalice and imbue it with celestial energy. The next creature to drink the liquid gains the benefit of a *Greater Restoration* spell. Once used, this property of the chalice cannot be used again until the next dawn.

column3: Forged in the heart of Noxus, rumored to be quenched in the blood of conquered foes, it imbues its wearer with burning strength.
column4: Immolate aura burns nearby enemies; bonus health and increased size. Damage scales with bonus health.
column5: Creatures striking the wearer take 1d4 fire damage. +1 to saves vs. cold. The wearer counts as one size larger for grappling and intimidation.
column7: While wearing this armor, you have resistance to fire damage. As an action, you can unleash a wave of heat in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 4d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until the next dawn.

column3: Whispers say a master Ionian shadow dancer crafted these. Some link it to the conflicts surrounding the Kinkou Order.
column4: Grants bonus attack damage and movement speed after dealing damage, enhancing burst potential and mobility.
column5: Wearer gains +1 to Surprise. On successful attack, move unseen to any location within line of sight, leaving no trace. If the attack misses, user is revealed.
column7: While wearing the cloak, you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made in dim light or darkness. The dagger is a +1 weapon. As a bonus action, you can teleport to an unoccupied space within 30 feet, leaving behind a shadowy image of yourself that lasts until the start of your next turn. Once you use this ability, you cannot do so again until you complete a short or long rest.

column3: Favored by Noxian assassins and those who delve into forbidden alchemy, it grants the drinker a temporary edge at a terrible price.
column4: Consuming this potion grants health and mana over time and adds bonus damage to attacks and spells.
column5: Upon drinking, roll a d6. On a 1, gain a point of corruption. At 6 corruption, character becomes an NPC under DM control. Grants +2 to attack rolls for 1d4 turns, regain 1d8 lost HP.
column7: When you drink this potion, you regain 2d4+2 hit points, and you gain advantage on your next attack roll or saving throw within the next minute. For the next hour, you have disadvantage on Constitution saving throws and your maximum hit points are reduced by 5.

column3: Whispers suggest the city's fall was due to a powerful Void incursion, leaving behind only echoes and this unsettling artifact.
column4: Periodically unleash a wave of damage that slows enemies.
column5: Once per day, emit a sonic blast. Save vs. Magic or be slowed for 1d4 turns. Undead are immune. Those slain by this item become husks.
column7: This ancient Shuriman artifact hums with suppressed Void energy. While holding it, you can use an action to unleash a piercing shriek, forcing each creature within 30 feet to make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once used, this property cannot be used again until the next dawn.

column3: Crafted with dark magic in the Shadow Isles, it is said to corrupt the wielder, drawing power from the souls of the dead.
column4: Deals magic damage and grants bonus movement speed and stacking magic penetration upon hitting an enemy champion.
column5: Suffer 1d4 Sanity when equipped. Each hit drains 1 HP from target, granting the wielder +1 temp HP and +1 to hit rolls against that foe for 1 turn.
column7: This scythe pulses with necrotic energy, its touch chilling and corrupting. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this scythe, you gain temporary hit points equal to the creature's challenge rating (minimum of 1) for 1 minute. While you possess temporary hit points granted by this weapon, your alignment shifts one step closer to Chaotic Evil. This shift is subtle but cumulative; prolonged use may result in permanent alignment change at the DM's discretion.

column3: Forged in the light of Targon, rumored to be connected to the Solari and their eternal conflict against the Lunari.
column4: Empowers the wielder's next attack after using an ability, dealing bonus damage and granting movement speed.
column5: Strike with celestial fury after channeling power. Successful hit grants +1 to next initiative roll as you surge with solar energy. However, the light fades, imposing -1 to hit chance next round.
column7: This radiant longsword is a symbol of the Solari, forged in the heart of Mount Targon. You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. When you hit an undead or fiend with it, that creature takes an extra 2d8 radiant damage. As an action, you can cause the blade to emit bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet for 1 minute. Undead and fiends have disadvantage on attack rolls while in the bright light. Once this property is used, it cannot be used again until the next dawn.

column3: Favored by Ionian duelists, its whirling blades are said to channel the spirits of past masters, enhancing agility and precision.
column4: Grants attack damage, attack speed, and movement speed. Unique active grants temporary bonus movement speed and phantomize.
column5: On command, the wielder becomes as mist, gaining +2 to AC and +4 to saves vs. area attacks for 1 round. Afterwards, take 1d4 damage due to the strain of manipulating the life force.
column7: This elegant scimitar, a favored weapon of Ionian duelists, grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls. While wielding this blade, you gain advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks and Dexterity saving throws. In addition, once per turn when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can move up to half your speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

column3: This item seems to be associated with Ionian monks who are known for their movement techniques and spiritual attunement.
column4: Allows more frequent use of Flash and Ghost summoner spells.
column5: Once per day, teleport up to 30' or become invisible and move at double speed for 3 turns. Afterwards, make a DC 15 WIS save or be stunned for 1 turn.
column7: This amulet, attuned to Ionian spiritual practices, allows you to cast the Misty Step spell at will. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can expend a charge (of which the amulet has 3, regaining all expended charges daily at dawn) to become invisible until the end of your next turn. While invisible in this way, your movement speed increases by 10 feet.

column3: Said to be crafted by a wandering monk, seeking enlightenment, for disciples of his order. Perhaps connected to a forgotten spirit.
column4: Grants mana regeneration and healing power, useful for sustain in lane.
column5: The bearer regenerates 5 MP per turn, and healing spells or potions are +1 HP/level more effective. Prolonged use risks attracting spirits, requiring a WIS save to avoid possession.
column7: This intricately carved wooden idol, once held by a wandering monk, grants you advantage on Wisdom saving throws against being charmed or frightened. Additionally, once per day, when you use your action to meditate with the idol for at least 1 minute, you regain 2d6 hit points.

column3: Crafted from lost Freljordian ice magic, the shield whispers forgotten tales of the fallen Iceborn.
column4: Provides health, health regeneration, and ability power.
column5: Wearer gains +3 hit points, heals 1d4 hit points per turn, and spells are cast as if the wielder was one level higher. But beware the whispers of the shield— heed them not!
column7: While holding this shield, you have resistance to cold damage. Additionally, as a reaction when you take cold damage, you can choose to empower the shield with the absorbed energy. The shield gains 1 charge, up to a maximum of 3 charges. As an action, you can expend 1 or more charges to unleash a wave of frozen energy in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in the cone must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 2d6 cold damage per charge spent on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures that fail the save also have their speed reduced by 10 feet until the end of their next turn.

column3: Forged by celestial artisans on Mount Targon, rumored to shatter nightmares and grant clarity in the face of oblivion.
column4: Deals AoE damage on active, grants a shield, and empowers the next attack to deal bonus damage.
column5: Active: Shatters illusions and dispels fear. 1d6 Bludgeoning damage to ethereal foes. Shield grants +2 to saves vs. mind-altering effects. Next attack deals +1d4 damage and briefly stuns (DC 13 WIL save negates).
column7: This +3 longsword glows faintly when within 30 feet of a creature that is dreaming, whether naturally or magically. While wielding Dreamshatter, you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. As an action, you can plunge Dreamshatter into the ground, creating a 30-foot radius sphere centered on you. For the next minute, all creatures within the sphere have advantage on saving throws against nightmares and effects that would cause them to have disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws.

column3: Named after Eleisa, a Demacian healer known for her compassion. Possibly associated with the Lightbringers, a monastic order devoted to healing.
column4: Grants health, mana regeneration, and reduces crowd control duration.
column5: Wearer gains +3 to saves vs. charm and paralysis. Once per day, can replenish 1d6 hit points or recover from being stunned if incapacitated.
column7: This holy symbol can be used as a spellcasting focus for cleric and paladin spells. You gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DC of your cleric and paladin spells while using this item as a focus. Once per day, when a creature within 30 feet of you drops to 0 hit points, you can use your reaction to cause them to regain 1d8 hit points. If this restores them to at least 1 hit point, they also gain advantage on the next saving throw they make before the end of their next turn.

column3: Potent brew favored by Demacian artificers enhancing innovation, now outlawed due to volatile side effects.
column4: Grants bonus Ability Power, Attack Damage, and Cooldown Reduction for a short duration.
column5: For 10 minutes, cast spells as if two levels higher and deal +2 damage; after, roll a d6. On a 1, experience is cursed: next level requires double XP.
column7: When you drink this elixir, roll a d4. For the next hour, you gain a bonus to Intelligence checks and saving throws equal to the number rolled. Additionally, at the end of that hour, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of exhaustion.

column3: Potent brew favored by Noxian siege engineers and demolitionists, known for its volatile enhancement of destructive capabilities.
column4: Grants bonus health, increased damage to turrets, and bonus attack damage to minions.
column5: Drink grants +2 to hit structures, +1 damage. Allies within 30' suffer -1 to hit, unless immune to fear. Duration: 3 turns. Potential side effect: uncontrollable fits of giggling.
column7: When you drink this elixir, your destructive capabilities are amplified. For the next minute, your attacks deal an extra 2d6 force damage to objects and structures. Additionally, any critical hit you score against an object or structure causes a localized explosion. All creatures within 10 feet of the target must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 3d6 fire damage, or half as much on a success.

column3: Forged in Demacia, the Emblem of Valor is often used by soldiers needing to prove their loyalty and bravery to their leaders.
column4: Grants bonus health regeneration based on missing health, increasing survivability in prolonged fights.
column5: Wearer heals 1d4 hit points per turn while below half hit points. Grants +1 to morale checks when facing overwhelming odds. If the wearer retreats, the emblem crumbles to dust.
column7: While you wear this emblem, you have advantage on saving throws against being frightened. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can present the emblem and steel your resolve. Until the end of your next turn, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level + your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1), and attack rolls against you have disadvantage.

column3: Forged in the heart of Noxus, this item might have been used by a brutal warlord to suppress rebellions or enforce conscription.
column4: Taunt nearby enemies upon immobilizing an enemy champion.
column5: Upon hindering a foe, all lesser beings nearby must test Morale (failure means fleeing or cowering for 1d4 turns). Those immune to fear gain -2 to hit the wielder.
column7: While you possess this item, you have advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks made against creatures that have an Intelligence score of 8 or lower. In addition, you can cast the spell 'Cause Fear' once per day without expending a spell slot. When you reach 5th level, you can also cast 'Fear' once per day. When you reach 9th level you can cast 'Mass Suggestion' once per week. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

column3: The Entropy Field hums with the chaotic energy of the Crimson Circle, possibly used in their brutal arena rituals. It shifts the very fabric of reality around it.
column4: Deals damage and slows enemies upon impact, creating a zone that slows enemies inside it.
column5: On a hit, inflicts 1d6 entropy damage, slowing movement by half for 1 round. Area effect: 10' radius, saves vs magic or be slowed. Continued exposure causes mutation - roll on corruption table.
column7: This item radiates an aura of chaotic energy in a 30-foot radius. At the start of each of your turns, roll a d4. On a 1, all creatures within the aura have their movement speed halved until the start of your next turn. On a 2, all spells of 3rd level or lower cast within the aura have their range doubled. On a 3, all attack rolls within the aura are made with advantage. On a 4, all saving throws within the aura are made with disadvantage. This field can be suppressed for 1 minute as an action.

column3: Favored by Demacian sentries on long patrols, Espresso Snax are rumored to be baked with enchanted coffee beans from distant lands.
column4: Grants a temporary burst of movement speed and increased attack speed.
column5: Upon consumption: +2 to SPD for 1d4 turns and +1 to hit for 1d4 rounds. Potential side effect: Uncontrolled chattering (5% chance).
column7: Upon consuming an Espresso Snax as an action, you regain 1d4 hit points and gain advantage on Wisdom saving throws against exhaustion for the next 4 hours. Additionally, you do not suffer the effects of exhaustion for 1 hour.

column3: Favored by lower-ranking officers in Noxus, the Evenshroud is thought to provide protection and is associated with the Black Rose.
column4: Reduces affected enemies' resistances, increasing damage dealt to them.
column5: Enemies within 60' suffer -2 to all saves vs. spells. Attacks against them gain +1 to hit and +1 to damage for 6 turns. Save vs. Spells or be stunned for 1 turn.
column7: While wearing this armor, as a reaction when you or a creature within 30 feet of you is hit by an attack, you can grant all allies within 30 feet of you a +2 bonus to AC against that attack. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

column3: The storm seems to call out to the stars, perhaps created by an aspect of the celestial realm.
column4: Brings the target to you, and slows for a short duration.
column5: Creature is pulled 30' in a straight line toward the user. Save vs. Paralysis or be slowed for 1d4 rounds (half movement, -2 to hit).
column7: You can cast the spell 'Reverse Gravity' once per day. When you cast it this way, the spell's duration is concentration, up to 1 minute. Additionally, when you cast a spell that deals lightning or thunder damage, you can change the damage type to force damage.

column3: Favored by Demacian scouts, allowing them to safely navigate uncharted regions and provide early warnings against potential threats.
column4: Places a visible ward that reveals the surrounding area for a duration.
column5: When planted, the ward creates a shimmering beacon. Creatures within 30' are easily spotted. Undead might take 1d6 damage if they fail a save vs. magic.
column7: While holding this ward, you have advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to navigate or avoid becoming lost. As an action, you can plant the ward in the ground; it becomes invisible and sheds dim light in a 5-foot radius. Any creature that moves within 5 feet of the ward triggers an alarm, alerting you with a mental ping within a mile if you are on the same plane of existence. The ward lasts for 24 hours or until dispelled.

column3: An ancient relic from the Frozen Watchers, radiating intense cold and magical power, with possible connections to Lissandra.
column4: Periodically slows nearby enemies. Grants ability haste and mana regeneration.
column5: Creatures near the wielder must SAVE vs. cold or be slowed (half movement) for 1d4 rounds. Grants +2 to cast spells, restores 1 spell slot per day.
column7: This ancient relic of the Frozen Watchers radiates palpable cold. While holding the Eye of Frost, you are immune to cold damage. As an action, you can unleash a cone of frost extending 60 feet. Each creature in that area must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 8d8 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature killed by this effect is frozen solid. Once this ability is used, it cannot be used again until the next dawn. The eye is rumored to have connections to Lissandra, and prolonged exposure may reveal secrets of forgotten ice magic at the DM's discretion.

column3: Linked to the ancient Aspects of Targon, granting sight and protection. Possibly connected to champions like Taric or Leona.
column4: Provides health, mana regeneration, and vision through placed wards.
column5: Allows the user to cast See Invisible 3/day. Grants +1 AC. When depleted, shatters, releasing a burst of harmless light, possibly alerting nearby monsters.
column7: This gem pulses with celestial energy, a fragment of the power of the Aspects of Targon. While holding the Eye of the Aspect, you gain a +3 bonus to AC and saving throws. Additionally, you can cast the Shield spell (3rd-level version) as a reaction without expending a spell slot. You can do so three times, regaining all expended uses at dawn. Champions blessed by Targon, such as Taric or Leona, may find the Eye particularly attuned to their celestial nature, granting additional benefits as determined by the DM.

column3: Likely originating from Shurima's oasis, it might be tied to ancient guardians or benevolent spirits of the desert.
column4: Periodically heals nearby allies and restores mana to the wielder.
column5: Once per day, touch the eye to replenish 1d6 lost HP or MP to a character within 30'. On a failed save vs. WIS, the user has vivid dreams of the Oasis.
column7: This shimmering jewel hums with the life force of Shurima's ancient oases. While holding the Eye of the Oasis, you can cast Create or Destroy Water at will. As an action, you can touch a creature and restore 4d8 hit points. Once you use this healing ability, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest. The Eye whispers secrets of the desert, and might be connected to ancient guardians or benevolent spirits, revealing lore and quests at the DM's discretion.

column3: Linked to the Watchers of the Freljord, ancient beings of ice and void.
column4: Provides ability power, mana regeneration, and executes low-health minions.
column5: Grants +1 to cast spells, replenishes mana. Usable once per day: Instantly slay a creature with HD less than your level. Failure results in character aging 1d4 years.
column7: While attuned to this frozen orb, you gain advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks made to detect illusions or hidden creatures within 60 feet. As an action, you can peer into the icy depths of the orb, gaining truesight out to a range of 30 feet for 1 minute. Once used, this ability cannot be used again until the next dawn. The eye emanates an aura of extreme cold. Creatures within 5 feet of the orb have disadvantage on saving throws against effects that deal cold damage.

column3: Likely crafted by a Solari order, used by scouts and sentinels to watch for signs of the Void's corruption on Runeterra.
column4: Reveals a small area at long range for a short duration. Limited range early, improving with level.
column5: Cast Light beyond normal limits. Reveals secrets to those who dare look far. But beware, for what you see, may see you also. Range increases with caster level; 20' per level.
column7: This crystalline orb pulses with celestial energy. As an action, you can activate the orb to cast the Scrying spell (save DC 17), targeting a location or creature you have seen before. The orb can only be used once per day at dawn, after which its light dims until the next sunrise. While holding the orb, you have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks made to detect the presence of aberrations and creatures from other planes.

column3: Worn by Ionian monks seeking enlightenment, the Flash Zone aids in swift escapes or ambushes, resonating with the land's inherent magic.
column4: Short-range teleport with a brief invulnerability window after arrival.
column5: Usable once per day. Instantly teleport up to 30' away. Roll a d6: on a 1-2, target location is hazardous; on a 5-6, brief shimmer provides +2 AC for 1 round.
column7: This intricately woven sash shimmers with latent magical energy. As a bonus action, you can expend one of the sash's 3 charges to cast the Misty Step spell. The sash regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn. Additionally, while wearing the sash, your speed increases by 10 feet, and you gain advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks made to avoid being grappled or restrained.

column3: Forged in Demacia, this armament might have belonged to a Dauntless Vanguard, or a member of the Crownguard.
column4: Grants bonus attack damage and health, scaling with champion level.
column5: Wearer gains +1 to hit and damage. When HP is reduced to 0, roll a d6. On a 6, the wearer remains at 1 HP, otherwise death. Effect can trigger once per dawn.
column7: This masterwork weapon, of Demacian make, grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls. While wielding this weapon, you gain advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. Additionally, once per day, when you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, you can choose to knock the target prone if it is Large or smaller.

column3: Likely forged by the Iceborn, or by the followers of Volibear, this crest provides the wearer a burning aura.
column4: Deals magic damage to nearby enemies every second.
