column5: Creatures near the bearer take 1d4 fire damage each round; save versus breath weapon for half. Grants +1 to saves versus cold.
column7: While wearing this crest, you are wreathed in harmless flames, shedding bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet. You have resistance to cold damage. As an action, you can unleash a wave of fire. Each creature in a 15-foot cone originating from you must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 4d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until the next dawn.

column3: May be linked to the Winter's Claw, perhaps used as a food source during harsh winters. Could also be associated with yetis.
column4: Restores a small amount of health and mana. Grants a temporary movement speed boost upon consumption.
column5: Heals 1d4 hp and 1d4 mp. Additionally, the imbiber moves as if under the 'haste' spell for 3 turns, though their AC is reduced by 1 due to the sudden burst of energy.
column7: These preserved rations provide sustenance and warmth in even the harshest conditions. Consuming a Frosted Snax requires an action and restores 2d4 hit points and grants advantage on Constitution saving throws against exhaustion for the next hour. A creature can only benefit from consuming one Frosted Snax every 24 hours.

column3: Likely forged by the Ice Witch Lissandra's servants. Grants resistance to flame and creates a zone of perpetual frost.
column4: Empowers basic attacks to create a slowing field, also grants increased armor and magic resist.
column5: Melee attacks encase foes in ice (Save vs. Paralysis). Grants +2 to AC vs. fire-based attacks. Creatures entering your zone of influence must Save vs. Cold or suffer -1 to hit.
column7: While wearing these gauntlets, you have resistance to fire damage. As an action, you can create a 20-foot radius sphere of intense cold centered on a point you can see within 60 feet. The sphere lasts for 1 minute. Any creature that starts its turn within the sphere must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have its speed reduced by half until the start of its next turn. Additionally, at the start of each of your turns while the sphere persists, you can choose one creature within the sphere. That creature must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 3d6 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

column3: The Frozen Mallet could be associated with the Freljord, as it embodies the chilling power of the north and slowing enemies with ice.
column4: It grants health and attack damage and slows enemies on hit.
column5: On a hit, target must make a save vs. paralysis or be slowed. Movement reduced to 1/2 for 1d4 turns. Grants +1 to saves vs. cold.
column7: This magical maul is perpetually cold to the touch. Once per turn when you hit a creature with this weapon, that creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have its speed reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn. If the creature is already affected by an effect that reduces its speed, it instead has disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

column3: Favored by Demacian soldiers, particularly those facing monstrous threats or heavily armored Noxian legions, embodying the spirit of overcoming overwhelming odds.
column4: Deals bonus damage to champions with greater maximum health.
column5: Confers Advantage on attack rolls against giants, dragons, and enemies of noble birth. Grants +1 to damage per Hit Die difference, up to a maximum of +6.
column7: This weapon deals an extra 2d6 damage to Large or larger creatures. When you hit a creature of Huge or Gargantuan size with this weapon, you can choose to attempt to knock it prone. The creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC 10 + your Strength modifier + your proficiency bonus) or be knocked prone.

column3: Said to be blessed by the Aspect of Twilight, granting clarity and foresight to its user, especially among the Rakkor.
column4: Grants the user increased mana regeneration and ability haste.
column5: When held, the wielder must Save vs. Spells or be compelled to speak the truth. Grants +1 to hit rolls when fighting in dim light or darkness.
column7: While holding this globe, you gain advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks. Additionally, once per long rest, you can cast the Augury spell without using a spell slot or material components. When used within a settlement primarily populated by Rakkor, you also learn one additional piece of information from the augury.

column3: Favored by Noxian battlemages and warlords, it's believed to be tied to hemomancy and brutal, decisive victories, possibly Vladimir or the Black Rose.
column4: Deals damage and heals the user. Grants bonus attack damage. Grants health and attack damage based on enemies nearby.
column5: Grants +2 to hit and damage. Once per day, if at 0 hp, regain 1d8 hp. On a natural 1, the sword demands a blood sacrifice; lose 1 permanent CON.
column7: This magical greatsword pulses with crimson energy. Once per long rest as an action, when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can activate Goredrinker's Thirst. Until the end of your next turn, whenever you damage a creature with an attack, you regain hit points equal to half the damage dealt. Additionally, necrotic damage dealt by you ignores resistance.

column3: Forged with celestial energies, rumored to grant wearers brief control over gravity, potentially linked to the Aspect of Twilight.
column4: Grants increased movement speed and the ability to briefly ignore unit collision.
column5: Wearer can ignore difficult terrain and gains +1 to hit rolls when jumping down on an enemy. Once per day, may cast 'feather fall' on self.
column7: While wearing these boots, you can use a bonus action to briefly manipulate gravity. For 1 minute, you gain a fly speed of 30 feet. If you are still flying when the minute ends, you descend at a rate of 30 feet per round until you reach the ground. You can use this ability once, regaining the ability to do so after a long rest. Additionally, as a reaction when you would fall, you can reduce the falling damage you take by an amount equal to five times your level.

column3: Forged in the heart of Targon, it resonates with celestial energy, potentially linked to the Aspects.
column4: Grants increased magic resist and ability power when fully charged.
column5: Upon attunement, the orb grants +2 to saves vs. magic. On a failed save, user must make a DC 15 Will save or be overcome by visions of the celestial realm.
column7: This orb pulses with celestial energy. While holding the orb, you gain advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks related to celestial beings or magic originating from the upper planes. Additionally, once per day, you can cast the Identify spell without expending a spell slot to determine the properties of a celestial object or to discern the nature of celestial magic.

column3: Favored by Shuriman desert travelers, the Greater Totem provides crucial knowledge of approaching dangers, both seen and unseen in the sands.
column4: Periodically grants a free ward. Upgrades Stealth Ward to Greater Stealth Totem for longer duration and increased vision range.
column5: Once per day, user can see invisible entities or traps within 60ft. Usable three times before needing a full day's recharge. User may ignore the need for recharge at the cost of attracting hostile unseen entities.
column7: This totem grants its user heightened awareness of their surroundings. As an action, you can activate the totem, granting you advantage on Wisdom (Perception) and Intelligence (Investigation) checks made to detect threats within a 60-foot radius for the next 10 minutes. While active, the totem emits a faint, pulsating light visible up to 30 feet away. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

column3: Associated with restless spirits and the spectral realm. Perhaps a tool for navigating or manipulating the undead energies of the Shadow Isles.
column4: Reveals invisible units and grants bonus damage against monsters.
column5: Detect ethereal beings and strike with +1 to hit undead, dealing +1d4 damage. Lantern sheds dim light, spooking animals and attracting spectres.
column7: This lantern burns with an ethereal flame, illuminating the spectral realm. While holding the lantern, you can see into the Ethereal Plane within a 30-foot radius. As an action, you can command the lantern to emit a beam of spectral energy. Choose one undead creature within 60 feet that you can see. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or be turned for 1 minute. A creature turned in this way must spend its turns trying to move as far away from you as it can, and it can't willingly move to a space within 30 feet of you. It also can't take reactions. For its action, it can use only the Dash action or try to escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If there's nowhere to move, the creature can use the Dodge action. Once you use this action, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest.

column3: Favored by Noxian warmasons and Freljordian raiders, the Hamstringer hobbles foes, leaving them vulnerable. Useful for warriors seeking an advantage in the icy north.
column4: Dealing damage slows the target, making it easier to chase or escape.
column5: Target must SAVE vs DEX or suffer -2 to movement speed. Additionally, they attack at disadvantage vs. user for the next round, or until they receive healing.
column7: This magical weapon, favored by Noxian warmasters and Freljordian raiders, has 7 charges. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can expend 1 charge to attempt to hamstring it. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or have its movement speed halved until the end of its next turn. The weapon regains 1d6+1 expended charges daily at dawn. If the weapon is reduced to 0 charges, roll a d20. On a 1, the weapon crumbles to dust and is destroyed.

column3: A trophy taken from Kha'Zix. Symbolizes dominance over the Void and its creatures. Could be related to Rek'Sai or other Voidborn.
column4: Grants bonus attack damage. Killing Kha'Zix grants additional, permanent attack damage.
column5: Confers +1 to hit rolls, +1 to damage rolls. If used to slay a Void creature, gain a permanent +1 to Strength (max +3), but also 1d4 Corruption.
column7: This grotesque trophy pulses with void energy. While holding the Head of Kha'Zix, you gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to track Voidborn creatures. Additionally, as an action, you can present the head and force each Voidborn creature within 30 feet of you to make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is frightened of you for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until the next dawn.

column3: Forged on Targon, it shares health and gold. A bond of support, perhaps linked to the Solari's ideals of protection.
column4: Grants health, health regeneration, and executes low health minions to grant gold to an ally.
column5: Wearer heals slightly faster. Execute a nearly dead creature, transferring its lifeforce (gold) to an ally. Range: touch.
column7: This shimmering amulet resonates with celestial energy. As an action, you can touch a willing creature other than yourself and forge a bond between you and that creature for 1 hour. While bonded, whenever you take damage, the bonded creature takes half of the damage, rounded down. While bonded, at the start of each of your turns, you can transfer a number of gold pieces from your possession to the bonded creature equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum 1). This gold appears in the bonded creature's possession. You can only maintain one bond at a time. This effect ends early if you are incapacitated or die, or if the bonded creature is more than 100 feet away from you.

column3: Forged in the heart of Noxus, rumored to be imbued with the essence of a vanquished fire mage. A favored weapon of warlords.
column4: Deals bonus magic damage on hit and grants stacking magic penetration, decaying over time.
column5: On a hit, victim suffers +1 damage/level spell-like fire damage and subtracts 1 from magic resistance per hit, up to target's level. Resistance returns at 1/hour.
column7: This magical hatchet, forged in Noxus, deals an extra 1d6 fire damage on a hit. Once per long rest, when you score a critical hit with this weapon, you can choose to unleash a wave of fire in a 15-foot cone originating from you. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 3d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

column3: Crude hextech components hint at early Piltover and Zaunite influence in Ionia, or perhaps an Ionian attempt to replicate it.
column4: Provides ability power, health, and mana. Can be upgraded into more powerful versions.
column5: User gains +1 to cast damage, +3 hit points, and the ability to cast 1 extra spell before requiring rest. When upgraded, roll a d6. On a roll of 1, the core implodes, dealing 2d6 damage.
column7: This curious device hums with arcane energy. As an action, you can attempt to interface with a construct or magical item. Make a DC 15 Intelligence (Arcana) check. On a success, you gain temporary insight into the object's function, granting you advantage on one attack roll, saving throw, or ability check related to that object within the next hour. This device has no effect on artifacts or creatures.

column3: Prototype technology, likely developed in Zaun or by a Noxian artificer, for rapid battlefield traversal and engagement. May have ties to Viktor's Glorious Evolution.
column4: Dashes a short distance and unleashes a nova of magic missiles.
column5: Once per day, propel yourself 30' forward. All within 10' take 1d6 magic damage (save versus magic to halve). Roll a d6: on a 1, the belt malfunctions and you are stunned for 1 round.
column7: This prototype belt contains a limited-use propulsion system. As an action, you can expend 1 charge to propel yourself 30 feet in a straight line. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks. Additionally, six rockets fire at the end of the movement, each targeting a point within 5 feet of the destination. Each creature within 5 feet of any of those points must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take 2d6 fire damage. The belt has 3 charges and regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

column3: Whispers link it to fallen Targonian aspects, perhaps those who dared defy the stars' rigid paths.
column4: Grants bonus movement speed and magic resist after casting your ultimate ability.
column5: Upon utterance of a final, powerful word, wearer gains +2 to speed and resists magic for 1d4 rounds. Chance of attracting unwanted celestial attention (GM discretion).
column7: This faintly glowing amulet pulses with celestial energy. While wearing it, you gain advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. Additionally, once per day, when you or an ally within 30 feet fails a saving throw, you can use your reaction to grant them advantage on that saving throw, potentially turning the failure into a success. This property of the amulet fades at dawn if not used.

column3: Favored by Ionian hunters and spirit walkers, allows one to track down dangerous beasts of the forests.
column4: Bonus damage to monsters and increased experience gained from killing monsters in the jungle.
column5: Grants +1 to tracking, +1 damage die on attacks against beasts. Spend 1 turn after battle butchering the beast. Replenishes 1d4 food.
column7: This elegant Ionian machete is crafted from whispersteel, its blade humming with latent energy. While holding this machete, you have advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to track beasts. Additionally, when you hit a beast with this machete, the beast takes an extra 1d6 radiant damage. If the beast is a monstrosity, it takes an extra 2d6 radiant damage instead.

column3: Favored by Ionian spirit walkers and shadow stalkers, channels vital essence for hunting.
column4: Bonus mana regen in the jungle and bonus damage to monsters.
column5: Upon consumption of slain monsters, regain 1d4 mana. Furthermore, successfully tracking a beast yields advantage on your next attack roll.
column7: This intricately carved talisman throbs with spiritual power. While wearing it, you gain the following benefits: You have advantage on Wisdom saving throws against spells and effects from fey and undead creatures. As a bonus action, you can expend a Hit Die to regain a number of hit points equal to the result plus your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1 hit point). You can't use this bonus action again until you finish a short or long rest.

column3: Said to be created with concentrated starlight, this substance is rumored to enhance one's connection to the celestial realm.
column4: Grants bonus ability power and mana regeneration.
column5: Drinking this ichor allows the imbiber to cast one additional spell, but they take 1d6 radiant damage. A second draught is poison!
column7: As an action, you can apply this viscous, shimmering fluid to a weapon or piece of armor. For the next hour, the weapon sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. While illuminated, the weapon deals an extra 1d6 radiant damage on a hit. If applied to armor, the wearer gains advantage on Wisdom saving throws against being charmed or frightened by celestial beings. The ichor vanishes after 1 hour or after the radiant damage has been dealt a total of 10 times.

column3: Crafted by Demacian artisans, rumored to have protective enchantments from a Radiantite shard, safeguarding the wielder.
column4: Grants a shield when taking damage that would reduce you below a certain health threshold.
column5: Wearer is enveloped in shimmering light when near death; prevents the next lethal blow. Foe must save vs. magic or be blinded for 1d4 rounds by the radiance.
column7: While wielding this shield, you have resistance to radiant damage. Additionally, as a reaction when you take damage that would reduce you to 0 hit points, you can activate the shield's magic. You gain temporary hit points equal to half your maximum hit points, and the shield absorbs the triggering damage. These temporary hit points last for 1 minute. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

column3: Celestial in origin, resonating with the power of constellations and cosmic balance. Grants power from beyond the stars.
column4: Periodically empowers abilities, increasing damage based on time spent in combat and champion level.
column5: Once per round, reroll any die, adding your level to the result. On a natural 1 or 20, the stars align, granting advantage on all rolls for [level] rounds.
column7: This item requires attunement by a spellcaster. While attuned, you can cast the Guiding Bolt spell at will, without expending a spell slot. Additionally, once per long rest, you can use a bonus action to channel the power of the stars, granting you advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws until the end of your next turn. During this time, your eyes gleam with starlight.

column3: Favored by the Solari, the locket may possess lunar magic, a counter to the Lunari. Perhaps tied to Leona's power and devotion to the sun.
column4: Grants magic resist and health regeneration. Activates to shield nearby allies from incoming damage.
column5: A shimmering field envelops allies: 2d6 damage negated. Undead hesitate to attack those shielded, unless compelled.
column7: While wearing this locket, you gain advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can touch a willing creature and grant them temporary hit points equal to your level. You can use this bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

column3: Favored by Noxian arena masters and pit fighters, this brutal whip embodies strength through dominance. Used to control beasts and break the wills of foes.
column4: Deals damage to nearby enemies and grants movement speed when used. Useful for clearing waves and chasing enemies.
column5: On a hit, target must save versus STR or be knocked prone. Those immune to being knocked prone must save versus WIL or be stunned for 1 round. User gains +1 to movement for 1 round.
column7: This whip deals an extra 1d6 bludgeoning damage. On a hit, you can choose to attempt to knock the target prone. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw against a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier or be knocked prone. Additionally, creatures of Large size or smaller that are within 5 feet of you have disadvantage on attack rolls against targets other than you.

column3: Possibly named after a forgotten Freljordian hero. The item is a key component in more powerful equipment.
column4: Grants health and attack damage that increases upon killing enemy units.
column5: Wielder gains 1hp and +1 to hit for each foe slain in combat, lasting until the next dawn. If the fist is broken, the rage is dispelled.
column7: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with unarmed strikes and any weapon you are proficient with. Whenever you reduce a hostile creature to 0 hit points with an unarmed strike or a melee weapon attack while wielding this item, you gain temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus.

column3: Forged by the Solari, it resonates with celestial energy, offering protection against magical assaults for those deemed worthy by the Mountain.
column4: Grants magic resist and a shield that absorbs magic damage. The shield regenerates when out of combat.
column5: Confers Advantage on saves vs. spells and spell-like abilities. If a saving throw is failed against a magical attack, the Rookern absorbs a portion of the blow; for 1d4 rounds, incoming magic damage is reduced by 2 points.
column7: While holding this shield, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. In addition, the shield has 3 charges. As a reaction when you take damage from a spell, you can expend 1 charge to gain resistance to that damage type until the end of your next turn. The shield regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

column3: Forged on Targon's slopes, it resonates with celestial energy, granting vitality and resilience to its wielder.
column4: Grants health and ability haste, reducing cooldowns and increasing survivability in combat.
column5: Grants +1 to hit dice rolls when resisting spells and poison, and heals 1d4 hp a turn when below half health.
column7: This gem pulses with a warm, comforting light. While holding this gem, you gain the following benefits: Your hit point maximum increases by 10. You have advantage on saving throws against exhaustion. You can use a bonus action to touch a creature and restore 1d6 hit points to it.

column3: Forged by a Demacian artificer, the Kircheis Shard is rumored to amplify the wielder's intent, channeling inner energy into a potent strike.
column4: Energized attacks deal bonus magic damage and grant bonus movement speed.
column5: Next melee attack deals +1d6 lightning damage and grants +1 to movement until end of turn. Chance to attract unwanted elemental attention from the sky.
column7: This shard hums with latent energy. Once per turn when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can choose to expend the shard's energy. If you do, the attack deals an extra 2d6 lightning damage to the target. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

column3: Knights Vow is linked to Demacia and their ideals of protection and sacrifice. It is likely tied to a specific order of knights.
column4: Redirects damage from an ally to the wearer, healing based on damage dealt by the ally.
column5: The wearer designates a target, who becomes harder to hit (-2 AC). 10% of damage to the wearer is negated, but the target suffers equivalent damage as psychic feedback. Further, the wearer heals 1d6 hp when the target strikes a foe.
column7: While wearing this ring, when a creature within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can use your reaction to transfer up to 10 of that damage to yourself. You must be able to see the creature. Additionally, as an action, you can designate one willing creature you can see within 30 feet as your Vow target. While your Vow target is within 30 feet of you, you gain a +2 bonus to AC. If your Vow target is reduced to 0 hit points, you can choose to drop to 0 hit points instead. You can only have one Vow target at a time. Designating a new Vow target ends the effect on the previous target.

column3: Forged in Noxus, rumored to have been used in assassinations, allows the user to pierce through the toughest armor.
column4: Provides armor penetration, allowing physical damage to bypass a portion of the target's armor.
column5: Bypass DR X times per day. On critical hit, bypass all DR. Weapon degrades non-magical armor it strikes. Undead and constructs are immune.
column7: This +2 dagger ignores resistance to piercing damage. On a hit, the target's armor class is reduced by 1 until the end of their next turn. This effect is cumulative. If a creature's armor class is reduced to 10 or lower by this effect, the wielder can choose to make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a success, the wielder knows how to instantly kill the creature, and can choose to do so (instant death, no save).

column3: Favored by assassins in the empire. Legends says they grant the wielder enhanced stealth and lethality.
column4: Grants lethality and movement speed, increasing damage to isolated targets.
column5: Upon a successful hit, target must save versus death or drop to 0 hp. On a miss, the attacker is revealed and takes double damage from all sources for 1 round.
column7: This cloak is imbued with shadow magic. While wearing this cloak, you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. Additionally, once per day as a bonus action, you can become invisible until the end of your next turn or until you attack or cast a spell. When you hit a creature that is surprised with an attack while wearing this cloak, the attack deals an additional 4d6 necrotic damage and the creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed until the end of their next turn.

column3: Crafted by Ionian monks, this staff enhances natural magic, resonating with the spirit realm and amplifying a mage's connection to the land.
column4: The item grants increased magic power, mana regeneration, and reduces ability cooldowns.
column5: Upon attunement, gain +2 to spellcasting rolls. Spend a turn in meditation to recover a lost spell slot (level 3 or lower). Once per day, commune with local spirits for cryptic advice.
column7: This staff, crafted by Ionian monks, is a conduit to the spirit realm. While holding this staff, you gain a +3 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DC. Additionally, you can use a bonus action to regain one expended spell slot of 5th level or lower. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

column3: Forged atop Mount Targon, imbued with celestial power. Favored by support Ascended and the Solari for aiding allies in need.
column4: Grants gold and vision. Provides bonus health, mana regen, and ability haste, enhancing support capabilities.
column5: Once per day, touch a willing ally to grant +1 to all saving throws for 1d4 turns. User gains temporary blindness for one turn after use.
column7: Forged atop Mount Targon and imbued with celestial power, this item is favored by those who aid others. As an action, you can touch a creature and grant it the benefits of the Bless spell for 1 minute without expending a spell slot or requiring concentration. Additionally, as a reaction when a creature within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can reduce that damage by an amount equal to your level in the class that grants you the ability to cast spells. You can use each of these features a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

column3: Rumored to have been crafted from a sea monster's hide, Leviathan whispers promises of power and dominance to its wielder.
column4: Grants health and damage based on takedowns, lost on death. Resets stacks upon reaching maximum.
column5: Confers +1 to AC. Each successful hit grants +1 temporary HP (max 10). Upon death, character returns at 1 HP. If character achieves 10 successful hits, character cannot die until the next dawn.
column7: Rumored to be crafted from the hide of a colossal sea monster, Leviathan whispers promises of dominance. While wearing this armor, you gain a +3 bonus to AC. Additionally, you can breathe underwater and have advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks made to swim. As an action, you can unleash a powerful roar. Each creature within 30 feet of you must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once you use this roar, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

column3: Associated with the Black Mist and its lingering magic, tormenting those who dare wield it. May be related to the Ruination.
column4: Deals bonus magic damage over time and increased damage to slowed or immobilized targets.
column5: Those struck suffer 1d4 damage each round for 3 rounds (save allowed). Those bound or slowed suffer 1d6 damage instead. Wielder must save vs. death each week or become a wraith.
column7: This twisted artifact pulses with malevolent energy from the Shadow Isles. While attuned to this item, you gain resistance to necrotic damage. Additionally, once per long rest, when you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can choose to unleash a wave of Black Mist. Each creature within 30 feet of you must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or take 8d6 necrotic damage and become frightened of you for 1 minute. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and isn't frightened. The item is then destroyed as the Black Mist consumes it.

column3: Favored by warriors facing impossible odds in the Freljord, a 'Lifeline' is a blessing of the Ice Witch, granting temporary reprieve.
column4: Shields the user from lethal damage and grants bonus attack damage when triggered.
column5: Wearer is immune to a single source of damage. Upon trigger, gain +2 to hit and damage rolls for the next round, representing desperate aggression.
column7: This amulet, blessed by the Ice Witch, is a lifeline for those facing certain doom in the harsh Freljord. If you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you are instead reduced to 1 hit point, and gain temporary hit points equal to half your hit point maximum. This effect can only occur once. After the effect is triggered, the amulet crumbles to dust, its magic expended.

column3: Potentially forged by a Demacian artisan, rumored to channel the power of starlight. Might have been wielded by a hero fighting the darkness.
column4: Deals bonus damage to enemies. Grants the wielder increased movement speed and attack speed for a short duration.
column5: Suffer +1 AC from magical darkness. When swung, brightly illuminate a 30' radius. On hit, all undead and demons flee from the light (save vs. spell or turn to ash).
column7: This radiant blade hums with celestial power. You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic longsword. When you hit a creature that is vulnerable to radiant damage with this weapon, the target takes an extra 4d8 radiant damage. Additionally, once per day, you can cast the Sunbeam spell (save DC 17) from the sword. While wielding the Lightbringer, you have advantage on saving throws against being frightened or charmed.

column3: Forged on Targon, it resonates with celestial power. Often carried by those who stand against overwhelming darkness, inspired by the sun.
column4: Provides magic resist and health. Active: grants a shield to nearby allies, protecting them from damage.
column5: Confers +2 to saves vs. magic. Once per day, emit a radiant burst: allies within 30' gain 3d6 temporary hit points, absorb the next magic attack targeting them.
column7: While wearing this locket, you gain advantage on saving throws against being frightened. As an action, you can unleash a burst of protective energy, granting yourself and each ally within 30 feet of you a +2 bonus to AC and saving throws until the end of your next turn. You can use this ability three times, and regain all expended uses after finishing a long rest.

column3: Recovered from a drowned Oracle, it whispers secrets of unseen dangers, possibly linked to ancient sea curses or forgotten leviathans.
column4: Detects invisible enemy units and disables enemy traps for a short duration.
column5: Grants 1 turn of 'True Sight' (60ft range) and automatically disarms one magical trap. On a failed save (WIS 13), user experiences disturbing visions.
column7: As an action, you can consume this extract. For the next minute, you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) and Intelligence (Investigation) checks made to detect hidden dangers, traps, and illusions. Additionally, you are immune to the frightened condition caused by curses or undead. Once consumed, the whispers fade, and the extract is gone.

column3: Associated with Ionian monasteries, used to focus magical studies. May have been owned by a powerful spirit walker.
column4: Grants mana, ability haste, and mana regeneration upon leveling up.
column5: The chapter grants +1 to cast spells, replenishing mana (spell slots) upon leveling up. However, overuse might attract spirits to the caster.
column7: While holding this chapter, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DC. Additionally, when you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals damage, you can reroll one of the damage dice. You must use the new roll. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until the start of your next turn.

column3: The echo resonates with ancient Ionian magic, amplifying the wearer's spells, connecting them to the spirit realm and first lands.
column4: Damaging abilities grant stacks. At 100 stacks, the next damaging ability consumes all stacks to deal bonus magic damage to the target and nearby enemies.
column5: Once per day, unleash stored magical energy as a wave dealing 2d6 damage to all within 30'. Save vs. Magic or be stunned for 1 round. User must meditate for 1 turn to recharge.
column7: While attuned to this item, the first spell you cast of 1st level or higher each day has its area of effect, range, and number of targets doubled. Once per long rest, when you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals damage, you can unleash a pulse of energy. Choose up to three creatures within 30 feet of the target; each of those creatures takes force damage equal to the level of the spell.

column3: Potentially associated with the ancient magic of Ionia and its reverence for spiritual energy. Could be tied to the Vastaya.
column4: Damaging abilities grant stacks. At 100 stacks, the next damaging ability consumes all stacks to deal bonus damage and bounces to nearby enemies.
column5: Upon casting a spell, roll a d6. On a 6, the spell chains to another target within sight, dealing half damage. The caster glows faintly for one turn.
column7: This pulsing orb hums with latent energy. As an action, you can expend 1 charge to unleash a wave of force. Each creature in a 15-foot cone originating from you must make a DC 15 Strength saving throw, taking 4d6 force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The orb has 3 charges and regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn. While holding the orb, you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

column3: Gamblers in Bilgewater often carry trinkets like these dice, hoping to sway Lady Luck in their favor during high-stakes games.
column4: On a dice roll, reroll twice and take the highest result.
column5: Once per day, reroll any failed roll. On a natural 1, the dice crumble to dust.
column7: While you are holding these dice, you can choose to reroll one attack roll, ability check, or saving throw you make. You must use the new roll. Once the dice are used, roll a d6. On a roll of 1, the dice lose their magic and become ordinary dice. On a roll of 2-6, the dice can't be used again until the next dawn.

column3: Favored by monstrous creature hunters in the pits of Noxus, this item was made to quickly dispatch large beasts.
column4: Deals bonus damage to monsters and grants a chance to deal bonus damage on hit.
column5: On a successful hit against a monstrous creature, roll 1d6. On a 6, deal double damage. If damage exceeds HP, the creature explodes in a shower of gore.
column7: When you hit a Large or larger creature with this magical weapon, you deal an extra 2d6 slashing damage. Once per long rest, you can choose to reroll any damage die from this weapon and must use the new result.

column3: Whispers from the celestial realm suggest a connection to fallen watchers and their influence on Runeterra's magic, amplified through Targon's celestial energies.
column4: Imbues magic damage with burning, reducing magic resist of enemies hit and creating a damaging area.
column5: Casting spells risks attracting otherworldly attention, inflicting a burning curse (-1 to saves vs. magic) and creating a zone of aberrant energy (1d6 damage/round, save vs. magic to negate).
column7: This arcane focus allows you to ignore resistance to fire damage. When you cast a spell that deals fire damage, you can choose one creature damaged by the spell to become poisoned until the end of your next turn. Once you use this property, you can't use it again until the next dawn.

column3: Favored by Ionian monks seeking inner peace and harmony, aiding meditation and channeling of spiritual energy.
column4: Provides increased mana regeneration. Grants bonus mana upon using an ability.
column5: Wearer gains +1 to cast spells without components. Recover 1d4 mana per turn meditating. On a roll of 1, the meditation draws unwanted attention.
column7: While holding this item, you gain advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can regain 1d4 hit points. You cannot use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.

column3: Forged in Ionia, Manamune's creation involved spirit magic, resonating with the land's inherent energy and the interconnectedness of its inhabitants.
column4: Grants bonus attack damage based on maximum mana and refunds mana on ability casts, stacking to transform into Muramana.
column5: Wearer gains +1 to hit and damage rolls for every 5 points of mana. Spells cost 1 less mana. When mana is exhausted, the blade transforms, dealing +1d6 damage on a hit until rested.
column7: While attuned to this Ionian artifact, your connection to the land enhances your spellcasting. You gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC increases by 2. Additionally, once per long rest, when you cast a spell that deals damage, you can maximize the damage dice of one damage type dealt by the spell.

column3: Crafted from shipwrecked souls and sea salt, it whispers tales of vengeance from the depths. Associated with lost mariners.
column4: Upon taking fatal damage, become untargetable and continue attacking for a short duration.
column5: Upon death, the wielder's spirit lingers, fueled by rage. They lash out with spectral attacks before passing on, possibly becoming a ghost if slain again during this period (1-in-6 chance).
column7: This cursed blade whispers of the drowned. When you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, the creature must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you for 1 minute. While frightened in this way, the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Additionally, the blade deals an extra 1d6 necrotic damage on a hit, and you gain temporary hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

column3: Potentially linked to Demacian knights, as a tool to protect allies and inspire courage through self-sacrifice.
column4: Taunts nearby enemies, reduces damage taken, and deals damage to nearby enemies upon damage taken and at the end of the duration.
column5: Wearer gains +3 to AC, but all attacks targetting allies within 30' are redirected to them, attacker makes a DC 15 WIL save or attacks the wearer. On expiring, explodes for 2d6 damage to all within 10'.
column7: This holy symbol, etched with the crest of a forgotten Demacian order, radiates protective energy. As a reaction when a creature within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can transfer the damage to yourself. You take damage equal to the amount the other creature would have taken. If this damage reduces you to 0 hit points, you do not fall unconscious immediately. Instead, you can choose one ally within 30 feet of you. That ally gains temporary hit points equal to your maximum hit points, and advantage on attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks for 1 minute. At the end of that minute, you immediately fall unconscious, and must succeed on a DC 15 death saving throw or die. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

column3: Associated with dark magic and power accumulation, perhaps favored by ambitious Noxian mages seeking forbidden knowledge. Could be connected to the Black Rose.
column4: Grants ability power upon champion kills and assists, lost on death. Stacks up to 25 times for massive AP.
column5: Steal the souls of slain foes. Each soul grants +1 to cast checks. On death, roll a d6; on a 1-3, lose half of your stacks. On a 4-6, lose all stacks.
column7: This heavy, ornate tome pulses with dark energy. While holding this book, you gain advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks made to learn about Necromancy spells or rituals. Additionally, whenever a creature you can see within 30 feet of you dies, you gain 1 temporary hit point. These temporary hit points last for 1 hour. As an action, you can expend any number of temporary hit points granted by this book to cast the 'False Life' spell without material components, using a spell slot equal to the number of temporary hit points expended (minimum of a 1st-level spell slot).

column3: Linked to an ancient order on Targon, dedicated to purity and protection against corruption from the Void.
column4: Removes all crowd control effects from an ally and grants them a brief period of crowd control immunity.
column5: Touch ally to negate paralysis, poison, and charm. Target gains +4 to saves vs. mental effects for 3 turns. Upon use, user ages 1d4 weeks, reflecting the blessing's burden.
column7: This intricately carved amulet is crafted from pure silver and blessed by celestial beings. As an action, you can touch one willing creature and end one of the following conditions affecting it: blinded, deafened, paralyzed, poisoned, or stunned. Once used, this property of the amulet cannot be used again until the next dawn. Additionally, the wearer has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

column3: Potentially a tool utilized by the Ascended to manage and control the flow of lesser beings and resources within their empire.
column4: Consumes minions to gain damage bonuses against that minion type.
column5: As an action, touch a corporeal undead to attempt to banish it. The target must make a saving throw vs. item level or be instantly turned to harmless dust.
column7: This small, crystalline shard hums with latent energy. As an action, you can target a creature within 60 feet of you that has Challenge Rating 1 or lower. That creature must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is disintegrated, turning to fine dust. If the target is reduced to 0 hit points by this effect, only dust remains. Once you use this shard, it cannot be used again until the next dawn. When you hit a creature with an attack or spell and the attack roll or spell DC includes your proficiency bonus, you can add an additional 1d6 force damage.

column3: Favored by messengers and scouts across the desert, granting swift passage between oases and ancient ruins. Often enchanted with protective spirits.
column4: Greatly increased out-of-combat movement speed, reduced when in combat.
column5: Wearer moves at x2 speed when unburdened. If attacked, must SAVE vs. DEX 14 or boots slow to normal speed for 1d4 turns. Blessed versions may ignore the SAVE.
column7: While wearing these boots, your base walking speed increases by 15 feet. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can activate the boots' enhanced mobility. For the next 10 minutes, your walking speed is doubled, and you have advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks and saving throws. Once this bonus action is used, the boots cannot be activated again until the next dawn.

column3: Linked to the Lunari, wielding moon magic. Might be associated with champions like Diana, who draws power from the moon.
column4: Grants magic resist and ability haste, while also providing a shield after casting an ultimate ability.
column5: Grants advantage on saving throws vs. magic and grants the wearer a ward that absorbs damage once per day after calling upon their inner power (casting a 6th level spell or higher).
column7: This elegant longsword is perpetually bathed in soft moonlight. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. While attuned to this weapon, you can cast the Moonbeam spell (3rd level version) once per long rest without expending a spell slot. Additionally, you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened while holding the blade.

column3: Associated with forbidden knowledge and necromantic practices within Noxus. Possibly tied to the Black Rose or dark mages seeking immortality.
column4: Applies Grievous Wounds to enemies hit by abilities, reducing their healing.
column5: Target's wounds fester, healing provides no succor. Saving throw (Wisdom) or incur disadvantage on subsequent Constitution checks until healed by divine magic or a full day's rest.
column7: This weighty tome radiates an aura of dark magic. While holding the Morellonomicon, you can cast the Life Transference spell once per day. Additionally, any creature you hit with a spell attack suffers one level of exhaustion after the spell resolves. Once used, the Life Transference property can't be used again until the next dawn.

column3: Rumored to be crafted for the Ascended, perhaps at the behest of a long-lost emperor for a monstrous champion.
column4: Grants AP, attack speed, and on-hit damage; perfect for hybrid damage dealers who weave spells and attacks.
column5: Wielder gains +2 to hit in melee, +2 to cast spells. On a hit, target must SAVE vs. Poison or take 1d6 damage. Breaks if used by a non-mage.
column7: Weapon (any sword or dagger), very rare (requires attunement). You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you deal an extra 1d6 force damage. Once per turn, when you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you can make a melee attack with this weapon as a bonus action.

column3: Favored by mages in Ionia, enhancing their natural connection to the spirit realm and amplifying their spellcasting abilities.
column4: Grants a large amount of ability power, increasing the damage of spells.
column5: Rod imbues +1d4 to magic damage rolls. However, if 1 is rolled, the spell fizzles, and the caster takes 1d4 backlash damage.
column7: Rod, rare (requires attunement by a spellcaster). While holding this rod, your spell attack bonus increases by +2 and your spell save DC increases by 2. Additionally, you can use a bonus action to reroll one damage die of a spell you just cast. You must use the new roll.

column3: Whispers suggest it's linked to a fallen Shadow Isles mage, seeking to corrupt the living with arcane power.
column4: Grants ability haste and mana. Empowers the user's next ability after casting an ultimate.
column5: Once per day, after casting a ritual of 6th level or higher, the next spell cast before the sun rises is cast as if by a scroll, ignoring material components up to 50 gold.
column7: Wondrous item, very rare (requires attunement by a spellcaster). This grimoire pulses with necrotic energy. While holding it, you gain advantage on death saving throws. When you cast a spell that deals necrotic damage, you can maximize one of the damage dice instead of rolling it. This property can't be used again until the next dawn. Additionally, undead creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls against you.

column3: Favored by Ionian martial artists. Legends say masters can move like shadows while wearing them, blending into the spirit realm.
column4: Reduces damage from basic attacks and provides movement speed.
column5: AC 13. wearer reduces damage from mundane missile attacks by 2 points and moves +10' when exploring or evading in wilderness or urban environments. If fleeing reduce encounter distance by half.
column7: While wearing these boots, your Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to move silently are made with advantage. Additionally, when you take the Dash action on your turn, your movement speed increases by 20 feet until the end of the turn.

column3: Associated with Targon's nomadic people. Grants resilience and empowers allies nearby, embodying the mountain's supportive aspect.
column4: Grants health regeneration, mana regeneration, and bonus gold. Provides aura of mana regen to nearby allies.
column5: Wearer heals 1hp per round and regenerates 1 mana per turn. Allies within 30' also regen mana. +1 to saves vs. exhaustion.
column7: While you wear this medallion, you gain a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws. In addition, as an action, you can expend 1 charge to grant yourself and each creature within 30 feet of you that you can see temporary hit points equal to 1d6 + your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1). This medallion has 3 charges and regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

column3: Crafted by Demacian mages, the Null-Magic Mantle protects against arcane threats, commonly used by frontline soldiers and mageseekers.
column4: Provides magic resistance, reducing damage taken from enemy abilities.
column5: Confers advantage on saves versus spells and magical effects. On a failed save, halve damage. If already resistant to magic, reduce magical damage taken by one-quarter.
column7: You have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. While wearing this mantle, you can use your reaction when you are hit by a spell to attempt to nullify the spell's effect. Make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell has no effect on you and is instead reflected back to the caster, targeting them as if they had cast it. If the caster is immune to the spell or effect it is simply negated.

column3: Favored by Noxian commanders, the Obsidian Cleaver sunders armor, leaving enemies vulnerable to further assaults. Represents raw, brutal power.
column4: Deals physical damage, reduces enemy armor, and grants movement speed on hit.
column5: On a hit, target must save vs. crushing blow or suffer -1 to AC. Cleaving a foe strengthens the wielder, increasing movement by 10' for a turn.
column7: This massive obsidian greataxe deals an extra 2d6 slashing damage to any creature wearing armor. Additionally, once per turn when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can choose to reduce the AC of the target by 1, to a minimum of 10, until the end of your next turn. This effect stacks.

column3: Likely crafted by the ancient Iceborn, a relic against magical assaults. Perhaps tied to a forgotten god or powerful ice witch.
column4: Grants magic resist and reduces incoming magic damage. Provides a burst of damage upon taking enough magic damage.
column5: Wearer gains +3 to saves vs. spells. If targeted by a harmful spell, unleash a shock dealing 1d6 cold damage to the caster.
column7: While wearing this helm, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Additionally, you have resistance to cold damage and can withstand extreme cold environments without penalty. The helm also grants you the ability to cast the *Absorb Elements* spell once per long rest.

column3: Favored by those scaling the mountain, rumored to be blessed by ancient aspects for protection.
column4: Disables nearby enemy turrets for a short duration, allowing for safer sieges.
column5: Once per day, emit a pulse. Stone and metal constructs nearby become inert for 1d4 rounds. A save versus magic negates.
column7: This adamantine warhammer grants you advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks made to climb. Additionally, as an action, you can strike a Large or smaller construct or object. That construct or object must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of your next turn. You can use this ability three times, regaining all expended uses at dawn.

column3: Crafted by a reclusive Ionian bladesmith, rumored to have ties to the ancient teachings of the Kinkou Order.
column4: Dashes empower your next attack to slow the target and deal bonus damage.
column5: On a hit after dashing, target must SAVE vs DEX or be slowed (treat as entangled), and take +1d6 damage. User is momentarily winded (-1 to next roll).
column7: This +2 Shortsword hums with a subtle energy. Once per day, as a bonus action, you can speak the sword's command word to imbue it with the Swiftness of Oponn. For the next minute, your movement speed doubles, and you gain advantage on Dexterity saving throws.

column3: Potentially used by Demacian mageseekers to detect hidden magic or illusions. Could be associated with Sylas's escape.
column4: Grants true sight, revealing invisible units and disabling enemy wards for a short duration.
column5: Reveals invisible creatures and traps. Grants advantage on saving throws vs. illusions. Causes a burning sensation when near magical items and spellcasters.
column7: When you drink this shimmering, silver liquid, you gain the benefits of the See Invisibility spell for 1 hour. Additionally, for the same duration, you have advantage on saving throws against illusions and on Wisdom (Insight) checks made to detect deception. As a bonus action, you can end the effect early to cast Detect Magic, requiring no components.

column3: Forged on Targon, rumored to ward against celestial trickery or the gaze of Aspects. Sought after by those who deal with cosmic entities.
column4: Grants magic resistance. Passively grants immunity to magic damage every 90 seconds.
column5: Wearer is +3 to saves vs. illusion and mind-affecting magic. Once per day, wearer ignores the effects of a single harmful spell that targets them.
column7: While wearing this hood, you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened by celestial beings or effects originating from the Astral Plane. Additionally, you gain a +3 bonus to Wisdom (Insight) checks made to discern the true nature of celestials and aberrations. Once per day, when you fail a saving throw against a celestial effect, you can choose to succeed instead.

column3: Likely forged in the Freljord, possibly tied to the Winter's Claw or another ice-based faction. Grants resilience in harsh conditions.
column4: Grants bonus health, mana, and ability haste. Transforms into Fimbulwinter when meeting certain conditions.
column5: Grants +3 to saves vs. cold, provides 1 ration of food per day, and once per day, creates a barrier of ice that absorbs 1d6 damage. If broken, the Orb shatters, becoming useless.
column7: While holding this orb, you are immune to the effects of extreme cold. Additionally, you can cast the 'ice storm' spell once per day, using your Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17). The orb regains its ability to cast 'ice storm' at dawn.

column3: Favored by Noxian arena champions, Overlord's Bloodmail is a testament to brutal strength and the will to dominate, embodying the empire's values.
column4: Grants health, attack damage, and temporary bonus health/size on takedown.
column5: Wearer gains +3 hit points. On slaying a foe, swell to ogre-size for 1d4 turns (+1 to hit, -1 AC). Afterwards, must SAVE vs. Poison or be Exhausted.
column7: This suit of plate armor is forged from blackened steel and etched with stylized depictions of brutal combat. While wearing this armor, you gain the following benefits: You have advantage on Strength saving throws and Strength checks. When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can use your reaction to deal an extra 2d6 necrotic damage to the target and gain temporary hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

column3: Forged in the icy heart of the Freljord, these pauldrons are rumored to have been worn by a forgotten Iceborn warrior.
column4: Immobilizing an enemy grants bonus armor and magic resist to nearby allies.
column5: When wearer freezes a foe, allies gain +2 AC and +1 to saves vs. magic for 3 turns. The pauldrons whisper forgotten battle tactics.
column7: These pauldrons are crafted from shimmering ice that never melts. While wearing these pauldrons, you gain resistance to cold damage. As an action, you can summon a blizzard in a 20-foot radius centered on you. The blizzard lasts for 1 minute, and the area within it is heavily obscured. Any creature that starts its turn in the blizzard or enters it for the first time on a turn must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take 4d6 cold damage. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until the next dawn.

column3: Said to be blessed by the Zephyr winds of Ionia, granting the wearer unnatural agility and speed. Perhaps a connection to a wind spirit.
column4: +25 Attack Damage, +25% Attack Speed, +10% Cooldown Reduction, +10% Movement Speed.
column5: Grants +1 to DEX. Once per day, reroll a failed DEX saving throw. Subject to whims of weather, storms may hinder its power (-1 DEX in strong winds).
column7: While wearing this pendant, your base walking speed increases by 10 feet, and you have advantage on Dexterity saving throws against effects that you can see. In addition, you can cast the Feather Fall spell once per long rest without using a spell slot.

column3: Forged in Demacia, rumored to be blessed by Kayle. Grants brief invulnerability, favored by mages escaping Noxian ambushes.
column4: Grants temporary invulnerability, rendering the champion unable to move or act during the stasis.
column5: Allows the user to briefly step outside of time, becoming untouchable but unable to act. Roll a d6; on a 1, you are shunted to a random point in time.
column7: This stopwatch has 3 charges. As an action, you can expend 1 charge to become invulnerable to all damage for 1 round. At the end of your next turn, you become stunned until the end of your next turn. The stopwatch regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

column3: Favored by lowborn arena fighters in Noxus, the Phage's brutal design reflects the region's harsh gladiatorial traditions and thirst for blood.
column4: Grants bonus health and attack damage. Attacks grant a temporary movement speed bonus.
column5: Upon a hit, chance to inflict 'momentum'. Momentum grants +1 to movement and attack rolls for 1 round. If already affected by momentum, target must save vs. STR or be knocked prone.
column7: This brutal weapon grants +1 to attack and damage rolls. On a hit, the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or have disadvantage on the next attack roll they make before the end of their next turn.

column3: Favored by ascetics and wandering mystics in Targon seeking enlightenment. Often found near sites of great contemplation.
column4: Grants health regeneration and mana regeneration.
column5: Wearer recovers 1d4 hit points and 1d4 mana each turn. While meditating, recovery is doubled. May attract celestial beings or maddening whispers from beyond.
column7: While wearing this medallion, you gain advantage on Wisdom saving throws. Additionally, once per long rest, when you fail a Wisdom saving throw, you can choose to succeed instead. The medallion then loses this property until the next dawn.

column3: Whispers link it to a forgotten Ionian wind spirit, granting swiftness to those deemed worthy. Some believe it responds to inner peace.
column4: Grants bonus move speed and magic resistance after casting your ultimate, decaying over time.
column5: Upon unleashing a potent spell, move with unnatural speed (+2 to initiative, +10' movement) and resist magic. Save vs. magic or speed wanes after 3 rounds.
column7: This item grants the wearer a +1 bonus to their initiative rolls and increases their movement speed by 10 feet. As a bonus action, the wearer can also grant themselves advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks until the end of their turn. Once used, this bonus action can't be used again until the start of the wearer's next turn.

column3: Likely plundered from a rival pirate crew or a foolish merchant vessel, hinting at the unscrupulous nature of Bilgewater's inhabitants.
column4: Restores health over time.
column5: Quaffing this murky brew grants +4 hit points over 1d4 turns. Side effects may include scurvy, sea shanties and uncontrollable greed.
column7: When you drink this potion, you regain 2d4 + 2 hit points. This potion's color swirls with shades of murky green and smells faintly of brine and regret.

column3: Likely stolen from a rival pirate crew or found in a hidden cove, used to scout out enemies.
column4: Places a temporary, invisible ward, revealing the surrounding area for a short duration.
column5: Creates a magical sensor, revealing invisible creatures or pathways, lasts 6 turns. Range: 60'. Detects illusions, shadows, or magical traps.
column7: This small, magically imbued totem can be planted as an action. For the next 8 hours, the ward is invisible and emits a pulse out to a 60-foot radius. Any creature entering this radius is clearly visible, and you are alerted to their presence (but not their location) if you are within 1 mile of the ward. A ward has an AC of 10, 1 hit point, and is immune to poison and psychic damage. It can be destroyed.

column3: Favored by Noxian assassins, the dirk is often used to secure bounties. The dirk is rumored to be crafted from metal sourced from a fallen darkin.
column4: Killing large monsters grants bonus gold and empowers your next attack.
column5: Upon slaying a beast, gain +1 to your next attack roll. If the beast has 3+ HD, also gain 1d6 gold. Gold disappears at the end of the day.
column7: This dagger is a magic weapon. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. Additionally, once per long rest, when you hit a creature with this dagger that is below half of its maximum hit points, you can choose to deal an additional 3d6 necrotic damage. If you do so, you gain advantage on all Wisdom (Survival) checks made to track that creature for the next 24 hours.

column3: Poro-Snax are beloved by poros, creatures native to the Freljord, often found around hearths and ancient ruins. Feeding them strengthens their bond.
column4: Summoner's Rift: Feeds a poro, making it grow. Howling Abyss: Throws a Poro-Snax, which poros will run towards.
column5: Creatures fed Poro-Snax become docile. A single snax thrown can distract beasts up to Huge size. A hoard of such creatures could be used as distractions or living walls.
column7: A delicious treat adored by poros. As an action, you can feed a Poro-Snax to a friendly Poro. The poro becomes especially loyal and helpful, granting you advantage on one Wisdom (Animal Handling) check you make to interact with it within the next hour. Alternatively, if no poros are present, consuming a Poro-Snax yourself grants you advantage on the next Wisdom (Survival) check you make to navigate through snowy or icy terrain within the next hour.

column3: Whispers say the Pox Arcana was penned by a hemomancer seeking to weaponize disease for the empire.
column4: Dealing ability damage applies a stacking poison that deals magic damage over time.
column5: Target suffers -1 to saves vs. poison/disease per stack. At 3 stacks, target must save vs. death or be stricken with a wasting illness, taking 1d4 damage per day until cured.
column7: This ancient tome is rumored to contain vile hemomantic rituals capable of weaponizing disease. While holding the Pox Arcana, you can cast the Contagion spell once per long rest without expending a spell slot. Additionally, you gain advantage on saving throws against contracting diseases, and whenever you successfully inflict a creature with the poisoned condition, the duration of the condition is doubled.

column3: Forged atop Mount Targon, it resonates with celestial power. Might have connection with the Solari or Lunari.
column4: Deals bonus damage based on max health, heals based on damage dealt, and grants bonus armor/MR based on health.
column5: Grants +2 AC per 10 HP. Strikes deal +1 damage per character level. User heals 1d4 HP per successful hit. Undead flee if damage exceeds their current HP.
column7: Forged on the summit of Mount Targon, this weapon pulses with celestial energy. While attuned to Primordial Dawn, you can use a bonus action to cause it to emit bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. As an action, you can call upon the weapon's power to cast the Sunbeam spell (save DC 17) once per day. The weapon deals an extra 1d8 radiant damage to any creature that is vulnerable to sunlight.

column3: Whispers say Priscilla, a forgotten noble, blessed it for her champions. Now it is a symbol of cruel ambition, sought by those craving power.
column4: Grants bonus attack speed and movement speed after scoring a takedown.
column5: Upon a kill, wearer gains +1 to attack rolls and +2" movement for 1d4 rounds. On a critical failure wearer is stunned for 1 round.
column7: This dark amulet is said to have been blessed by a forgotten Noxian noble. While wearing Priscilla's Blessing, you gain advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks. Additionally, once per day, when you reduce a creature to 0 hit points, you can gain temporary hit points equal to the creature's challenge rating. These temporary hit points last for 1 hour. If the creature was a humanoid, you also learn one piece of information about its deepest desires or fears.

column3: The blade is rumored to have been forged in the Freljord, possibly by a forgotten tribe seeking to claim new lands and resources.
column4: Grants bonus attack damage and a passive gold generation effect while last hitting minions.
column5: The blade whispers secrets of nearby wealth (veins of ore, monster lairs). On a successful parry, the wielder can detect hidden passages within 30 ft for 1 round.
column7: This finely crafted blade hums with a faint, icy energy. Once per day, when you hit a creature with this sword, you can choose to have the attack deal an extra 2d6 cold damage and reduce the creature's speed by 10 feet until the end of its next turn. The blade is rumored to lead the wielder to caches of valuable ore and precious gems, revealing hidden veins and deposits within a 1-mile radius while attuned.

column3: Associated with Viktor, and the founding of the Glorious Evolution. Could be tied to the Spirit of Innovation, if Ionia ever focused on tech.
column4: Provides stats and can be upgraded to enhance Viktor's abilities.
column5: Grants +1 to a stat chosen at dawn. Each upgrade permanently enhances a specific skill; roll 1d6 to determine which. On a 6, instead, a random other player suffers -1 to a stat of your choice.
column7: This intricate device pulses with arcane energy and strange potential. As an action, you can expend a hit die to infuse the Hex Core with your life force, granting you one of the following benefits for 1 minute: Advantage on Intelligence checks and saving throws; Resistance to lightning damage; or the ability to cast the *shocking grasp* cantrip, even if you don't know it. You can only have one benefit active at a time. Further experimentation may unlock additional enhancements.

column3: Whispers claim these threads are spun from the souls of the damned, granting control over the living.
column4: Charm an enemy champion, forcing them to attack their allies for a short duration.
column5: On a failed save, puppeted creature attacks nearest ally (50% chance of target). Save allowed each round. Puppeteer takes 1d4 damage for each round of control.
column7: This tangled skein of ghostly threads grants the user control over the bodies of others. As an action, you can target one humanoid within 30 feet that you can see. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you for 1 minute. While charmed in this way, you can use a bonus action on each of your turns to mentally command the target to move up to its speed and perform one simple action that it would normally be capable of. At the end of each of its turns, the target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that succeeds on this saving throw is immune to the effects of the Puppeteer for 24 hours.

column3: Favored by Ionian monks seeking clarity and protection from outside influences. It is sometimes seen amongst travelling merchants in Bilgewater.
column4: Removes all crowd control effects. Grants brief immunity to further crowd control.
column5: Grants a save versus enchantment/charm effects. If successful, you are also freed from any current bindings, petrification, or paralysis. Lasts 1 round.
column7: While wearing this sash, you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, frightened, or possessed. Additionally, as a reaction when you fail a saving throw against an effect that would charm, frighten, or possess you, you can choose to succeed instead. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

column3: Favored by mages in Ionia, Rabadon's Deathcrown is a symbol of magical prowess and deep understanding of arcane energies, possibly connected to the spirit realm.
column4: Massively increases Ability Power, amplifying the potency of magical abilities.
column5: Wearer gains +5 to Magic Saves. Spells cast inflict +1 damage die. But take -1 on saves vs. illusions as the crown clouds mind with visions.
column7: While wearing this crown, your spell attack bonus and spell save DC each increase by 2. In addition, the damage dice of your spells are maximized (e.g., a d6 becomes a 6). Once per long rest, when you cast a spell of 5th level or lower, you can cast it as if using a spell slot one level higher.

column3: Favored by Ionian spirit walkers, it aids traversing untamed lands, ensuring harmony with nature's path.
column4: Grants bonus experience from large monsters and increased mana regeneration in the jungle.
column5: Allows safe passage through the wilderness. When used, roll 1d6, on a 1-2 attract a monster, 3-4 find herbs, 5-6 move twice as far.
column7: While wearing these boots, you ignore difficult terrain. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can expend 1 charge to cast the *pass without trace* spell. The boots have 3 charges and regain 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn. While wearing these boots and attuned to nature, you gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to navigate or track.

column3: Favored by scouts patrolling Demacia's borders, allowing for faster movement between outposts.
column4: Grants movement speed near turrets and increased health regeneration when damaged by enemy champions.
column5: Wearer moves swiftly near fortifications. Incoming attacks mend flesh (+2hp/round) so long as attacker is visible.
column7: While wearing this cloak, your speed increases by 10 feet. Additionally, you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to move silently through natural environments.

column3: Rectrix, a quill from a celestial being, perhaps related to the Aspect of Justice or Judgment.
column4: Empowers the next three spells cast, granting bonus damage and reducing mana cost.
column5: Next 3 spells cast are at +1 to cast and are automatically known. If spell is unknown, there is a 1-in-6 chance to forget it after casting.
column7: This quill, plucked from a celestial being, radiates a faint aura of justice. While holding the Rectrix, you gain advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks. Additionally, once per long rest, you can use the quill to cast the Zone of Truth spell (DC 15).

column3: Associated with the celestial, embodying sacrifice and healing, perhaps linked to the Aspect of the Host.
column4: Heals allies in an area after a delay. Can be used while dead.
column5: Activate to call upon divine intervention. 3d6 HP restored to those within a 30' radius after 2 rounds. Usable from beyond the veil, but taxes the soul: User takes 1d4 damage.
column7: This sacred amulet embodies sacrifice and healing. As an action, you can touch a creature and expend a charge to heal it for 4d6 hit points. Additionally, if a creature within 30 feet of you drops to 0 hit points, you can expend a charge as a reaction to cause it to instead drop to 1 hit point. The amulet has 3 charges and regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

column3: Commonly used by travelers and adventurers, rumored to be brewed with rare Ionian herbs known for their restorative properties.
column4: Slowly restores health over a short duration, providing sustain in lane or during skirmishes.
column5: Drink: Restore 2d4 hit points over 1 turn. May make a DC 13 Con save to avoid nausea and vomiting, losing any potential additional healing from this potion.
column7: When you drink this potion, you regain 4d4 hit points. In addition, for the next minute, you regain 1 hit point at the start of each of your turns (10 hit points total). This potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

column3: Likely originating from the frozen wastes, rumored to contain essence of the ancient ice witch.
column4: Grants health regeneration, restoring a small amount of health per second.
column5: Wearer recovers 1d3 hit points per turn. If worn in extreme cold, healing is doubled; in extreme heat, healing is halved. May attract the attention of ice spirits.
column7: This bead is frigid to the touch, and faintly glows with frost. As an action, you can crush the bead, releasing its energy. You regain 2d8 + 2 hit points, and are cured of one disease or poison affecting you.

column3: Favored by frontline soldiers of Demacia, it is often used by those who fight alongside weaker allies, or when defending fortifications.
column4: Grants gold and heals allies when nearby minions are executed. Grants bonus health and health regeneration.
column5: When a blow would fell an ally, instead steel yourself and absorb the impact. Your ally is spared, and you gain vitality, becoming hale and hearty. Grants +2 to HP, and slowly recover 1 lost HP per turn.
column7: While holding this shield, when a creature within 5 feet of you takes damage, you can use your reaction to transfer half of the damage (rounded up) to yourself. You must be able to see the creature. Additionally, while wielding this shield, you have advantage on saving throws against effects that would knock you prone.

column3: Associated with Targon's ascended, granting enhanced mana regeneration and ability power.
column4: Grants ability haste, mana regeneration, and bonus health. Provides a ward.
column5: Upon attuning, the wielder recovers mana quickly. Once per day, may summon a spectral sentinel to watch over a location. Sentinel disappears after 8 hours or when danger is present.
column7: While holding this remnant, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC increases by 2. Additionally, you regain 1 sorcery point or 1 expended spell slot of 3rd level or lower upon finishing a short or long rest. Once you use this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.

column3: Linked to the Watchers, ancient beings of the Freljordian ice, offering glimpses into their chilling power.
column4: Provides health, mana regeneration, ability haste, and a ward-placing active.
column5: Grants the wearer visions of the past, present, and possible futures. User risks madness as the visions are cold and uncaring. Save vs. Insanity each use.
column7: While holding this remnant, you have resistance to cold damage and advantage on saving throws against being frightened. As an action, you can attempt to freeze a creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The creature must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or become restrained for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, the restrained creature can make another Constitution saving throw. On a success, the effect ends. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

column3: Riftmaker is likely tied to the Black Rose, an organization known for dark magic and manipulating rifts for their own purposes.
column4: Damage converts to true damage; healing scales with damage dealt.
column5: Bonds the user to an otherworldly entity. 1/day, convert damage to bypass armor. Accumulate corruption; upon reaching a threshold, heal HP equal to corruption. Risk: attracts unwanted attention from beyond.
column7: This dark artifact grants you a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls with spells. Whenever you deal damage with a spell, you regain hit points equal to 1d6 + your spellcasting ability modifier. Additionally, you ignore resistance to necrotic damage. This item is cursed. Becoming attuned to this item extends the attunement duration indefinitely. While attuned, at the end of each long rest, you must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or gain one level of exhaustion.

column3: Forged in the bitter cold, said to be able to freeze the very ground on which battles are fought. Possibly linked to the Ice Witch.
column4: Empowers the next attack to deal bonus damage and create a temporary frost area that slows enemies.
column5: Attack deals +1d6 cold damage. Target must Save vs. Cold or be slowed (half movement) for 1d4 rounds. Ground freezes: difficult terrain in a 10' radius.
column7: This gauntlet, perpetually cold to the touch, is forged from ice that never melts. While wearing the gauntlet, you can use an action to freeze a 15-foot cone of ground in front of you. This area becomes difficult terrain. Additionally, any creature that starts its turn or enters the area for the first time on a turn must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have its movement speed reduced by half until the end of its next turn. The ice melts after 1 minute. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until the next dawn.
