column3: Forged in the heart of Targon, infused with celestial energies, it whispers forgotten truths to those who dare listen. Grants resilience in prolonged battles.
column4: Grants health, mana, and ability power that increase over time.
column5: Heal 1d6 hit points per turn, recover 1d4 mana. On a roll of '1' for either, hear a fragment of forgotten lore. DM determines relevance.
column7: This rod, pulsing with a faint celestial light, whispers secrets of ages past to its wielder. The rod has 10 charges and regains 1d6+4 expended charges daily at dawn. While holding the rod, you can expend charges to gain the following benefits: (1 charge) You gain advantage on one Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw. (3 charges) You regain 2d8 hit points. (5 charges) You cast the 'Greater Restoration' spell. If you listen to the whispers of the rod for at least 1 hour each day, you gain one level of exhaustion at the end of the hour, but also gain resistance to psychic damage until the next dawn.

column3: Forged atop Mount Targon, it resonates with celestial energy. It might be linked to the Aspect of Twilight, enhancing map awareness.
column4: Provides health and allows placement of Stealth Wards, granting vision in an area.
column5: Confers +1 to Wisdom checks. Allows the user to cast 'See Invisible' once per day. The caster can see ethereal watchers for 8 turns if a WIS save is failed.
column7: This crimson stone, warm to the touch, grants unparalleled awareness of your surroundings. As an action, you can touch a point within 60 feet of you. For the next hour, you know the location of all creatures within a 30-foot radius of that point. This ability pierces magical darkness and nonmagical barriers, but is blocked by one foot of stone, one inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until the next dawn. While attuned to the Ruby Sightstone, you are immune to the blinded condition.

column3: Likely forged by ancient Iceborn, the Runecarver's etchings resonate with forgotten glacial magic and Freljordian spirits. Could be associated with Lissandra.
column4: Empowers basic attacks with bonus magic damage and grants movement speed on hit.
column5: On a hit, target must save versus magic or be slowed for 1 round. Grants +1 to hit rolls against creatures with the 'Ice' descriptor.
column7: This weapon pulses with ancient glacial magic. Once per long rest, when you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, you can choose to deal an extra 6d6 cold damage to the target and force it to make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target is also restrained for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

column3: Likely a relic of the ancient Iceborn, perhaps used in rituals to consume the power of primal runes.
column4: Restores health and mana. Deals bonus magic damage. Increases max health.
column5: Wearer heals 1d6 HP/Mana per turn. Attacks inflict +1 magic damage. Max HP permanently increased by 5 after combat where at least one foe is slain.
column7: This relic radiates a faint aura of consumed power. When you use this item to absorb a magic rune or magical effect (DM's discretion), you gain temporary hit points equal to five times the level of the spell or effect consumed. These temporary hit points last for 1 hour. Additionally, for the next minute, your weapon attacks deal an extra 1d6 force damage.

column3: Favored by Demacian sentinels, this bulwark's runes deflect magic. Some whisper it was crafted by mageseekers, a twisted irony.
column4: Provides magic resistance to the wielder and nearby allies.
column5: Confers +2 to saves vs. magic. Allies within 30' gain +1 to saves. However, the bulwark hums with suppressed magic - a failed save results in a wild magic surge (GM's discretion).
column7: While holding this shield, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Additionally, once per day, when you are targeted by a spell, you can use your reaction to attempt to absorb the spell's energy. Make a DC 15 Charisma saving throw. On a success, the spell has no effect on you, and you regain a number of hit points equal to the spell's level x 5.

column3: Echoes resonate with Ionian spirit magic, amplifying spellcasting. Potentially tied to ancient monasteries or spirit realms.
column4: Grants magic damage on spell cast and bonus movement speed.
column5: Once per combat, after casting a spell, deal +1d6 magic damage with subsequent attacks, and move +10' for 1 round. Save vs. Magic or attract unwanted attention from spirits.
column7: This arcane focus pulses with Ionian spirit magic. While holding this focus, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DC. Additionally, once per long rest, when you cast a spell that deals damage, you can choose to deal an additional 2d6 force damage to one target within 30 feet of the original target. This additional damage is considered magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity.

column3: Associated with monks of Ionia seeking enlightenment and inner peace, enhancing their connection to the spirit realm.
column4: Grants AP and mana, restoring mana on spell cast.
column5: Wearer can cast spells more often. 1-in-6 chance a spell cast doesn't expend a charge. The wearer experiences vivid dreams, potentially receiving cryptic advice.
column7: This ring hums with tranquil energy. While wearing this ring, you have advantage on Wisdom saving throws. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can expend a hit die to regain a number of hit points equal to the die roll + your Wisdom modifier. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1) per long rest.

column3: Forged in the desert's heart, it whispers of ancient Ascended, their power now sand. A relic of forgotten empires.
column4: Grants a shield and a dash that empowers the next attack to deal bonus damage.
column5: Once per day, create a sand simulacrum to scout ahead. If broken, the next strike deals +1d6 damage, revealing weakness.
column7: This ancient claw, imbued with the power of fallen Ascended, grants potent abilities. The claw is a +2 magical melee weapon. When you hit a creature with it, you can force the target to make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target gains one level of exhaustion. On a successful save, the target takes 2d6 necrotic damage. This effect can only be used once per turn.

column3: Implies a dark pact or ritual sacrifice within Noxus, possibly connected to the Crimson Circle or similar hemomancy cult.
column4: Bonus attack damage that scales with bonus health.
column5: Upon striking a foe, gain +1 to hit and damage rolls equal to your lost hit points. Upon reaching 0 hp, immediately die. The bargain is struck, but the blood price is absolute.
column7: This dark gift, pulsing with crimson energy, is bestowed upon those who enter into a pact with entities of pure hemomancy. While attuned to this gift, whenever you deal damage with a spell or weapon attack, you can choose to regain a number of hit points equal to half the damage dealt (rounded up). This effect can only be used once per turn. However, at the end of each long rest, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or gain one level of exhaustion as the gift demands its due.

column3: A relic from the Shadow Isles, possibly tied to ancient rituals enhancing predator instincts. It is tied to the hunger of the void.
column4: On-hit, grants phantom hits, dealing bonus damage and applying on-hit effects a second time.
column5: Upon striking a foe, a spectral tendril lashes out, seeking another nearby enemy. Roll a d6. On a 1, the tendril turns on the wielder, dealing 1d4 damage.
column7: This grotesque amulet, reeking of voidal energies, grants the wearer an insatiable hunger for power. While attuned to the Sated Devourer, you gain the following benefits: Your Strength score increases by 4, to a maximum of 24. Whenever you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level. These temporary hit points last for 1 minute. After a long rest you must consume the life force of a beast or humanoid by succeeding on a DC 16 grapple check, or suffer two levels of exhaustion.

column3: Favored by young Demacian soldiers for practice. Its simple design reflects Demacia's value of resourcefulness and practicality.
column4: Damaging enemy champions grants a burst of movement speed.
column5: Hurl a pebble with unnatural speed and accuracy. If it strikes true, you are granted +1 to initiative on your next turn as you exploit your foe's distraction.
column7: A masterfully crafted slingshot, imbued with the spirit of Demacian resourcefulness. This weapon grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. When you use this slingshot to make a ranged attack against a creature, you can choose to forgo adding your proficiency bonus to the attack roll. If you do so and the attack hits, the creature is knocked prone.

column3: Used by Demacian scouts to survey enemy positions. It could reveal hidden Noxian camps or Freljordian raiding parties before they strike.
column4: Periodically reveal a small area at a distance.
column5: Grants a fleeting glimpse through the veil of distance. 1/Day: See a 30ft radius area within 1 mile, but risk attracting unwanted attention (GM's discretion).
column7: This Demacian-made crystal orb allows the user to cast the Scrying spell without expending a spell slot. Once attuned, you may cast the Scrying spell once per day. Additionally, while holding the orb, you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks made to detect hidden creatures or objects within 30 feet.

column3: Forged in Noxus, rumored to have ties to the Black Rose, offering protection to mages delving into forbidden magic.
column4: Grants armor and ability power, increasing armor gained upon killing enemy units.
column5: The wearer gains +2 AC. Upon slaying a foe, gain +1 AC (max +15) until end of session. If AC reaches 15, wearer must save vs. magic or be controlled by arcane whispers.
column7: This dark iron armguard, etched with arcane symbols, grants its wearer a +2 bonus to AC. While wearing the armguard, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects. Additionally, as a reaction when you are hit by a spell attack, you can absorb some of the spell's energy, gaining temporary hit points equal to the spell's level.

column3: Associated with undeath and pain, possibly linked to the Black Mist or souls trapped within the Shadow Isles.
column4: Deals damage based on missing health, and heals the user.
column5: On hit, target takes +1d6 necrotic damage per 10% health missing. User heals for damage dealt. Undead are immune to the damage, healing the user instead.
column7: This shard of pure darkness radiates a chilling aura. While holding it, you are resistant to necrotic damage and your hit point maximum cannot be reduced. Once per day, as an action, you can unleash the shard's power, forcing each creature within 30 feet to make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take 3d6 necrotic damage and become frightened of you for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. The shard whispers to you in your dreams, urging you to embrace despair.

column3: Forged in the Freljord, perhaps by a forgotten Ice Witch or a master blacksmith of the Winter's Claw. Grants lethality and armor penetration.
column4: Provides armor penetration and a slowing effect on damaging abilities.
column5: Ranged attacks cripple foes, reducing movement by 1/4 for 1d4 rounds, and ignores 20% of metal armor. The wielder gains +2 to hit armored foes.
column7: This Freljordian weapon grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls. When you hit a creature with this weapon, the attack deals an extra 2d6 cold damage and the target must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or have its speed reduced by 20 feet until the end of its next turn. Additionally, attacks made with this weapon ignore resistance to piercing damage and treat immunity as resistance.

column3: Potentially tied to Lissandra or other Iceborn, grants vision and slows enemies. Once held immense power now a fragment.
column4: Slows nearby enemies on ability cast. Grants bonus move speed and vision when near enemies.
column5: Enemies failing a save vs. magic suffer -2 to hit. Those fleeing are easily tracked. Grants fleeting visions of enemies in the fog and snow.
column7: This shard pulses with ancient ice magic. As an action, you can touch the shard to a point within 60 feet. A spectral eye appears there, granting you and your allies vision of that area for 1 minute. Additionally, once per day, you can cast the Slow spell (save DC 15) from the shard. While holding the shard, you have resistance to cold damage.

column3: Forged in Demacia, Sheen's magic resonates with righteousness, empowering the wielder's next strike with amplified force.
column4: After using an ability, the next attack deals bonus magic damage.
column5: On a hit, add +1d6 magic damage. This bonus damage will only trigger after casting a spell. The magic damage can be resisted as normal. The bonus lasts a single round.
column7: This polished stone hums with righteous energy. Once per short rest, when you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend a spell slot as a bonus action. The attack deals an extra 2d8 radiant damage per level of the spell slot expended. If you have no spell slots, you can use this effect once per long rest to deal 2d8 radiant damage.

column3: Likely crafted by Demacian artificers, perhaps enchanted by mages, for scouting and defense against unseen threats in the wilderness.
column4: Periodically grants a shield, offering temporary protection from damage.
column5: Once per day, grants +2 AC against a single attack. If that attack misses, the Totem is depleted of power.
column7: While holding this shield, you can use a bonus action to activate it, granting yourself and each ally within 30 feet of you temporary hit points equal to your level + your proficiency bonus. These temporary hit points last for 1 minute. Once used, the shield can't be used again until the next dawn.

column3: Associated with the Aspects of Targon, channeling celestial energies and offering protection to allies through ethereal shields and swiftness.
column4: Grants movement speed and empowers allies with a shield upon activation.
column5: Caster and nearby allies gain +2 to save vs. fear and move 50% faster for 3 turns. After effect ends, caster must save vs. WIS DC 13 or be stunned for 1 turn.
column7: This holy symbol allows you to cast the Shield spell at will, without expending a spell slot. Additionally, as an action, you can invoke the Reverie, granting all allies within 30 feet of you advantage on Dexterity saving throws and increasing their movement speed by 15 feet for 1 minute. Once you use this action, you cannot do so again until you complete a long rest.

column3: Forged in the icy heart of the Freljord, rumored to be able to weaken even a Watcher's grip. Grants tenacity and cleanse effects.
column4: Provides Tenacity, and a single-use active to remove all debuffs.
column5: Grants +2 to saves versus charm and hold effects. Once per day, negate a magical effect that impairs movement or thought; this action is resolved before the effect.
column7: While holding this weapon, you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. As an action, you can unleash the Silvermere Dawn, ending one condition (blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, paralyzed, or poisoned) affecting you. Additionally, for the next minute, you have advantage on saving throws against effects that would impose any of those conditions on you. Once used, this ability can't be used again until the next dawn.

column3: Favored by Ionian duelists and pit fighters, enhancing their combat prowess in skirmishes. Some say it whispers secrets of forgotten techniques.
column4: Challenge a champion, reducing their damage to you and granting bonus damage on hit.
column5: Upon striking true, mark a foe. They suffer -2 to hit you, but you gain +1 to hit them and deal +2 damage. Lasts until sundown.
column7: This elegant sabre hums with latent energy. While wielding this weapon, you gain a +2 bonus to initiative rolls. Additionally, once per turn when you hit a creature with an attack using this sabre, you can choose to move up to half your speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

column3: Likely acquired through less-than-reputable means in Bilgewater, perhaps involving deals with the Buhru or illicit ventures in the Serpent Isles.
column4: Grants bonus gold on minion kill. Limited uses.
column5: Each use grants the bearer advantage on one haggling roll as if filled with plundered coin. Risk: On a fumble, the sack bursts, revealing fool's gold.
column7: This seemingly ordinary sack is charmed to produce more gold. Once per day, when you reach into the sack, it contains 1d20 + 50 gold pieces. However, there is a 10% chance that instead of gold, the sack contains a non-magical poisonous snake (use the stats for a Poisonous Snake from the Monster Manual) that immediately attacks.

column3: Favored by Ionian mages seeking to enhance their connection to the spirit realm and empower their spellcasting.
column4: Grants magic penetration, allowing spells to deal more damage by bypassing enemy magic resistance.
column5: Wearer's spells ignore some magical defenses. Spells cast do +1 damage per level of the caster. Save vs. Magic or be stunned for 1 round after casting a spell through the shoes.
column7: While wearing these elegant shoes, your spell save DC increases by 2. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can teleport up to 15 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

column3: Said to be forged in the soulfires of the Black Rose, the Soul Sickle corrupts the wielder with dark intent and insatiable hunger.
column4: Grants bonus attack damage and mana regeneration. Killing minions grants bonus gold.
column5: Upon glutting on souls, wielder must test WIS or attack nearest creature. Grants +1 to hit and damage rolls. Failsafe: Upon death, Soul Sickle animates and attacks nearest non-wielder.
column7: This magical sickle, rumored to be forged in the soulfires of the Black Rose, whispers dark promises to its wielder. While holding the Soul Sickle, you have disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws against being charmed or frightened. Additionally, once per day, when you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this sickle, you gain temporary hit points equal to the creature's maximum hit points. These temporary hit points last for 1 hour.

column3: A relic of the Shadow Isles, possibly connected to lost rituals of life and death, now corrupted by undeath.
column4: Grants spell vamp and on-hit damage, allowing the user to heal from damage dealt.
column5: Siphon life force from foes. A hit steals 1d4 HP, granting it to the wielder. Undead are immune; clerics resist.
column7: A chilling blade from the Shadow Isles. This magic cutlass deals an extra 1d6 necrotic damage on a hit. When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this weapon, you can choose to trap its soul. The soul remains trapped within the cutlass until you use an action to release it, or until the cutlass is destroyed. While a soul is trapped, you gain advantage on saving throws against being frightened. You can only have one soul trapped at a time.

column3: Associated with spirits and protection against malevolent magic, perhaps used by sentinels or those venturing into the Shadow Isles.
column4: Provides magic resistance and health regeneration, mitigating magic damage taken.
column5: Grants +2 to saves versus magic. Regenerate 1d3 hit points per turn unless damaged by fire, in which case, no regeneration.
column7: This ethereal cowl offers protection against the supernatural. While wearing the cowl, you have resistance to necrotic damage and advantage on saving throws against being possessed. Additionally, as an action, you can invoke the cowl to cast the Sanctuary spell (save DC 15) on yourself. Once used, this property cannot be used again until the next dawn.

column3: Favored by mageseekers, rumored to be forged from petricite, a stone that nullifies magic, originating from Demacia.
column4: Grants magic resist and attack damage. Passively grants a magic damage shield when near enemy champions.
column5: Wearer gains +3 to saves vs. magic. Once per day, may negate a magical attack, turning it back upon the caster. However, all subsequent magic attacks against the wearer gain +1 to hit.
column7: This rare shield is crafted from petricite, a stone that disrupts magic. While wielding this shield, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Additionally, as a reaction when a creature within 30 feet of you casts a spell, you can attempt to disrupt the spell. Make a DC 15 ability check using your choice of Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma. On a success, the spell fails and has no effect.

column3: Forged in the ancient glaciers, this item resonates with the strength and endurance of the Freljord's primal spirits and legendary golems.
column4: Bonus health, tenacity, and health regeneration for increased survivability in prolonged fights.
column5: Wearer gains +3 to saves vs. petrification and cold damage. Once per day, can ignore one critical hit. Slowly heals 1hp/round unless damaged.
column7: This very rare amulet pulses with the ancient magic of the Freljord. While wearing this amulet, your hit point maximum increases by 20. Additionally, you gain resistance to cold damage and have advantage on saving throws against being petrified. As an action, you can tap into the spirit of the golem, granting yourself temporary hit points equal to your level. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

column3: Associated with the Shadow Isles, potentially used by spectral beings or wraiths to enhance their magical abilities and sustain themselves.
column4: Provides magic damage, mana sustain, and life steal against monsters.
column5: User gains +2 to cast necromantic spells, recovers 1d4 hit points when draining life force from undead creatures. Potential risk of spectral possession on a fumble.
column7: This legendary artifact whispers with the chilling energy of the Shadow Isles. While holding this spectral orb, you gain the following benefits: Your hit point maximum increases by an amount equal to your level. You have resistance to necrotic damage. As a bonus action, you can become ethereal until the end of your next turn. While ethereal, you can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. You take 5 (1d10) force damage if you end your turn inside an object. Once you use this bonus action, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

column3: Associated with Ionian water spirits and the ebb and flow of magic, enhancing allies with its currents.
column4: Heals and shields grant bonus Ability Power and Ability Haste to the ally.
column5: Upon casting a healing or protective spell, the target gains +1 to cast magical spells and casts 1 round sooner as their magic is accelerated.
column7: This staff, crafted from a branch taken from a tree that grows only near sacred Ionian springs, is a conduit for potent water magic. While holding this staff, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC increases by 2. Additionally, as an action, you can unleash a surge of flowing water to heal one creature within 30 feet. The target regains hit points equal to 2d6 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This property can be used a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and all expended uses recharge daily at dawn.

column3: Forged with celestial magic, it resonates with champions touched by the stars, like Zoe or Aurelion Sol, amplifying their innate cosmic power.
column4: Empowers abilities, granting increased range and damage based on the user's bonus mana and AP.
column5: Upon attunement, the wielder's spells reach further and hit harder. Roll a d6; on a 1, the spell rebounds, affecting the caster instead.
column7: This instrument, imbued with the raw power of the cosmos, resonates with those touched by celestial forces. If you are a Celestial Warlock, Sorcerer with the Aberrant Mind or Divine Soul origin, or a Cleric of the Knowledge or Twilight Domain, you can use the Starcaster as a spellcasting focus. While wielding it, you gain a +3 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC increases by 3. Additionally, when you cast a spell that deals radiant damage, you can reroll any 1s on the damage dice, and must use the new result.

column3: Celestial power enhances champions, akin to the Aspect of Might's influence on chosen warriors.
column4: Provides adaptive force, scaling with bonus health, granting increased damage output and survivability.
column5: Upon wearing this item, the player gets +1 to hit and damage rolls. Furthermore, for every 10 hit points they have, they gain +1 to said rolls, as well as +1 to saving throws against fear.
column7: This grants a permanent +2 to one ability score of your choice, up to a maximum of 20. In addition, you gain proficiency in one skill associated with that ability (if you are already proficient, you gain expertise instead).

column3: Favored by Ionian monks seeking inner peace, it channels spiritual energy. Could be associated with the teachings of Karma.
column4: Grants magic resist and ability haste, scaling with mana spent.
column5: User gains +1 to saves versus spells. Each spell cast adds +1 to AC for 1 round. If AC exceeds 20, manifest a protective ward until end of next round.
column7: While holding this quarterstaff, you gain a +3 bonus to Wisdom saving throws. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can expend 1 ki point to gain advantage on the next saving throw you make before the end of your next turn. If you have no ki points, you can still gain advantage on the saving throw, but you suffer one level of exhaustion.

column3: Favored by Demacian soldiers. Bears the crest of a forgotten order of knights. Grants courage and resilience in battle.
column4: Grants health, health regeneration, and bonus gold on minion kills. Provides charges to consume for bonus damage.
column5: Wearer gains +1 to saves vs. fear and poison. Once per day, may expend a charge to deal +1d4 damage on a successful melee attack. Carries 3 charges, replenished at dawn.
column7: While wearing these shoulderguards, you have advantage on saving throws against being frightened. In addition, when you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail. Once per long rest, when you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can choose to drop to 1 hit point instead.

column3: Favored by Ionian monks, wards provide temporary protection and awareness, aiding in meditation and defense against wayward spirits.
column4: Places an invisible, fragile ward that grants vision in a small area for a short duration.
column5: Grants a brief glimpse of the unseen. Save versus WIS or attract unwanted attention from spirits. Ward decays after 1 turn, or instantly if touched by unnatural beings.
column7: As an action, you can plant the Stealth Ward at a point within 10 feet of you. The ward is invisible and lasts for 8 hours or until destroyed (AC 10, 1 hit point, immune to poison and psychic damage). While the ward is active, you are alerted if any creature comes within 30 feet of it. Additionally, you have advantage on Stealth checks while within 30 feet of the ward. You can have a maximum of three active wards at any time. If you plant a fourth, the oldest ward disappears.

column3: Favored by Ionian duelists, its quickening hum resonates with the spirit realm. Often used in ceremonies and duels to quicken the participants.
column4: Provides attack speed and ability haste, enhancing rapid strikes and spellcasting.
column5: Confers +1 to initiative. On a successful hit, target must save versus Paralysis or be unable to act next round. Stacks with haste spells for potentially devastating effect.
column7: This exquisitely balanced shortsword hums faintly when held. You gain a +1 bonus to initiative rolls. As a bonus action, you can speak the sword's command word to imbue it with spirit energy for 1 minute. While imbued, your movement speed increases by 10 feet, and you have advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks and saving throws.

column3: Forged in the icy peaks of the Freljord, channeling the raw power of lightning storms. Said to be wielded by ancient stormcallers.
column4: Empowers the next attack with bonus damage and slows the target.
column5: Next melee attack deals +1d6 lightning damage and target must SAVE vs Paralysis or be slowed (half move) for 1 round. Recharges only in electrical storm or after imbibing potion of speed.
column7: This greatsword crackles with potent electrical energy. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. Whenever you hit a creature with this weapon, that creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become stunned until the end of your next turn. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

column3: Favored by Noxian commanders for its brutal efficiency, allowing swift advances and crushing enemy lines. Potentially forged by the Black Rose.
column4: Deals damage and slows enemies on cast, also grants movement speed.
column5: On a hit, target must save versus STR or be knocked prone. Grants +1 to initiative when charging into combat or fleeing. Movement is doubled for a short time.
column7: This greataxe is a brutal weapon of war. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. As an action, you can slam the axe into the ground, creating a shockwave in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone and have their speed reduced by half until the end of your next turn. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the end of your next turn.

column3: Forged by a forgotten Ionian master, rumored to channel storm spirits. Its raw power is sought by those who desire unmatched striking speed.
column4: Empowers the next attack to deal bonus damage and slow the target.
column5: On a hit, the wielder's spirit leaves their body in the form of lightning, teleporting them 10' in a straight line and stunning any creature they pass through for 1 round.
column7: This magical longsword crackles with electrical energy. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. Once per short rest, when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can choose to deal an extra 2d6 lightning damage and the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of your next turn.

column3: Associated with Darius, though it may be a weapon used by other Noxian commanders to break enemy ranks and inspire fear.
column4: Deals damage and slows enemies on cast, also grants movement speed.
column5: Once per turn, slam the blade to inflict STR damage and reduce enemy movement to half for one round; 1/day, increase movement by 50% for one round.
column7: This massive greataxe grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. As an action, you can slam the axe into the ground, creating a shockwave in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone and have their speed reduced by half until the end of your next turn. You can use this ability three times, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. While wielding this axe, you have advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks.

column3: Forged with celestial fire, it is reminiscent of artifacts wielded by the Solari, warding off darkness.
column4: Deals continuous magic damage to nearby enemies, increased damage to monsters and minions.
column5: Grants a constant aura of heat, dealing 1d4 fire damage to those within melee range. Undead and creatures of the night suffer double damage.
column7: This radiant shield is forged from celestial metal. While holding this shield, you have resistance to fire damage and gain a +2 bonus to your AC. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can activate the Aegis's aura. While the aura is active, any creature within 10 feet of you takes 1d6 radiant damage at the start of each of its turns. The aura lasts for 1 minute, and you can't use this ability again until you finish a short or long rest.

column3: Likely crafted by Ionian spirit walkers, enhances magical bonds and connection. Perhaps used during meditation or communion with spirits.
column4: Grants bonus mana and ability haste, empowering the user's connection with their ally.
column5: Wearer can cast spells through a willing ally within 30ft. Ally takes half damage from the spell. Potential for disastrous backfires if the bond is broken mid-cast.
column7: While attuned to this amulet, once per long rest, when a creature within 30 feet that you can see takes damage, you can choose to take half of that damage instead, rounded down. Additionally, you gain advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks made to discern the emotional state of creatures you have a bond with.

column3: Likely created by a Noxian artificer, its crude construction suggests it's meant for frontline soldiers.
column4: Grants movement speed towards enemies, and an AOE slow upon reaching them.
column5: Move with unnatural speed toward a foe. Upon contact, those nearby must save vs. Paralysis or be slowed (half movement) for 1d4 rounds.
column7: This crude but effective device functions as a wondrous item. As an action, you can activate T.U.R.B.O., granting you the following benefits for 1 minute: Your movement speed doubles. You gain advantage on Strength checks and saving throws. At the end of each of your turns while T.U.R.B.O. is active, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of exhaustion. Once used, T.U.R.B.O. cannot be used again until the next dawn.

column3: Forged on Targon, this brace resonates with celestial power, assisting those who protect the vulnerable. Often used by the Rakkor.
column4: Grants health, health regeneration, and executes minions to grant gold to an ally.
column5: Wearer gains +1 to AC. Once per day, may smite a creature of negligible HP (1 hp or less). Target turns to gold dust, 1d6 gold pieces appear at the wearer's feet.
column7: While wearing this brace, you can use a bonus action to grant one creature within 30 feet of you temporary hit points equal to your level. These temporary hit points last for 1 hour. Additionally, as a reaction when a creature within 30 feet of you that you can see is hit by an attack, you can impose disadvantage on the attack roll, potentially causing it to miss. You can use each of these features a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

column3: Associated with celestial magic, often carried by mages seeking to amplify their connection to the heavens and increase their mana reserves.
column4: Grants bonus mana and mana regeneration, stacking mana upon spell cast.
column5: User gains +1 to cast spells. Each successful spell cast permanently adds a charge to the Tear. On 10 charges, roll a d6. On a 6, spell permanently improved (DM's discretion, damage/range/etc.)
column7: While holding this crystalline tear, you can use a bonus action to recover 1d4 expended spell slots. The combined level of spell slots recovered cannot exceed 2. Once used, this property cannot be used again until the next dawn.

column3: Favored by monks and traveling merchants, allowing for swift travel to remote temples or bustling marketplaces across Ionia.
column4: After a delay, teleport to a target allied structure.
column5: Upon utterance of command word, user vanishes and reappears next to designated structure. Mispronunciation or flawed structure diagrams risk arrival inside walls (1d6 damage) or miles away (1d20 miles in random direction).
column7: This small, intricately carved stone allows you to cast the Teleport spell once. When you cast the spell in this way, you ignore the 'familiarity' requirement; you can teleport to any location you have seen before, regardless of how well you know it. Once used, the stone turns to dust.

column3: Potentially tied to void corruption experiments performed during the height of the Ascended empire. Could be tied to Bel'Veth.
column4: Empowers the holder, granting increased attack damage, ability power, and tenacity for a short duration.
column5: Grants +2 to hit and damage rolls, and advantage on saves vs. charm and fear. Duration: 3 rounds. After, suffer -1 to all rolls for 1d4 rounds.
column7: This pulsating, obsidian shard grants the user resistance to necrotic damage. Additionally, as an action, you can touch a creature and force them to make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's maximum hit points are reduced by 1d6 for 1 hour. You can't use this ability again until the next dawn.

column3: Favored by Noxian bounty hunters and debt collectors, it ensures debts are paid, one way or another, often associated with the Black Rose.
column4: Grants lethality and critical strike chance. Executes enemies below a health threshold, granting bonus gold.
column5: On a successful hit, the target must SAVE vs DEATH or instantly die if below the item user's level. On a successful hit and death, the item user is granted 1d6 gold.
column7: While wearing this amulet, when you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with an attack, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level. In addition, you have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks made to determine if a creature is being truthful. This amulet is often used by Noxian bounty hunters to ensure debts are paid, one way or another, and is associated with the Black Rose.

column3: Associated with the Black Rose, it likely enhances the wearer's cunning and resilience, maybe connected to LeBlanc or Swain.
column4: Provides health, ability haste, and damage reduction after casting ultimate.
column5: Grants +3 to saves vs charm and fear after casting a ritual. Lasts 1d4 rounds. Possible mishap on a roll of 1: target becomes hostile.
column7: While wearing this ring, you have advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against being charmed or frightened. In addition, once per day, you can cast the Suggestion spell (save DC 15). This ring is associated with the Black Rose and enhances the wearer's cunning and resilience.

column3: Favored by melee combatants and warriors of the Iron Legion, each spike is rumored to be quenched in the blood of the fallen.
column4: Reflects damage and inflicts grievous wounds to attackers when hit by basic attacks.
column5: Creature suffers damage when it hits you with a melee attack. Chance target also suffers -2 to all attack rolls for 1d4 rounds due to festering wounds.
column7: While wearing this armor, whenever a creature hits you with a melee attack, the attacker takes piercing damage equal to your proficiency bonus. In addition, you have resistance to piercing damage. This armor is favored by melee combatants and warriors of the Iron Legion, with each spike rumored to be quenched in the blood of the fallen.

column3: A discarded coin from a bygone Shuriman dynasty, hinting at the empire's forgotten wealth and the transience of power. Likely a trinket of a fallen emperor.
column4: Grants gold and mana upon nearby enemy minion deaths. Encourages support role activity and sustain.
column5: Coin whispers secrets of past eras. Spend coin to possibly glimpse future, but each use ages the holder, imposing cumulative -1 to all rolls.
column7: This timeworn coin, a relic from a fallen Shuriman dynasty, whispers of forgotten wealth. While holding the coin, you can cast the *Detect Magic* spell once per long rest. Additionally, once per week, you can meditate with the coin for 1 hour to gain advantage on a single History check related to Shurima.

column3: Likely owned by a powerful Ice Witch, its magic allows the bearer to glimpse echoes of the past and slow their foes.
column4: Slows nearby enemies and grants vision of them for a short duration.
column5: Once per day, user may cast 'Temporal Snare'. Target must Save vs. Paralysis or be slowed (half movement) for 1d4 rounds. Reveals invisible foes within 30' for 1 round. Item crumbles to dust after 7 uses.
column7: This icy artifact, once held by a powerful Ice Witch of the Freljord, allows you to glimpse echoes of the past and hinder your enemies. As an action, you can touch an object or creature to perceive a brief vision of its recent past. Additionally, once per day, you can cast *Ray of Frost* as a 3rd-level spell (spell save DC 15).

column3: Said to be favored by nomadic ascetics who dwell on the slopes of Mount Targon, seeking enlightenment and offering aid to weary travelers.
column4: Grants health regeneration, mana regeneration, and a small amount of gold over time.
column5: Wearer recovers 1d4 hit points and 1d4 mana per turn when not in combat, and has a 1-in-6 chance of finding a lost coin or useful pebble each day.
column7: Favored by the nomadic ascetics of Mount Targon, this medallion grants resilience and guidance. You gain advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to navigate mountainous terrain. As an action, you can touch a creature and grant it temporary hit points equal to your level. These temporary hit points last for 1 hour. You cannot use this ability again until you finish a long rest.

column3: Likely once belonging to a Frost Priestess, the item hums with dormant power, awaiting a wielder worthy of channeling the glacial energies within.
column4: Grants gold and mana regeneration on damaging spells against champions. Transforms into Fated Guide when quest is completed.
column5: Upon casting a spell, roll a d6. On a 6, recover 1d4 mana. When 5 successful spells are cast, the edge transforms into a Fated Guide; a powerful staff.
column7: While holding this dagger, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and the save DC of your spells. Once per day, when you hit a creature with a spell attack using this dagger, you can choose to steal a spell slot from the target. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or lose one random spell slot of the highest level they have available. You regain a spell slot of the same level. This dagger also grants resistance to cold damage.

column3: Forged on the slopes of Mount Targon, this brace resonates with celestial power, offering protection to its wielder and empowering their allies.
column4: Grants health, health regeneration, and ability haste. Grants gold to allies when nearby enemies are slain.
column5: Wearer gains +1 AC. Once per day, may touch an ally; they gain +1 on their next save vs. death or being charmed/frightened. The wearer only gains half XP from encounters.
column7: While wearing this brace, you gain a +2 bonus to AC. As an action, you can unleash a celestial wave. Each creature within 30 feet of you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be knocked prone and take 3d8 radiant damage. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone. Once used, this property cannot be used again until the next dawn. Additionally, allies within 10 feet of you gain advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

column3: Brewed with mystical glacial water, favored by Iceborn. Provides sustenance and inner resolve for surviving in harsh environments.
column4: Restores health and mana. Grants a small burst of movement speed upon consumption.
column5: Grants +1 on saves vs. cold and starvation. Upon consumption, heal 1d6 hp and move at double speed for 1 round. May attract unwanted attention from winter spirits.
column7: When you consume this biscuit, you regain all hit points. For the next 24 hours, you have advantage on saving throws against exhaustion and you are immune to the effects of extreme cold. Additionally, you can breathe normally in any environment, and you gain resistance to cold damage for the duration.

column3: Associated with nomadic tribes charting the shifting sands, or perhaps ancient Ascended beings who needed to survey their vast empire. Used to observe enemies.
column4: Provides vision and map control through the placement of wards after jungling.
column5: Grants the ability to leave behind an invisible, immobile eye that sees all within a 120' radius for 6 turns. The user is not notified if the eye is disturbed.
column7: This ornate knife grants advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to track creatures. Additionally, as an action, you can plunge the knife into the ground and visualize the movements of creatures within 1 mile for the next minute. The DM determines what information is revealed, but it typically includes the number, type, and general direction of travel of creatures.

column3: Often carried by Noxian legionnaires on long marches, a smaller, less potent version of the elixirs used by the Trifarix.
column4: Grants increased health, tenacity, and champion size for a short duration.
column5: Drink: gain +2 to saves vs. fear and intimidation, +1d4 temp HP. Size increases by 1 category. Duration: 5 turns. Upon expiration, -1 to saves vs. fear for 1 turn.
column7: For 1 hour after drinking this potion, you gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons. Additionally, your carrying capacity is doubled for the duration.

column3: Commonly carried by Noxian soldiers before battle, this elixir is rumored to be brewed with secret ingredients to inspire aggression.
column4: Grants bonus attack damage and lifesteal for a short duration upon consumption.
column5: Drink: +2 to hit and damage rolls for 5 rounds. Afterwards, -1 to AC as the rage subsides. Possible frenzy.
column7: For 1 minute after drinking this potion, you gain advantage on attack rolls and Strength checks and saving throws. In addition, at the start of each of your turns, you gain 5 temporary hit points.

column3: Favored by Ionian duelists seeking versatile power, rumored to be inspired by ancient fighting styles. Often sought after by pit fighters in Noxus.
column4: Provides balanced stats, enhanced attack after spell cast, and movement speed on hit.
column5: On a hit roll, if a spell was cast in the last round, deal +1d6 damage. If a hit connects, move an additional 10ft this round. User gains +1 to hit, damage and AC.
column7: This magical weapon grants +2 to attack and damage rolls. When you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, the next attack roll you make before the end of your next turn gains advantage. Additionally, once per turn, when you cast a spell, the next weapon attack you make before the end of your turn deals an extra 1d8 force damage.

column3: Likely crafted by Noxian alchemists or engineers, designed for quick assaults and area denial. Could be associated with Singed's experiments.
column4: Grants movement speed towards enemies, upon close proximity, it unleashes a shockwave that slows nearby enemies.
column5: Once per day, user may move at double speed toward a foe. Upon contact, all within 10' must save vs. Paralysis or be slowed (half movement) for 1d4 rounds.
column7: This wondrous item requires attunement. As an action, you can activate the Chemtank, gaining the following benefits for 1 minute: Your movement speed is doubled. You have advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks and Strength saving throws. At the end of each of your turns while the Chemtank is active, each creature within 5 feet of you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of your next turn. Once used, the Chemtank cannot be activated again until the next dawn.

column3: Likely related to lost souls or spectral entities of the Shadow Isles, perhaps used in rituals to bind or control spirits.
column4: Periodically applies a stacking magic damage and movement speed buff when dealing or taking damage.
column5: Upon use, target foe must SAVE vs. magic or be cursed. On subsequent damage, the wearer's speed is doubled for the round and the foe suffers -1 to hit.
column7: This unsettling mask requires attunement. While wearing this mask, you can cast the 'detect thoughts' spell at will, without expending a spell slot. Additionally, as an action, you can target one creature you can see within 30 feet and force it to make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is frightened by you for 1 minute. The frightened creature must use its movement on each of its turns to move as far away from you as possible. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until the next dawn.

column3: A relic from the Shadow Isles, rumored to be tied to spirits seeking to sow confusion and dread among the living.
column4: Sends out two spectral entities that seek out nearby enemies.
column5: Casts 'Phantom Summons'. Two incorporeal stalkers appear, moving at incredible speed to harass the nearest living beings, sowing terror with icy touch. Victims must SAVE vs. Magic or FLEE for 1d4 turns.
column7: While attuned to these spectral pauldrons, you can cast the *invisibility* spell once per day. When you do, two translucent, ghostly duplicates of yourself appear alongside you for the duration of the spell. These duplicates mimic your movements but provide no tactical advantage beyond visual distraction.

column3: Favored by those who navigate treacherous currents, Typhoon Claws are rumored to be imbued with the spirit of a raging storm.
column4: Empowers basic attacks, granting temporary attack damage and movement speed on hit.
column5: On a hit, a surge of elemental air grants +2 to hit and run checks for 1 round. A critical hit unleashes a localized wind blast, potentially pushing foes back 5 ft.
column7: These handwraps grant a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with unarmed strikes. Additionally, once per short rest, when you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you can attempt to push the target up to 15 feet away from you in a straight line. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be pushed and knocked prone. Finally, you gain advantage on saving throws against being swept away or knocked prone by powerful gusts of wind or water.

column3: Associated with the Black Mist and the anguished spirits of the Shadow Isles, it seems to amplify their despair.
column4: Deals damage over time to nearby enemies and heals the wearer for a portion of the damage dealt.
column5: Aura: 10' radius. Living beings: -1 to Morale checks. Undead: +1 to hit. Drains 1d4 HP per round from living beings, heals wearer same amount. Chance of attracting spectres.
column7: This dark amulet whispers promises of power fueled by sorrow. While wearing it, you gain resistance to necrotic damage and advantage on saving throws against being frightened. However, at the end of each long rest, you must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or gain one level of exhaustion. Furthermore, any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of you must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be overwhelmed with despair, suffering disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the start of its next turn.

column3: Likely crafted by a hemomancer within Noxus. Perhaps associated with Vladmir or one of his apprentices.
column4: Grants the wielder lifesteal, restoring health based on damage dealt to enemies.
column5: Each strike fills the wielder with stolen vitality. Roll a d6; on a 1, the wielder risks succumbing to bloodlust, attacking the nearest creature, friend or foe.
column7: This scepter pulses with dark energy. While holding it, you gain the following benefits: You gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls. Whenever you cast a spell that deals damage, you regain hit points equal to 1d4 + the level of the spell. This healing cannot exceed the amount of damage dealt by the spell. In addition, once per long rest, as an action, you can expend a number of hit dice up to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1). Each creature of your choice within 30 feet of you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take necrotic damage equal to the total rolled on the hit dice and you regain hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt.

column3: Likely used by Demacian armies for morale and coordination. Could be associated with the Dauntless Vanguard.
column4: Empowers nearby allied lane minions and reduces damage from enemy towers.
column5: Confers +1 to morale checks for allies within 30'. Enemy siege attacks suffer -1 to hit. Banner must be planted; moving breaks the effect.
column7: This banner radiates courage. While the banner is within 30 feet of you and unfurled, you and friendly creatures within 30 feet of you gain the following benefits: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened. You can reroll any attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, but you must use the new roll. Each friendly creature can only use this reroll once per long rest. As a bonus action, you can plant the banner into the ground. While planted, the banner emanates an aura that grants advantage on death saving throws to friendly creatures within 60 feet. The banner remains planted until you use a bonus action to uproot it. The banner can be destroyed (AC 10, 10 hit points, vulnerability to fire damage).

column3: Vespertide's enchantments hint at ties to dark magic, perhaps related to the Black Rose or forgotten Noxian rituals.
column4: After casting your ultimate, gain bonus move speed and magic damage on-hit for a duration.
column5: Upon uttering words of great power, briefly gain +2 to movement and inflict 1d6 magic damage with melee attacks. Duration: 5 rounds. Save vs. Magic to negate.
column7: This dagger hums with shadowy power. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. When you hit a creature with this dagger, you can expend 1 charge to deal an extra 2d6 necrotic damage to the target and you regain hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt. The dagger has 3 charges and regains all expended charges daily at dusk. Additionally, you can cast the *darkness* spell once per long rest without using a spell slot.

column3: Favored by young mages in Ionia, Doran's Ring is often seen as a stepping stone to more powerful arcane artifacts.
column4: Provides Ability Power, Health, and Mana Regeneration.
column5: Grants +1 to cast spells. User heals 1hp every turn. Expend ring's magic to reroll a failed magic check.
column7: While wearing this ring, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC. Additionally, you regain 1 hit point at the start of each of your turns if you have at least 1 hit point.

column3: Horns are commonly used among the Freljord tribes to signal a coming raid. It could be used by the Winter's Claw or the Avarosan.
column4: Gain health regeneration after taking damage. Blocks a small amount of damage from enemy champions.
column5: Wearer gains +1 to saves vs. fear after taking damage. Additionally, once per day, wearer can negate 2 points of damage from a single attack.
column7: As an action, you can blow this horn. Each creature within 30 feet of you that is hostile must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once used, the horn cannot be used again until the next dawn.

column3: Bred in the harsh climates of the Freljord, these pups are favored by those seeking to ignite a fire in their hearts.
column4: Deals bonus damage on next attack and applies a slow.
column5: On a hit, add +1 fire damage die to weapon. Target must make a save vs. Paralysis or be slowed (half movement) for 1 round.
column7: You can use an action to summon a Scorchclaw Pup familiar. It uses the statistics of a Weasel, but it also deals 1 fire damage with its bite attack. As a bonus action, you can command the pup to breathe a cone of fire that deals 1d4 fire damage in a 15-foot cone. Creatures in the area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or take the damage. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest. If the pup dies, it reappears after 1d4 days.

column3: Favored by Demacian scouts, these wards reveal hidden threats, embodying the kingdom's vigilance against mages and Noxian spies.
column4: Provides vision and disables enemy wards in a small area, revealing invisible units.
column5: A glass bauble that detects arcane trickery and illusory figments; creatures attempting invisibility within 30' suffer disadvantage on stealth checks. Lasts until broken (AC 9, 1 HP).
column7: When you use an action to plant this magical ward, it becomes invisible. The ward has AC 10, 1 hit point, and is immune to poison and psychic damage. A creature can use an action to attempt a DC 12 Intelligence (Investigation) check to spot the ward. If the check succeeds, the ward becomes visible. While active, the ward emits a magical aura in a 60-foot radius. This aura reveals invisible creatures and objects, and it suppresses magical illusions, revealing their true form. The ward lasts for 8 hours or until destroyed.

column3: Used by Ionian monks to quickly recover from wounds sustained during meditation or combat. Could be related to the Spirit Blossom festival.
column4: Instantly restores a moderate amount of health over a short duration.
column5: Quaffing this potion restores 2d4 hit points. Side effects may include temporary visions of spirits or minor prophetic dreams for 1d4 turns.
column7: As an action, you can drink this potion or administer it to another creature within reach. The drinker regains 2d4 + 2 hit points. The potion's crimson liquid glimmers with swirling golden motes.

column3: Favored by Ionian monks for centuries to protect sacred groves from outsiders.
column4: Places an invisible ward that grants vision of the surrounding area for a short duration.
column5: When cast, the user becomes invisible to entities with less than 8 INT, but can do nothing other than observe. Ward lasts 6 turns or until dispelled.
column7: As an action, you can plant this magical ward. The ward is invisible and lasts for 8 hours. The ward has AC 10, 1 hit point, and is immune to poison and psychic damage. A creature can use an action to attempt a DC 12 Wisdom (Perception) check to spot the ward. If the check succeeds, the ward becomes visible. While active, the ward alerts you if any creature comes within 30 feet of it. You are mentally alerted to the presence of a creature; you do not know what kind of creature it is.

column3: Associated with the Void and Watchers through the summoning of Rift Herald. Void corruption spreads from the host to the surrounding area.
column4: Summons the Rift Herald to siege enemy turrets, empowering nearby allied champions.
column5: Once per day, summon a powerful but unintelligent voidling to attack a specified target. Allies near the voidling gain +1 on attack rolls, but risk corruption and madness.
column7: This grotesque eye pulses with dark energy. As an action, you can crush the eye, summoning a Rift Herald to a point you can see within 60 feet. The Rift Herald acts as an ally and obeys your commands. It uses the statistics of a Young Purple Worm, with the following changes: it is size Large, its type is aberration, and it has 60 hit points. The Rift Herald disappears after 1 minute, or when reduced to 0 hit points. Once the eye is crushed, the area within 30 feet of where it was crushed becomes filled with a tangible aura of void corruption for 1 hour. Any creature that starts its turn within this area must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take 2d6 psychic damage and gain one level of exhaustion.

column3: Favored by the Fortune's loyal crew, providing extra gold after a kill. Could be associated with gangs or freebooters of Bilgewater.
column4: Grants bonus gold on kill, shared with the support champion.
column5: Upon slaying a foe, 1d6 silver pieces are found near the corpse, divvied to nearby allies. On a roll of 1, the gold is fool's gold and vanishes.
column7: This small pouch seems to magically refill itself. After you participate in defeating a creature with a challenge rating of 1 or higher, you gain a number of gold pieces equal to the creature's challenge rating (minimum of 1 gp). If the creature has no listed challenge rating, the DM determines an appropriate amount. This pouch can hold up to 100 gold pieces, and any excess gold is lost.

column3: Forged in Ionia, these boots enhance mental clarity and swiftness, embodying Ionian ideals of balance and enlightenment. Connected to the spirit realm.
column4: Reduces cooldowns on abilities and summoner spells, and grants increased movement speed.
column5: Wearer casts spells and prayers with blinding speed (reduce casting time by 2 turns) and moves with unnerving swiftness (+1 to initiative). However, spirits are drawn to the wearer.
column7: While wearing these boots, your walking speed increases by 10 feet, and you have advantage on Wisdom saving throws against being charmed or frightened. Additionally, once per long rest, when you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you can reduce the casting time to 1 action if the casting time is normally longer. Alternatively, if the spell has a casting time of 1 action, you may cast it as a bonus action.

column3: Forged on the slopes of Mount Targon, perhaps linked to a celestial being granting swiftness and adaptability.
column4: Grants bonus movement speed and reduces the effectiveness of slows.
column5: Wearer ignores movement penalties from terrain and gains +1 to Dexterity saving throws against immobilization. Duration: 1 turn.
column7: While wearing these boots, your walking speed increases by 10 feet. As a bonus action, you can adapt the soles to grant you one of the following benefits for 1 minute: advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks, the ability to walk on difficult terrain as if it were normal terrain, or the ability to climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check. Once you use this bonus action, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

column3: Favored by Noxian gladiators, the B. F. Sword is rumored to be forged in blood magic, amplifying the wielder's strength.
column4: Grants a large amount of attack damage, increasing the potency of physical attacks.
column5: Confers +4 to hit and damage rolls. Upon scoring a critical hit, the wielder must make a DC 12 Wisdom save or fly into a bloodthirsty rage for 1d4 rounds.
column7: You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can choose to have the attack deal an extra 3d6 necrotic damage. If you do so, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or gain one level of exhaustion.

column3: Commonly used by Ionian villagers and trained acolytes alike; a simple tool with many uses. Often enchanted by novice practitioners.
column4: Increases attack speed. Grants the wielder a small edge in swift strikes.
column5: Confers +1 on initiative rolls. On a critical hit, target must save versus Dexterity or drop their held item.
column7: This simple dagger is a +1 weapon. Once per day, as a bonus action, you can imbue the dagger with elemental energy, choosing acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison damage. The next attack you make with the dagger before the end of your turn deals an extra 1d6 damage of the chosen type.

column3: Dwarven artisans in the Freljord, famed for their metalwork, forge Pickaxes. Used for mining rare Truesilver deposits deep within the mountains.
column4: Increases attack damage, aiding in champion combat effectiveness through enhanced physical prowess.
column5: Upon striking true, target must SAVE vs. STR or weapon sticks fast! Requires an action to dislodge. On a critical strike, target is knocked prone.
column7: This masterwork pickaxe, crafted by dwarven artisans in the Freljord, grants advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks made to mine ore or tunnel through earth and stone. When used to mine Truesilver, the amount of ore acquired is doubled.

column3: Forged in the heart of Noxus, it's rumored to be imbued with the essence of ancient fire mages, fueling their destructive power.
column4: Deals continuous magic damage to nearby enemies, increased damage to minions and monsters.
column5: Creatures near the wielder suffer 1d4 fire damage per round; flammable objects ignite. Armor saves vs. fire. Extra damage vs. plant-based monsters or constructs.
column7: While holding this item, you are immune to fire damage. As an action, you can unleash a wave of heat in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 4d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once used, this property cannot be used again until the following dawn.

column3: Associated with celestial bodies and the magic of Targon. Grants resilience and mana, potentially linked to the Aspects.
column4: Grants health and mana. Upon leveling up, restores mana and health based on a percentage.
column5: Drink deep from the Catalyst, never thirst for spells again, at the cost of aging as fast as the mountains! 1 in 6 chance to gain one level if drained completely.
column7: While holding this catalyst, you gain the following benefits: You gain resistance to radiant damage. Whenever you regain hit points from a spell or magical effect, you also regain a number of hit points equal to your proficiency bonus. Whenever you expend a spell slot, you regain 2d4 hit points.

column3: Favored by Noxian generals for its brutal efficiency, the blade inflicts grievous wounds, hindering regeneration and healing on the battlefield.
column4: Deals physical damage and applies Grievous Wounds, reducing the effectiveness of healing on the target for a short duration.
column5: On hit: target cannot regain hit points through spells or abilities. Potions and natural healing are at 1/4 effectiveness. Lasts 8 seconds, or until target rests.
column7: This wicked blade, when it hits a creature, prevents the target from regaining hit points until the start of your next turn. Additionally, the first time the target attempts to regain hit points before the start of your next turn, they must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of exhaustion.

column3: Often reinforced with True Ice, Giant's Belts are favored by hardy Freljordian warriors and chieftains for their resilience.
column4: Grants bonus health, increasing survivability in combat.
column5: Wearer gains +1 hit point per level. If reduced to 0 hit points, wearer may make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On success, they are instead reduced to 1 hit point.
column7: While wearing this belt, your Strength score increases by 4, to a maximum of 24. Additionally, you have advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws against being moved or knocked prone. The belt has 3 charges. As a reaction when you would be subjected to forced movement you can expend a charge to negate the movement.

column3: Favored by low-ranking Noxian officers to protect from magical attacks. Some speculate it's made from captive mages' essence.
column4: Grants magic resist and a shield that absorbs magic damage when taking damage.
column5: Confers +2 to saves versus spells. Upon taking magic damage, negates the next spell entirely, then crumbles to dust.
column7: While holding this weapon, you have advantage on saving throws against spells. If you take damage from a spell, you can use your reaction to absorb the magical energy. If you do so, you gain temporary hit points equal to the spell's level + your proficiency bonus. These temporary hit points last for 1 minute. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

column3: Associated with nomadic tribes navigating the harsh Freljordian landscape, seeking ancient ruins and forgotten paths.
column4: Grants gold and experience over time. Generates a ward after leaving spawn.
column5: Tracks the nearest source of untapped magic or ancient power; glows brighter when near ley lines. Once per day, casts 'phantom ward' (lasts 1 turn, 10' radius).
column7: While holding this compass, you always know which direction is north. Additionally, once per day, you can use an action to ask the compass to guide you to the nearest ruin or area of historical significance within 10 miles. The compass hums softly and the needle spins before settling on the direction of the chosen location. The guidance lasts for 1 hour, after which you must wait until the next dawn to use this ability again.

column3: Favored by Noxian arena fighters, the Brutalizer enhances aggression and lethality, embodying the empire's values.
column4: Grants attack damage and armor penetration. Previously granted cooldown reduction.
column5: Weapon grants +1 to hit and damage rolls. On a critical hit, target's AC is permanently reduced by 1 (cumulative) due to shattered armor.
column7: This menacing weapon grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls. On a hit, the wielder can choose to forgo dealing damage and instead inflict a stack of 'Brutalized' on the target (max 3 stacks). While Brutalized, the target has disadvantage on Dexterity and Wisdom saving throws. At the start of each of the target's turns, they can make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, removing one stack on a success. If the target reaches 3 stacks, they are also stunned until the end of their next turn.

column3: Likely crafted in Demacia, given its resistance to magic and the nation's anti-magic stance. May be related to Galio or the petricite forests.
column4: Provides magic resist and ability power. Absorbs some magic damage via a shield when taking damage.
column5: Confers +2 to saves vs. magical effects. Once per day, absorb a magical attack, converting damage to temporary hit points.
column7: This elegant shield is crafted from petricite, granting the wielder advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. Once per day, as a reaction when you or an ally within 30 feet takes spell damage, you can grant resistance to that damage type to the target until the end of their next turn. This property of the shield can only be used to grant resistance to one damage type per day, chosen when the ability is activated.

column3: Favored by Ionian duelists seeking swiftness, its origins trace back to ancient movement techniques studied in monasteries.
column4: Increases movement speed and critical strike chance.
column5: Bestows +1 to initiative rolls. When charging into melee, roll +1 to hit. On a critical hit, move an additional 1d4 hexes after the attack.
column7: While wearing this amulet, your speed increases by 10 feet. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can Dash.

column3: Favored by Noxian assassins, the Axiom Arc whispers promises of swift victories and unforgettable executions. It may have ties to the Black Rose.
column4: Refunds a large portion of your ultimate's cooldown upon scoring a takedown.
column5: Upon slaying a worthy foe, roll under your Intelligence score. If successful, reduce your XP needed to level by 10%. If you fail, an enemy’s spirit haunts your dreams that night.
column7: This sinister longbow hums with dark energy. When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with an attack using this bow, you regain a number of expended spell slots with a combined level equal to half the creature's challenge rating or level (minimum of one), to a maximum of 5th level spell slot. You cannot regain spell slots in this way again until you finish a long rest. Additionally, you gain advantage on attack rolls against any creature that is surprised.

column3: Forged in the Shadow Isles, it corrupts the wielder, draining life and empowering attacks. Linked to the Ruination and potentially Viego.
column4: Deals damage based on enemy health, steals movement speed, and heals the wielder.
column5: On a hit, target must save vs death or lose 1d4 STR and grant it to the wielder as HP. On a fumble, user must save vs death or be charmed as per the spell by an unknown entity.
column7: This corrupted longsword whispers of power and decay. On a hit, the blade deals an extra 2d6 necrotic damage. As a bonus action, you can attempt to steal the life force of a creature you have hit with this blade. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take 4d6 necrotic damage and become charmed by you for 1 minute. While charmed in this way, you gain temporary hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest. While attuned to this blade, your alignment tends towards Chaotic Evil.

column3: Crafted with materials echoing Ascended might, its creation may be tied to a powerful mage seeking to restore Shurima's glory.
column4: Grants bonus gold and experience upon assisting in champion kills.
column5: The bearer gains uncanny luck attracting allies during battle. Allies are more likely to survive, even against overwhelming odds, and share knowledge of hidden treasures (roll +1 on encounter checks).
column7: N/A

column3: Likely tied to the Black Mist and the life-draining magic of the Shadow Isles. Could be related to the Ruination.
column4: Heals allies when dealing damage and grants them bonus magic resist. Provides healing and ability power.
column5: Creatures struck by spells while blooming must Save vs. Death or become withered, taking 1d4 damage each round as they slowly turn into spectral flora. Nearby allies are briefly fortified.
column7: N/A

column3: Crafted by celestial artisans, it is said to be imbued with the power to shape dreams and destinies, influenced by Zoe.
column4: Grants bonus Ability Haste and empowers healing and shielding abilities.
column5: Heal allies at range (1d6 hp). Protect allies from attacks for one round; must rest to regain ability. Grants +1 to cast dream magic.
column7: N/A

column3: Said to be tied to ancient Ionian magic, possibly related to spirit energy manipulation techniques or a lost sword-fighting style.
column4: Grants attack damage, critical strike chance, and mana regeneration based on damage dealt.
column5: On a critical hit, the wielder regains expended magical energy, briefly regaining clarity and focus in battle. High chance of addiction.
column7: This blade pulses with Ionian spirit energy. While attuned to this weapon, when you score a critical hit with it, you regain a number of hit points equal to the damage dice of the weapon. Additionally, once per long rest, when you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can choose to drop to 1 hit point instead. If you do, the blade emits a burst of energy, dealing 3d6 radiant damage to all creatures within 15 feet of you. You then gain temporary hit points equal to the radiant damage dealt.

column3: Forged in the coldest reaches of the Freljord, rumored to have been touched by the spirit of a long-dormant ice giant.
column4: Reduces attack speed of nearby enemies and grants armor and mana.
column5: Nearby creatures suffer -2 to attack rolls. Grants +3 AC. User gains +1 to WIL saves vs. cold.
column7: This artifact radiates intense cold. While holding it, you have resistance to cold damage. As an action, you can unleash a wave of frost. Each creature in a 30-foot radius centered on you must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 6d8 cold damage and its speed is reduced by half until the end of your next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and its speed isn't reduced. After using this ability, the Frozen Heart becomes inert for 1d4 rounds, during which time you lose the resistance to cold damage.

column3: Associated with ambitious Noxian artificers seeking to enhance mobility and burst damage. Could be linked to a secretive hextech research division.
column4: Dashes a short distance and fires projectiles, dealing magic damage.
column5: Once per day, propel forward 30' and unleash a blast dealing 2d6 damage to all within 10'. Save vs. Dex or be knocked prone. Requires a rare power cell to recharge.
column7: This belt is a marvel of Noxian engineering. As an action, you can activate the rocketbelt to propel yourself 30 feet in a straight line towards a direction you choose. Any creature within 5 feet of your destination must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 4d6 fire damage. You are considered to have cast a spell to activate the belt for the purposes of counterspell, and it requires a spell slot of 3rd level. Once activated, the belt cannot be used again until the next dawn.

column3: Favored by reavers and shipwrights, especially useful for claiming coastal territory and isolated outposts without drawing the full fleet's attention.
column4: Grants armor, magic resist, and attack damage. Empowered siege minions; nearby allies get less XP.
column5: Wearer gains +2 AC and +2 to hit when fighting near structures. Allies within 30' suffer -1 to hit. Siege attacks do double damage. A cursed item for wanderers.
column7: This magical maul grants +3 to attack and damage rolls. While wielding this maul, you can cast the spell 'Knock' at will. Additionally, when you hit a structure (such as a door, wall, or siege engine) with this maul, you deal triple damage to it. Once per long rest, you can unleash a thunderous strike against a structure. Make an attack roll against the structure's AC. On a hit, the structure takes 5d10 thunder damage and must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or become vulnerable to all damage for 1 minute.

column3: Forged in Bilgewater, associated with sea monster hunting. Grants the user the ability to take down any monstrosity in the seas.
column4: Every third attack deals true damage. Provides attack damage, attack speed, and critical strike chance.
column5: On every third successful attack roll, ignore the target's armor. If the target is a sea monster, deal double damage. Grants +2 to hit rolls.
column7: This +3 spear is particularly effective against creatures of the deep. You gain advantage on attack rolls against aberrations and monstrosities that have a swimming speed. When you hit such a creature with this spear, it takes an extra 3d6 piercing damage. Furthermore, once per day, you can cast the spell 'Control Water' without expending a spell slot.
