When used against a Kraken, the spear deals an additional 6d6 damage and the Kraken has disadvantage on its saving throw against 'Control Water'.

column3: Crafted by a Demacian weaponsmith to pierce even the thickest armor, it might have been used in wars against Noxus or the Freljord.
column4: Grants armor penetration and increased damage against tanky targets based on the health difference.
column5: Creatures struck by this weapon have their AC temporarily lowered, and those with high HP totals suffer extra damage, representing a chink in their defenses found and exploited.
column7: This +3 light crossbow ignores the Damage Resistance property of any creature. Furthermore, if you hit a creature with AC 18 or higher, that creature's AC is reduced by 1. This reduction lasts for 1 minute. The AC of a creature cannot be reduced below 18 in this way. In addition, you have advantage on attack rolls against creatures that are larger than you.

column3: Crafted with sands from Shurima and imbued with ancient magic, it offers protection against curses and debilitating magics.
column4: Grants attack damage, magic resist, and a cleanse that removes crowd control effects.
column5: Wearer is immune to paralysis, petrification, and charm. A saving throw is allowed against spells of enslavement or domination, with a +4 bonus. Once per day, the wielder can negate an ongoing magical effect, such as a binding spell.
column7: This scimitar, forged from Shuriman sands and ancient magic, grants advantage on saving throws against being cursed or suffering from debilitating magical effects. While wielding this weapon, you are immune to the frightened condition.

column3: Favored by Noxian duelists and executioners, its whisper erodes even the mightiest defenses, ensuring a swift end.
column4: Grants armor penetration and Grievous Wounds, reducing healing received by the target.
column5: On hit: Target's AC is reduced by 2 for 1d4 rounds. Further, any healing received is halved for the duration. Usable once per round.
column7: This Noxian blade whispers with malice. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with this weapon, that creature must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or have their Armor Class reduced by 2 until the end of your next turn. This reduction can stack.

column3: Favored by duelists and dancers across Ionia, the Phantom Dancer is said to grant its wearer supernatural speed and grace.
column4: Grants attack damage, attack speed, critical strike chance, and movement speed; also grants phasing and a lifeline.
column5: Wearer gains +1 to AC and +2 to hit when fighting one-on-one. On a failed save vs. death, instead go to 1hp and flee the fight at double speed (save vs. fear).
column7: While attuned to this blade, your walking speed increases by 15 feet, and you gain a +2 bonus to Dexterity saving throws. Additionally, as a reaction when you are hit by a melee attack, you can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You then have advantage on attack rolls against the triggering creature until the end of your next turn.

column3: Enhances ranged attacks, reminiscent of Ionian archers who imbue their shots with mystical energy for greater reach and impact.
column4: Grants increased attack range and energizes attacks to deal bonus magic damage on hit.
column5: Ranged attacks gain +50% range; successful hits deal +1d6 lightning damage. Once per day, may ignore cover penalties. Mishaps arc to nearest ally, dealing 1d6 lightning damage.
column7: This mystical longbow grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. In addition, the bowstring seems to hum with stored energy. As a bonus action, you can empower your next ranged attack with the bow to have its range doubled and deal an extra 2d6 force damage on a hit. This property can be used a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and all expended uses recharge at dawn.

column3: Favored by Noxian assassins. Associated with the Black Rose and Leblanc, for their ability to manipulate and break through defenses.
column4: Deals bonus damage to enemies with shields, briefly reducing their shield.
column5: On hit, target's AC is penalized by -2 [1 round]. If target relied on magical protection, they must save vs. Spells or also lose 1d4 hp.
column7: This dagger, crafted from a strange, obsidian-like material, is a +1 weapon. When you hit a creature wearing armor or wielding a shield with this dagger, that creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the end of its next turn. If the creature is concentrating on a spell, it automatically fails the saving throw. Additionally, if the target is benefiting from temporary hit points, they lose an amount of temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt by the dagger.

column3: Likely crafted by a forgotten Freljordian tribe, it evokes themes of protection and winter resilience, potentially tied to the Winter's Claw.
column4: Heals allies and grants them bonus movement speed when near the user.
column5: Grants +1 to AC to nearby allies and advantage on saves vs. cold. Once per day, user may summon a spectral sled dog to pull them a short distance.
column7: This intricately carved wooden sled radiates a faint aura of cold. While riding the Solstice Sleigh, you and up to two other Medium-sized creatures are immune to the effects of extreme cold, and you gain advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. As an action, you can command the sleigh to glide effortlessly over snow and ice at a speed of 60 feet for 1 hour. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

column3: Associated with Ionian storm mages and the harnessing of raw magical energy into directed bursts, reminiscent of Ionian traditions.
column4: Periodically emits chain lightning, damaging multiple nearby enemies on attack.
column5: Grants the ability to discharge stored electricity, dealing 1d6 lightning damage to a primary target and arcing to up to 2 nearby foes; Save vs. Lightning or be stunned for 1 round.
column7: This magical weapon crackles with stored lightning. Once per long rest, as an action, you can unleash the Shiv's energy, targeting a point within 60 feet. Each creature within a 20-foot radius of that point must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 6d6 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Additionally, on a failed save, the target is stunned until the end of your next turn.

column3: Forged atop Mount Targon, it resonates with celestial power, potentially linked to the Aspect of the Twilight or the Aspect of War.
column4: First attack after casting a spell crits, heals you and grants armor pen. Cooldown is based on base AD.
column5: Upon striking a foe after invoking a celestial power, the wielder heals 1d6 HP and ignores the foe's armor for one attack. Recharge after combat.
column7: This weapon, blessed by celestial energies, allows you to channel the might of Targon. The first time you hit a creature with an attack on your turn, you can choose to deal an additional 4d8 radiant damage. If you do so, until the end of your next turn, you have advantage on attack rolls against that creature and the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls against you.

column3: Associated with Demacian vanguard tactics, enabling swift and fortified advances. Could be connected to the Dauntless Vanguard.
column4: Empowers siege, granting bonus damage to structures. Nearby allies gain increased movement speed when moving towards turrets or structures.
column5: Grants +1 to siege checks. Allies within 30' gain +2 to movement when charging fortifications or fortified positions. Structures automatically take maximum damage for 1d4 rounds.
column7: While holding this item, you can, as a bonus action, create a path of solidified light. This path is 10 feet wide and up to 30 feet long, originating from you. The path remains for 1 minute. While on the path, you and any friendly creatures gain +10 feet to your movement speed and have advantage on saving throws against being knocked prone. You can use this ability once per long rest.

column3: Used by sentinels and mages of the White City, allowing greater reach and vigilance against threats both seen and unseen.
column4: Increases ability haste, health, and allows placement of more wards. Also increases ward range.
column5: Grants +1 to Wisdom saving throws against illusions and reveals hidden enemies within 60'. The holder can maintain one extra active magical ward or trap.
column7: This stone pulses with a soft, inner light. While holding the Vigilant Wardstone, you gain advantage on Wisdom (Perception) and Intelligence (Investigation) checks related to detecting hidden creatures or objects within 60 feet. Additionally, you can cast the *See Invisibility* spell once per day. The stone regains its ability to cast this spell at dawn.

column3: Forged in the coldest reaches of the Freljord, it's said to ward off the chilling touch of the Watchers.
column4: Provides mana, armor, and ability haste. Converts mana into health and grants a shield when near enemies.
column5: Wearer gains +2 to saves versus cold. When in danger, a spectral barrier absorbs 1d6 damage, but requires 1d4 turns to recharge. If barrier breaks, wearer must test vs. paralysis or be frozen solid.
column7: This item appears as a simple pendant made from a shard of true ice, perpetually cold to the touch. While wearing Winter's Approach, you have resistance to cold damage. As an action, you can unleash a wave of intense cold in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 8d6 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. After using this ability, the pendant becomes inert until the next dawn.

column3: Likely tied to the Void and the Watchers. Possibly a tool used by the Ascended in their battles against the Void.
column4: Periodically summons a Void grub that explodes on enemies.
column5: Once per day, summon a 1 HD voidling that explodes for 1d6 damage in a 5' radius. On a fumble, the voidling attacks the summoner.
column7: This twisted, obsidian spike hums with an unsettling energy. While holding the Realmspike, you can cast the *Detect Magic* spell at will. Additionally, as an action, you can target one creature within 60 feet and force them to make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature is frightened for 1 minute. While frightened in this way, the creature is also vulnerable to psychic damage. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until the next dawn.

column3: Associated with the Buhru tribe and sea monster hunting rituals of Bilgewater. Possibly used to appease or control sea beasts.
column4: Deals physical damage and slows enemies. Applies grievous wounds.
column5: Target suffers -2 to saves vs. poison. Anyone eating creature struck with this weapon must test vs. paralyzation or become paralyzed for 1d4 turns.
column7: This wickedly barbed harpoon is a relic of the Buhru tribe, said to be blessed by Nagakabouros. Once per day, as an action, you can hurl Death's Daughter at a creature within 60 feet. Make a ranged attack roll. On a hit, the target takes 3d8 piercing damage and must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 30 feet toward you. If the target is a beast of size Large or larger, it has disadvantage on the saving throw.

column3: Forged in the heart of a dying star, the Black Hole Gauntlet is rumored to be connected to the Aspect of the Void.
column4: Periodically pulls nearby enemies closer, dealing magic damage based on their maximum health.
column5: Once per day, touch the gauntlet to create a 10' radius sphere, those inside must make a DC 15 Strength save or be pulled 5' closer to the center, taking 1d6 damage per character level.
column7: This gauntlet pulses with an unnatural darkness. While wearing the Black Hole Gauntlet, you gain a +2 bonus to AC. As an action, you can activate the gauntlet to create a miniature black hole at a point within 30 feet that you can see. Each creature within 10 feet of the point must make a DC 17 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 4d10 force damage and is pulled 5 feet toward the center. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pulled. The black hole collapses after one round. Once this property is used, it cannot be used again until the next dawn.

column3: Forged in the darkest Noxian forges, whispered to be infused with souls of conquered foes. Linked to the Black Rose.
column4: Deals bonus damage after dashing, or exiting stealth, and grants armor penetration.
column5: On a hit after moving 40ft in a single round, deal +1d6 damage. Further, attacks are made as if the target's AC is 2 less.
column7: These razor-sharp talons are crafted from darksteel and imbued with a fragment of trapped souls. While worn, your unarmed strikes deal 1d8 slashing damage. As a bonus action, you can expend 1 soul to deal an additional 2d6 necrotic damage and gain advantage on your next attack roll. These talons can hold a maximum of 5 souls. When you reduce a humanoid to 0 hit points, you can use your reaction to trap its soul within the talons, granting the talons 1 soul. Souls fade from the talons at dawn.

column3: Crafted by Noxian artificers, the Detonation Orb is rumored to utilize forbidden hemomancy for explosive power, favored by demolition squads.
column4: Deals area damage after a delay. Triggers on-hit effects. Good for wave clear and burst.
column5: Orb deals 3d6 fire damage to all within 10ft. Save vs. Breath for half damage. Those slain by the Orb explode dealing 1d6 fire damage to those within 5ft.
column7: This orb pulses with crimson energy. As an action, you can hurl the Detonation Orb up to 60 feet. Upon impact, the orb explodes in a 20-foot radius sphere. Each creature in that area must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 fire damage and 8d6 force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature in the area of effect that is reduced to 0 hit points by this damage is disintegrated. Once used, the orb turns to ash.

column3: Favored by Noxian assassins and spies. Grants the wielder the element of surprise, negating an enemy's awareness.
column4: Grants invisibility after killing an enemy champion. Next attack deals bonus damage, especially against wards. Disables traps.
column5: Upon slaying a foe, vanish from sight (as per Invisibility spell). First strike deals +1d6 damage and bypasses armor if target is unawares. Pass unseen through magical wards and mundane traps.
column7: This blade hums with shadows. Once per long rest, when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can force them to make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature is Blinded and Deafened until the end of your next turn, and you gain advantage on attack rolls against that creature until the end of your next turn. Additionally, the first time you hit a creature with this weapon after emerging from being hidden or invisible, the attack deals an extra 4d6 necrotic damage.

column3: Likely created by hemomancers in Noxus, Flesheater could be associated with the Black Rose or a warlord seeking power through blood magic.
column4: Grants increasing damage and lifesteal as the wearer damages enemies in combat.
column5: Upon a hit, wielder gains +1 to hit and damage rolls until the end of combat. For every three successful hits, they recover 1d4 hit points. The blade whispers promises of power.
column7: This weapon thirsts for blood. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can choose to deal an extra 2d6 necrotic damage. If you do, you regain hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt. Additionally, if you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this weapon, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level. These temporary hit points last for 1 hour.

column3: Favored by fortune tellers and swindlers alike. The blade is rumored to have been first owned by a card shark known as 'The River King'.
column4: On hit, grants a stacking buff that increases critical strike chance, lost on being hit.
column5: Upon a successful hit, the wielder gains +1 Luck modifier to the next roll, stacking. Upon being hit, the wielder is cursed, resulting in -1 Luck modifier.
column7: This +2 shortsword, once owned by the infamous card shark 'The River King', hums with chaotic energy. Once per long rest, when you make an attack roll with this weapon, you can choose to gamble. Roll a d20. On a 1-10, the attack automatically misses and you take 1d6 psychic damage. On an 11-20, the attack automatically hits and deals an extra 4d6 force damage.

column3: Associated with the Kinkou Order, this jitte might have been wielded to maintain balance and discipline.
column4: Grants bonus armor and magic resist, reducing damage from enemy champions.
column5: Confers +2 AC. Once per day, deflect a single attack; attacker takes damage equal to your level. Requires Lawful alignment to attune.
column7: This +1 jitte grants advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. As a reaction when you or an ally within 30 feet is hit by an attack, you can redirect the chi flowing through the jitte, imposing disadvantage on the attack roll. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

column3: Crafted in the Shadow Isles, it drains the life force of enemies, possibly linked to the Black Mist's power.
column4: Grants bonus damage and movement speed on champion damage; cooldown per champion.
column5: Upon striking a foe, inflict 1d6 necrotic damage. If the target dies this turn, move again this turn with +2 to movement.
column7: This +2 scythe deals an additional 2d6 necrotic damage on a hit. Whenever you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this weapon, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level. Additionally, once per day, you can cast the 'Enervation' spell (save DC 15) without expending a spell slot or material components.

column3: A tool used by the Harrowing's reapers, it enhances their ability to collect souls. Connected to the Black Mist and spectral entities.
column4: Deals bonus damage based on the target's missing health, increasing execute potential.
column5: On a hit, target must save vs Death or take double damage. Undead are immune. Wielder must make a Wisdom save after use or become shaken.
column7: While holding this reaper's scythe, you gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. In addition, when you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this weapon, you can choose to trap its soul. The creature's soul is transferred to the scythe, and you can use a bonus action to release the soul, causing the scythe to deal an extra 6d6 necrotic damage on its next successful hit within 1 minute. The scythe can hold up to 3 souls at a time. When the scythe contains 3 souls, you can cast the 'Soul Cage' spell (no components required) as an action, consuming the souls in the scythe.

column3: Forged on the slopes of Mount Targon, rumored to briefly grant the wielder the aspect of the divine.
column4: Grants high attack speed and bonus damage for a short duration.
column5: Once per day, gain +4 to hit and double weapon damage for 1 round. Afterwards, -2 to hit for 1d4 rounds due to divine aftershock. If the wielder is a Cleric of a rival god, they take 1d6 damage.
column7: This longsword hums with celestial energy. You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. Once per day, as a bonus action, you can invoke the divine aspect within the sword for 1 minute. While the aspect is invoked, you gain the following benefits: Your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20. Once per turn when you hit a creature with an attack using this sword, you can deal an extra 3d8 radiant damage to the target. At the end of the minute, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of exhaustion.

column3: Favored by temple archers, these items echo the teachings of precision and inner balance, principles deeply rooted in Ionian martial arts.
column4: Grants bonus attack damage, attack speed, and critical strike chance, enhancing ranged damage output.
column5: Ranged attacks gain +1 to hit and damage. On a critical hit, the target must save versus Wisdom or be stunned for one round, representing the perfect shot finding a pressure point.
column7: This exquisitely crafted longbow is always perfectly balanced in your hands. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. In addition, you gain the following benefits while wielding this bow: Your ranged weapon attacks ignore half and three-quarters cover. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with this bow, you can reroll one of the damage dice, choosing which result to use. As a bonus action, you can enter a state of heightened focus for 1 minute. While focused, your critical hit range with this bow is increased by 1 (to a maximum of 17-20).

column3: Forged on the slopes of Mount Targon, rumored to offer protection against celestial wrath and the dangers of the ascent.
column4: Provides health regeneration and damage reduction from champion attacks. Grants bonus movement speed when near an ally.
column5: Confers +1 to Saves vs. Spells and missile attacks. When within 30' of another character, gain +2 to movement; if damaged, both must Save vs. Paralysis or be unable to move for 1 round.
column7: While wearing this amulet, you gain advantage on saving throws against spells and effects that deal radiant damage or originate from celestial beings. Additionally, once per day, when you would be reduced to 0 hit points by radiant damage, you are instead reduced to 1 hit point.

column3: A hybrid weapon favored by those who blend magic and might, like Viktor. Potentially once belonging to a Hemomancer for blood magic.
column4: Deals magic damage, grants lifesteal and spell vamp, and active damage that slows the target.
column5: On Hit: 1d4+1 magic damage; Target is slowed, -2 to movement for 1 round; Heals wielder for damage dealt (cap 8hp/round).
column7: This magical weapon grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can expend a spell slot to deal an additional 1d8 force damage per level of the spell slot. In addition, you regain a number of hit points equal to half the force damage dealt. If you expend a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the target must also succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become stunned until the end of your next turn.

column3: May be connected to the Black Rose. Grants empowerments at the cost of health, a common theme in Noxian pacts.
column4: Deals damage to yourself to deal damage to enemies, and gain movement speed.
column5: Sacrifice HP: deal +1d6 damage; Move with haste, +5' movement that round. 1 in 6 chance of attracting unwanted attention from dark entities.
column7: This dark artifact grants the wearer access to forbidden power, but at a terrible cost. As an action, you can sacrifice a number of hit points, up to half your current hit points. For each 5 hit points sacrificed, you gain one Ruin point, to a maximum of 10 Ruin points. These Ruin points last for 1 minute and can be used in the following ways: * Empowered Attack: You can expend 1 Ruin point to add 1d6 necrotic damage to an attack roll. * Heightened Spell: You can expend 2 Ruin points to increase the DC of a spell you cast by 2. * Unholy Resilience: You can expend 3 Ruin points as a reaction when you take damage to reduce the damage by 1d10. At the end of each turn you have at least 1 Ruin Point, you must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of the nearest creature until the start of your next turn. If you fail three saving throws to this effect, you gain one level of exhaustion.

column3: Forged by a forgotten aspect of Targon, the Wordless Promise binds two champions, sharing their burdens and bolstering their resolve.
column4: Grants bonus health and ability haste. Periodically heals your most wounded ally. Healing them grants you movement speed.
column5: As an action, touch an ally to grant them temporary HP. If they are reduced to zero HP before your next turn, you may choose to take the damage instead, appearing adjacent to them.
column7: While attuned to this amulet, when a creature you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can use your reaction to transfer half of that damage to yourself. You can't reduce this transferred damage in any way. Additionally, when you are reduced to half your hit point maximum or lower, you and one willing creature within 30 feet of you both gain temporary hit points equal to your level in this class. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

column3: Favored by Ionian duelists seeking swiftness in combat. The enchanted boots whisper forgotten techniques, enhancing reflexes and agility.
column4: Grants bonus movement speed. Passively grants bonus tenacity and slow resist.
column5: Wearer moves +2" per round. Saving throws against being stunned or slowed gain +2. If the wearer fails the saving throw, they only suffer half of the duration/effect.
column7: While wearing these boots, your walking speed increases by 15 feet, and you have advantage on Dexterity saving throws against effects that you can see, such as traps and spells. In addition, as a bonus action, you can spend 1 Hit Die to gain advantage on your next attack roll or Dexterity check before the end of your turn.

column3: Favored by Noxian scouts, the device is rumored to have been reverse-engineered from ancient Shuriman surveillance technology.
column4: Reveals and disables nearby wards and traps for a short duration. Grants movement speed towards revealed wards.
column5: As an action, reveal hidden threats (DC 13 WIS save to resist). Grants +2 to move silently near revealed threats, but all others gain advantage to detect you.
column7: This handheld device has 3 charges. As an action, you can expend 1 charge to cast Detect Magic in a 60-foot cone. Additionally, you can use a bonus action to expend 1 charge and make a DC 15 Intelligence (Investigation) check to pinpoint the exact location of the nearest magical trap or illusion within 30 feet. The sweeper regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

column3: Potentially used by Demacian soldiers. Grants resilience and damage based on fortitude, embodying Demacian ideals.
column4: Grants attack damage based on max health. Provides bonus armor and magic resist.
column5: Wearer gains +1 AC per 10 current HP. On a crit, deal +1d4 damage per 10 max HP. If reduced to 0 HP, wearer makes a DC 15 CON save, or is slain outright.
column7: You gain a +3 bonus to AC and saving throws against effects that would inflict the frightened or charmed condition. Additionally, you gain a bonus to damage rolls equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of +1).

column3: Likely tied to a Freljordian tribe known for raiding. The blade may have been used to plunder from rival tribes or outsiders.
column4: Grants gold upon killing a unit and increased critical strike chance.
column5: Upon a kill, wielder gains 1d4 silver pieces. Additionally, rolls of '1' on attack dice are rerolled, once per turn.
column7: This magical blade grants you advantage on attack rolls against creatures that are carrying gold or other valuable items. In addition, when you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this weapon, you may choose to immediately search their person for any gold or other valuables; if you do, you regain 1d6 hit points.

column3: Associated with the Black Mist emanating from the Shadow Isles, potentially used by those who seek to manipulate its power.
column4: Grants gold and vision upon damaging enemy champions with abilities or attacks. Transforms into Harrowing Crescent.
column5: Upon striking a foe, 1d4 temporary HP are granted, and a spectral image is revealed. Once 5 images are seen, the scythe transforms; the wielder's max HP is permanently reduced by 1.
column7: This scythe deals an extra 2d6 necrotic damage to any target it hits. Whenever you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this weapon, a wisp of black mist erupts from their body and swirls around you. For the next minute, you have advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks.

column3: Commonly used by mageseekers to quickly return to base after long missions, it is associated with Demacia's infrastructure and control.
column4: Instantly restores mana and returns the champion to their base.
column5: Quaffing the blue pill allows immediate return to a designated safe haven. All accumulated wounds and fatigue are miraculously healed upon arrival. However, this escape route is one-way only; the character cannot return to their departure point.
column7: Potion, very rare. When you drink this potion, you teleport to a safe location that you designate when you create the potion. This location must be within the same plane of existence as you and must be familiar to you. The potion has no effect if you are not on the same plane of existence as the designated location. Once designated, the location cannot be changed.

column3: Worn by pit fighters and martial artists across Ionia, these gloves are rumored to be blessed by a forgotten spirit of perseverance.
column4: Grants critical strike chance. Useful for champions that rely on auto attacks.
column5: Wearer’s attacks deal +1 damage and threaten a Critical Hit on a roll of 19-20. On a critical hit, deal double damage and inflict Broken status for 1 round.
column7: Wondrous Item, rare (requires attunement). While wearing these gloves, your unarmed strikes deal 1d8 bludgeoning damage. Additionally, once per day when you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can choose to drop to 1 hit point instead. If you do so, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level. You cannot use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

column3: Forged in the heart of the Noxian empire, it is rumored to have been wielded by a powerful warlord during the early expansions.
column4: Grants a shield after dashing, and increased damage based on missing health.
column5: When the wielder is brought low, they may call upon the blade's inherent power, granting them +4 to AC for 1d4 rounds. On a hit, the blade deals +1d6 damage for each point of AC granted.
column7: Weapon (greatsword), legendary (requires attunement). You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Noxian Might: When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can choose to deal an extra 3d6 necrotic damage to the target. If you do, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or gain one level of exhaustion. The necrotic damage cannot be applied to constructs or undead.

column3: Said to be crafted by long-lost seers from Mount Targon, this relic enhances one's ability to perceive hidden truths and foresee future events.
column4: Provides vision and reveals invisible units in an area. Grants bonus ability power.
column5: Confers +2 to WIS checks related to perception and divination. Once per day, grants a glimpse of a possible future, though its accuracy is suspect (50%).
column7: While wearing this artifact, you gain advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks and Intelligence (Investigation) checks. Additionally, once per long rest, you can cast the Augury spell without expending a spell slot.

column3: Favored by Noxian alchemists, it enhances plague warfare, spreading virulent concoctions among their enemies.
column4: Grants Ability Haste and Ability Power. Imposes Grievous Wounds on enemies damaged by allies.
column5: Upon a successful hit: Victim tests CON or suffers -2 to future CON tests against disease for 1d4 turns; allies' attacks inflict festering wounds.
column7: This noxious vial contains enough material for three uses. As an action, you can hurl the vial up to 30 feet. On impact, the vial bursts, and each creature within a 10-foot radius must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, at the start of each of their turns, the poisoned creatures take 2d6 poison damage.

column3: Said to be woven from captured starlight by the Solari, granting resilience against the night. Perhaps a relic from the Rune Wars.
column4: Periodically damages nearby enemies. Grants bonus health and magic resistance.
column5: Radiates dim light, 5' radius. Once per dawn, unleash a burst of searing light: 2d6 damage to undead, 1d6 to others within 10'. Grants +1 to saves vs. magic and poison.
column7: While wearing this cloak, you have resistance to radiant damage and advantage on saving throws against effects that would turn you undead. As a reaction when you are hit by an attack, you can cause the attacker to be blinded until the end of its next turn.

column3: Drawn from the purest glacial springs, rumored to possess restorative properties known only to ancient ice witch covens. Used by hardy explorers.
column4: Restores health and mana over time. Refills upon visiting the shop.
column5: Quaffing this potion restores 1d6 hit points and/or MP. Flask refills after a day of rest in a settlement. Prolonged use may attract unwanted attention from frost witches.
column7: This flask, hewn from glacial ice, contains a perpetually cool liquid. As an action, you can drink the flask's contents and regain 2d4 hit points. The flask magically refills with water after one minute if it is not inside an enclosed container. The flask can only be used three times, after which the restorative properties of the flask fade and it becomes a mundane, albeit beautiful, object.

column3: Associated with forgotten Shadow Isles rituals and potent, but corrupting magic, the Deathfire Grasp was a tool for amplifying dark sorcery.
column4: Greatly increased the wielder's magic damage for a short duration, amplifying burst potential.
column5: Once per day, inflict +3 damage with a magic attack. The wielder ages 1d4 months and is one step closer to the Shadow Isles.
column7: Wand, very rare (requires attunement by a spellcaster). This twisted wand crackles with dark energy. You gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls while holding this wand. As an action, you can expend 3 charges to unleash a burst of necrotic energy at one creature within 60 feet. The target must make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking 8d6 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by this wand's effect has its soul trapped within the wand. The wand has 7 charges, and it regains 1d4+3 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ash, releasing any trapped souls.

column3: Implies a connection to consuming souls or life force, potentially linked to Mordekaiser or Thresh's artifacts.
column4: On-hit damage that scales with takedowns, granting bonus magic damage.
column5: Creature gains +1 to hit and damage for each soul devoured. Upon death, all devoured souls are released as specters.
column7: Weapon (any), legendary (requires attunement). This weapon pulses with a ravenous hunger. You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. On a hit, the weapon deals an extra 2d6 necrotic damage. When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this weapon, you gain temporary hit points equal to the creature's maximum hit points. These temporary hit points last for 1 hour. While attuned to this weapon, you must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw at dawn each day or become cursed. While cursed, you are compelled to feed the weapon souls. You have disadvantage on all saving throws made to resist this compulsion. If you go 7 days without feeding the weapon a soul, you take 10d6 necrotic damage as the weapon feeds on your life force.

column3: Crafted by a forgotten order of Ionian mages, rumored to enhance the user's connection to the spirit realm and the magic within.
column4: Grants ability power, health, and mana regeneration. Provides additional damage against minions.
column5: Wearer gains +1 to magic-user rolls. Once per day, regain 1d4 lost spell slots. However, spirits now whisper erroneous secrets in the wearer's ears.
column7: While wearing this ring, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC increases by 1. Additionally, you have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks made to interact with spirits or creatures from other planes of existence.

column3: The Edge of Finality hums with the echoes of spirit realm blades. Perfected by Ionian weapon masters.
column4: Grants AD, lethality and a spell shield when at low health, increasing damage.
column5: Bestows +3 to hit and damage. When HP is at 2 or less, gain invulnerability for 1 round and deal double damage on the next attack.
column7: This magical longsword deals an extra 2d8 force damage on a hit. Once per day, when you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this weapon, you can choose to trap its soul within the blade. While a soul is trapped, you can use a bonus action to unleash it, dealing 6d8 force damage to a target within 30 feet. The soul is then released.

column3: Favored by Noxian gladiators, the elixir is rumored to grant temporary invincibility, emboldening warriors before entering the arena.
column4: Grants temporary HP, size, and strength.
column5: Quaffing it bestows +2 to hit and damage for 5 turns, while doubling HP. Upon expiration, fumble die rolls are penalized with -1 until rest.
column7: For the next minute after drinking this elixir, you are immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. Additionally, you have advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. After the minute ends, you gain one level of exhaustion.

column3: The Equinox is likely connected to the celestial bodies watched over by the Solari and Lunari of Mount Targon.
column4: Deals damage to nearby enemies and reduces damage taken for a short duration after immobilizing an enemy champion.
column5: Upon a foe's binding, nearby entities suffer 1d6 radiant damage. For the next turn, the wielder's armor class is improved by 2.
column7: This mysterious artifact pulses with the combined energy of the sun and moon. While holding the Equinox, you gain advantage on saving throws against being blinded or frightened. Additionally, once per dawn or dusk, you can unleash a burst of celestial energy, dealing 3d6 radiant damage to all creatures within a 15-foot radius. The damage is halved for creatures that succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw.

column3: Implies a connection to ascended beings of Shurima, suggesting potential for transformation or enhanced power linked to the sun disc.
column4: Grants increased vision range, mana regeneration, and cooldown reduction to nearby allies.
column5: Caster sees further; recovers mana as if drinking plentifully from a spring. Allies nearby act with greater speed and are less weary (reduce encumbrance category by 1). Grants +1 on saves versus charm effects.
column7: This ancient Shuriman relic holds the potential to unlock your inner Ascended. As an action, you can touch the Eye of Ascension and make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw. On a success, you gain the benefits of the 'enlarge' portion of the Enlarge/Reduce spell for 1 hour, and your skin takes on a sun-kissed bronze hue. On a failure, you are stunned until the end of your next turn as the Eye attempts to reshape you. If you attempt this transformation again within 7 days, the DC increases by 2.

column3: Associated with the Solari, forging light into a protective ward. Perhaps a relic from a forgotten age on Mount Targon.
column4: Provides health, mana regeneration, and cooldown reduction. Grants an active shield to protect allies.
column5: Grants +1 AC. Once per day, emit a burst of light, granting all allies within 30' +1 AC for 1d4 rounds. Undead within range suffer disadvantage on attack rolls.
column7: A relic of the Solari, this item radiates a comforting warmth. While holding the Eye of the Equinox, you gain a +2 bonus to AC against ranged attacks that deal radiant damage. As a reaction when you or an ally within 30 feet is hit by such an attack, you can expend 1 charge to grant resistance to radiant damage to the target of the attack until the end of their next turn. The Eye has 3 charges, and regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

column3: Forged on Targon, this item likely has connections to the Solari or the Rakkor, embodying protection and resilience.
column4: Grants a shield to an ally and executes minions. Nearby allies heal for a percentage of damage taken.
column5: Grants the wearer the ability to interpose before an ally, suffering blows in their stead. Additionally, when near death, the item may revitalize companions with transferred vitality.
column7: While holding this shield, you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. As a reaction when a creature within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can grant them temporary hit points equal to your level in that class. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

column3: Whispers say the Flicker was crafted by a forgotten order in Ionia, tied to the spirit realm and rapid translocation.
column4: Briefly grants invulnerability and a short-range teleport.
column5: Wearer vanishes in a puff of light, reappearing nearby. Save versus magic or attract unwanted attention from spirits. Grants +1 AC briefly after use.
column7: This amulet allows you to cast the Misty Step spell at will. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 15 feet. If you do so, the next attack roll made against you before the end of your next turn has disadvantage.

column3: May be related to Lissandra or another Ice Witch. Grants ghostly apparitions and slows foes.
column4: Generates gold and mana regen. Active creates icy ghosts that seek enemies and slow them.
column5: Upon utterance of the item's name, two incorporeal spectres are released to do the bidding of the wielder, chilling foes in their grasp and slowing them to a crawl. Lasts 1d4 rounds.
column7: This spectral diadem allows you to cast the 'Hold Person' spell once per long rest without expending a spell slot. Furthermore, as an action, you can summon two spectral apparitions that appear in unoccupied spaces within 30 feet of you. These apparitions have a speed of 30 feet and can move through creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. As a bonus action on your turn, you can command one apparition to attempt to slow a creature within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or have its speed halved until the end of its next turn. The apparitions disappear after 1 minute or if reduced to 0 hit points (they have 1 hit point each).

column3: May be associated with Iceborn, wielding frozen power. Perhaps wielded by Lissandra's loyal followers or ancient Frostguard warriors.
column4: Empowers auto attacks with an ice field that slows enemies and deals bonus damage.
column5: On hit, target must save vs. frost or be slowed for 1 round. Once per day, wielder can unleash a blast of frost dealing 1d6 cold damage in a 10ft cone; save vs. cold for half.
column7: This gauntlet, when worn, grants you resistance to cold damage. As an action, you can unleash a cone of frost extending 15 feet from you. Creatures in the cone must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take 4d6 cold damage and have their speed reduced by half until the end of their next turn. You can use this ability three times, regaining all expended uses after a long rest. While attuned to this item, you can cast the 'Armor of Agathys' spell once per long rest, without expending a spell slot.

column3: Forged in the icy heart of the Freljord, it whispers tales of ancient frost giants and forgotten winters.
column4: Provides armor, mana, and cooldown reduction. Passively slows nearby enemies after using an ability.
column5: Grants +2 AC. After casting a spell, enemies within 10' must save vs. paralysis or be slowed (half movement) for 1 round.
column7: While wearing this shroud, you are immune to the effects of extreme cold and gain advantage on saving throws against spells and effects that deal cold damage. In addition, once per day, as an action, you can summon a blizzard in a 20-foot radius centered on you. The blizzard lasts for 1 minute, heavily obscuring the area and imposing disadvantage on ranged attack rolls and Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight. At the end of each of your turns while the blizzard persists, each creature within the area takes 2d6 cold damage.

column3: Favored by Ionian monks seeking enlightenment through secluded meditation and observation of the spirit realm.
column4: Places a temporary invisible ward that reveals the surrounding area for a duration.
column5: Grants brief invisibility and +4 to spotting hidden foes. Ward lasts 6 turns, revealing invisible creatures and traps within 30'. Save vs. magic or attract unwanted attention from spirits.
column7: While holding this totem, you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. As an action, you can plant the totem in the ground. For the next hour, any creature within 30 feet of the totem gains the benefits of the Pass Without Trace spell. Once this effect ends, the totem crumbles to dust and is destroyed.

column3: Forged in the icy heart of the Freljord, rumored to be imbued with the spirits of ancient frost mages, forever seeking worthy warriors.
column4: Empowers jungling with bonus damage to monsters and grants bonus gold. Chilling Smite slows enemy champions.
column5: Inflicts 1d4 frost damage to beasts and grants +1 gold. A successful hit requires a DC 13 CON save or target suffers -2 to movement speed for 1 round.
column7: You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic longsword. When you hit a creature with this weapon, that creature must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or become encased in ice. While encased, the creature is restrained and has vulnerability to fire damage. At the end of each of its turns, the encased creature can repeat the saving throw, freeing itself on a success. On a critical hit, the target is permanently frozen solid.

column3: Rumored to be recovered from a Sunken Temple of Nagakabouros, favored by fortune hunters and those seeking quick riches in the port cities.
column4: Grants bonus health and provides bonus gold per 10 seconds. Upon death, the item is lost.
column5: Wearer gains +1 HP. Every turn, roll 1d6. On a 6, gain 1 gold. If the wearer is reduced to 0 HP, the item crumbles to dust, and is lost.
column7: While you wear this amulet, you have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks and Charisma (Persuasion) checks made when interacting with merchants or pirates. Additionally, once per day, you can cast the Locate Object spell. When you cast the spell in this way, you only locate gold coins or items made of gold. While attuned to the heart of gold, once per week, you can choose to have up to 1000 gold pieces magically appear in your hand.

column3: Associated with Viktor and the Glorious Evolution, enhancing the user's mechanical capabilities. Commonly seen among Zaun's techmaturge.
column4: Provides ability power, mana, and health. Can be upgraded into higher tier Hex Cores.
column5: Grants +1 to hit with any mechanical device. User must save vs. magic or be compelled to 'improve' self with further modifications. Chance for mechanical limb failure.
column7: This arcane device hums with untapped potential. As an action, you can attach the Hex Core to a willing construct, or humanoid creature that has mechanical body parts. The target gains a +2 bonus to their AC, and they gain resistance to either lightning or poison damage (their choice). Additionally, they can cast the Shocking Grasp cantrip at will, and can use an action to cast the Lightning Bolt spell (3rd level) once per day. Once per week, the attuned creature can use an action to cast the Animate Objects spell.

column3: Associated with early Noxian artificers, seeking to weaponize magic for the empire's expansion. Could be related to Mordekaiser's research.
column4: Grants magic damage and an on-hit damage effect that heals the user.
column5: On a hit, deal +1d4 magic damage, and heal 1hp. Rolls of 1 on the d4 cause a magical feedback dealing 1 damage to the user.
column7: This arcane focus, once wielded by Noxian artificers, hums with latent magical energy. As an action, you can expend 1 charge to cast the Shocking Grasp cantrip (save DC 13) or expend 3 charges to cast Magic Missile as a 1st level spell. The revolver has 7 charges and regains 1d4+3 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the revolver shatters into inert fragments.

column3: Likely used by foragers and hunters of the Freljord seeking to survive the harsh wilderness and monster encounters.
column4: Restores health and mana over time while hunting monsters in the jungle.
column5: Quaffing this potion heals 5 hit points per turn for 8 turns. Additionally, regain 1 spell slot if exhausted after the healing completes. Effects are negated by engaging in combat with other humanoids.
column7: When you drink this potion, you regain 2d4+2 hit points. For the next hour, you have advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to track creatures, and on attack rolls against beasts and monstrosities whose challenge rating is equal to or less than your level. The effects end early if you take damage from a creature that is not a beast or monstrosity.

column3: A draught favored by the Reckoners, rumored to be distilled from the blood of fallen gladiators. Enhances aggression and power.
column4: On takedown, grants bonus attack damage, magic damage and movement speed for a short duration.
column5: Drink grants +2 to hit and damage rolls for 1d4 rounds. Afterwards, make a DC15 CON save or be overcome with exhaustion (-2 to all rolls) for 2d6 turns.
column7: When you drink this viscous, crimson fluid, you gain the following benefits for 1 minute: You have advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. When you make a melee weapon attack using Strength, you gain a +3 bonus to the damage roll (included in the attack). At the end of each of your turns, you take 3 (1d6) necrotic damage that cannot be reduced in any way. Afterwards, you gain one level of exhaustion.

column3: Forged by a forgotten Ionian sect, the Ionic Spark was used to defend against shadow magic. Now, only echoes of its power remain.
column4: Deals chain lightning damage to nearby enemies.
column5: Creature touched by spark must save vs. electricity or be stunned for 1 round. Nearby creatures have a 1 in 6 chance to be struck by chain lightning for 1d6 damage.
column7: While holding this weapon, you can use a bonus action to activate the Spark, causing it to emit a crackling aura of energy for 1 minute. While the aura is active, any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of you takes 1d6 lightning damage. The Spark can be used three times, and regains all expended uses at dawn.

column3: Favored by fortune tellers and gamblers across Bilgewater, believing it brought them luck in their ventures.
column4: Grants ability power and bonus gold per 10 seconds.
column5: Bestow +1 on all luck checks. Anytime a '1' is rolled on a check, a ghostly visage appears, whispering secrets of upcoming trials for 1 round.
column7: While you possess this item, you have advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to resist being charmed or frightened. Additionally, once per day, when you make an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can choose to treat the roll as a 20.

column3: Forged in Ionia, rumored to enhance the life-stealing abilities of those who wield it, possibly tied to ancient Hemomancy practices.
column4: On-hit, deals bonus magic damage equal to a percentage of the target's maximum health.
column5: Creatures struck must SAVE vs. DEATH or suffer 1d4 permanent HP drain. The wielder heals the HP drained. Undead are immune.
column7: This magical weapon deals an extra 1d6 necrotic damage on a hit. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you regain hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt. Once per long rest, as a reaction when you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can choose to drop to 1 hit point instead. If you do so, the next attack you make with this weapon before the end of your next turn has advantage and deals an extra 3d6 necrotic damage.

column3: Whispers claim it was forged in the Immortal Bastion, fueled by hemomancy. Its previous owners met gruesome ends, their life essence drained.
column4: Damaging champions heals the wielder. Periodically deals damage to nearby enemies.
column5: Heals 1d6 HP per round when near the dying. Adjacent foes suffer 1d4 damage (save vs. Death Ray). Wielder slowly becomes a ghoul.
column7: This terrifying artifact pulses with dark energy. While holding the Leeching Leer, you can use a bonus action to target one creature within 30 feet that you can see. The target must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or take 5d6 necrotic damage, and you regain hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and you regain no hit points. Once you use this ability, you cannot use it again until the start of your next turn. In addition, any creature that touches the Leeching Leer takes 2d6 necrotic damage. A creature reduced to 0 hit points by the Leeching Leer has its life essence completely drained away and cannot be revived by any means short of a wish spell.

column3: Favored by Demacian rangers, this item enhances precision. Used by elite trackers.
column4: Increased attack damage and critical strike chance. Grants bonus movement speed.
column5: Ranger gains +1 to hit rolls at long range. On a critical hit, target must save vs. paralysis or be rooted for 1 round.
column7: This exquisitely crafted longbow is a masterwork of Demacian craftsmanship. You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, once per turn when you hit a creature with this bow, you can choose to deal an extra 2d6 radiant damage to the target and the next attack roll against the target before the end of your next turn has advantage.

column3: Favored by captains and sea monsters alike, the Leviathan was a sign of dominance on the high seas, often adorned with trophies.
column4: Grants health based on kills and assists, lost upon death. Maximum of 30 stacks.
column5: Wearer gains +1 max HP per foe vanquished (max 30). On death, lose 1d6 HP permanently. While at max stacks, attract the attention of krakens. Beware!
column7: This colossal greatsword radiates the power of the deep sea. You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can expend a charge to unleash a wave of seawater dealing an additional 4d8 cold damage and pushing the target 10 feet away. This weapon has 3 charges and regains all expended charges daily at dawn. While wielding this weapon, you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened, and you can breathe underwater.

column3: Said to be blessed by the celestial entities of Targon, offering protection against the harshest conditions.
column4: Grants health regeneration and increased maximum health, enhancing survivability.
column5: Wearer gains +1 to saves vs. death. Once per day, when reduced to 0 hit points, wearer is instead restored to 1d4 hit points.
column7: While wearing this pendant, you have advantage on saving throws against exhaustion and resistance to cold and fire damage. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can touch the pendant to regain hit points equal to 1d8 + your Constitution modifier. Once you use this bonus action, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

column3: Crafted by the legendary smith, Dominik, it is said to be blessed by the sun, allowing the wielder to pierce even the mightiest armor.
column4: Grants armor penetration and bonus damage against champions with more health.
column5: Attacks ignore AC, doing +1 damage per HD above the wielder (max +6). Undead & shadow creatures suffer double damage.
column7: This legendary weapon grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls. When you hit a creature with this weapon, and that creature's AC is 18 or higher, the weapon deals an extra 2d6 radiant damage. If the target is wearing heavy armor, the extra damage increases to 3d6 radiant damage. Once per long rest, you can use a bonus action to call forth the sun's blessing, granting you advantage on attack rolls against armored opponents for 1 minute.

column3: Resonates with the ancient magic of Ionia, amplifying the wearer's spells, reminiscent of a powerful echo mage.
column4: Grants ability power, mana, and movement speed. Damaging abilities grant charges, releasing chain lightning on the next hit.
column5: Once per turn, after casting a spell, release a forking bolt of lightning dealing 1d6 damage for every 2 levels. Range: 30ft. Save vs. Magic to halve damage.
column7: This arcane focus grants a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DC. When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals damage, roll a d6. On a roll of 5 or 6, the spell's damage is echoed, dealing an extra 2d6 force damage to one additional target within 30 feet of the original target. The extra target is chosen by you. This additional damage can only occur once per casting of a spell.

column3: Associated with a Noxian artificer who sought to weaponize hemomancy. The item was lost after an experiment went awry.
column4: Deals bonus magic damage equal to a percentage of the target's maximum health on hit.
column5: On a hit, the wielder siphons a portion of the target's life force dealing extra damage. The target must test against its Constitution or lose 1 point permanently.
column7: This weapon pulses with dark energy. Once per long rest, when you hit a creature with this weapon, you can choose to deal an extra 6d6 necrotic damage. If the creature has blood, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or its maximum hit points are reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. A creature is immune if it doesn't have blood or is undead.

column3: Whispers say it was crafted in the Shadow Isles, fueled by tormented spirits, twisting minds and bodies alike. It is associated with corruption.
column4: Dealing magic damage applies magic resist shred, reducing enemy defenses over time.
column5: Curse: On a hit, victim saves vs. Wisdom or suffers -1 to AC vs. magic and -1 to saves vs. spells for 1d4 rounds. Cumulative.
column7: This cursed item radiates an aura of unease. When a creature attunes to Malady, they must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or become afflicted with a madness. While attuned, the user has advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks, but disadvantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks. Additionally, once per day, the wielder can cast the spell 'Inflict Wounds' as a 5th-level spell, requiring no material components.

column3: Likely originating from the Shadow Isles, the Mandrake Ward could be associated with necromantic magic or entities manipulating perception and fear.
column4: Reveals a target area, warning of approaching enemies, but disappears after use or after a duration.
column5: Upon planting, the ward emits a psychic shriek audible only to creatures of ill intent within 30ft, imposing disadvantage on surprise attacks for creatures entering the area, fades after 1d4 turns.
column7: This gnarled wooden ward pulses with necromantic energy. As an action, you can plant the Mandrake Ward in the ground. For the next hour, all creatures within a 30-foot radius must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of you. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to this effect for 24 hours. The ward crumbles to dust after an hour or after being successfully dispelled.

column3: Whispers speak of a pact made with dark entities, granting strength but risking demonic influence, potentially linked to Mordekaiser's dominion.
column4: Grants bonus AD, magic resist, and a shield when taking magic damage that would reduce the champion below a certain health threshold.
column5: The bearer gains +3 to hit and damage rolls, and resists spells, but risks possession by a demon (save vs. magic or lose control!) upon taking lethal magic damage. Shield 1d6 damage.
column7: While attuned to this weapon, you gain advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. Additionally, when you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can choose to drop to 1 hit point instead. If you do so, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level in the class that granted you the most recent level. These temporary hit points last for 1 minute. Once this effect is triggered, it cannot be used again until you complete a long rest. However, after each long rest, roll a d20. On a result of 1, you must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or gain one level of exhaustion.

column3: Favored by captains navigating treacherous seas, it offers protection against curses and shadowy entities, common in the waters around Bilgewater.
column4: Grants attack damage, magic resist, and a cleanse effect to remove crowd control.
column5: Grants +2 to saves versus spells and paralysis. Once per day, may automatically break free from magical restraints or enchantments, as if by a Wish spell.
column7: This +2 scimitar has 3 charges. As an action, you can expend 1 charge to cast the Dispel Magic spell (DC 15). In addition, while you wield this scimitar, you have advantage on saving throws against curses and effects that would turn you into an undead creature. The scimitar regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

column3: Forged by Ionian spiritwalkers, its illusions confuse foes, reminiscent of the trickster spirits of the forests, reflecting Ionian adaptability and misdirection.
column4: On dealing damage, grants bonus move speed and creates a temporary, untargetable illusion near you.
column5: Grants fleeting passage (2 in 6 chance) through enemy lines after striking; a duplicate appears at the point of attack, attracting a single blow before vanishing. Roll 1d6; on a roll of 1 or 2, the player is briefly incorporeal.
column7: This +1 shortsword has 3 charges. As a bonus action, you can expend 1 charge to cast the Mirror Image spell. While wielding this blade, you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in lightly obscured areas. The shortsword regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

column3: Said to be blessed by the celestial light of Targon, channeling the moon's restorative energies to aid allies in need.
column4: Heals nearby allies when in combat, with the healing increasing over time.
column5: Grants the wearer the ability to mend grievous wounds of those nearby. Each round, the mending becomes more potent. Chance for mended wounds to leave shimmering scars.
column7: While holding this Moonstone Renewer, you can use a bonus action to touch a creature within 30 feet. That creature regains hit points equal to 3d6 + your spellcasting ability modifier. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until the next dawn. Additionally, whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that restores hit points to a creature, you can choose a different creature within 30 feet of the target. The chosen creature regains hit points equal to 1d6.

column3: Whispers say Murksphere was used by a forgotten order in the Shadow Isles to contain malevolent spirits.
column4: Deals magic damage and briefly grants movement speed when damaging an enemy champion.
column5: Once per day, cast *Spirit Leech*. The target must SAVE vs. Magic or take 1d6 damage and you gain +1 to SPEED for 1 turn.
column7: This orb pulses with an unnatural darkness. As an action, you can hurl the Murksphere at a point within 60 feet. Each creature within 20 feet of that point must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a failed save, a creature also takes 3d6 psychic damage. Once this property is used, the Murksphere becomes nonmagical for 24 hours.

column3: Said to be forged in the heart of the Shadow Isles, it pulses with the essence of tormented spirits, granting power at a terrible price.
column4: Grants bonus damage and movement speed on champion hit, with a cooldown and stacking mechanic.
column5: Creature gains +1 to hit and damage. Upon striking a foe, creature must SAVE vs WIL or be compelled to move towards their target, even if unwise.
column7: This dark blade hungers for life force. When you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, the creature takes an extra 2d6 necrotic damage. If the creature is reduced to 0 hit points by this attack, you gain temporary hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt. Additionally, once per long rest, when you are reduced to half your hit point maximum or lower, you can regain hit points equal to 4d8 + your Constitution modifier. After using this feature, you gain one level of exhaustion.

column3: Favored by frost archers of the Freljord, Noonquiver aids in hunting massive beasts across the frozen tundra.
column4: Grants increased attack damage and attack speed. Passively deals bonus damage to minions and monsters.
column5: On a hit, deal +1d6 damage vs large or huge foes. Shots fired in dim light gain advantage. Spend 1 round to recover 1d4 arrows.
column7: While wearing this quiver, you gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with ranged weapons that use ammunition drawn from it. In addition, as a bonus action, you can imbue up to three arrows drawn from the quiver with frost. When an arrow imbued this way hits a creature, that creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have its speed reduced by 20 feet until the end of its next turn. On a failed save, the creature also suffers disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn if it attempts to move before then.

column3: Favored by Noxian assassins, it allows for swift strikes and ruthless efficiency in eliminating high-value targets.
column4: Grants bonus movement speed after damaging an enemy champion. Subsequent damage deals increased damage.
column5: The user gains +2 to initiative. First successful attack deals +1d6 damage. Afterwards, the user must SAVE vs. WIS (DC 13) or be stunned 1 round by bloodlust.
column7: This dagger grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls. Additionally, once per turn, if you have advantage on an attack roll against a creature, you can choose to deal an extra 14 (4d6) necrotic damage to the target. If you do so, you gain advantage on Stealth checks until the end of your next turn as dark shadows obscure your movements.

column3: Favored by those who seek hidden truths on Mount Targon. Used by the guides that explore the mountain's treacherous paths.
column4: Temporarily reveals and disables nearby enemy wards and reveals hidden enemy traps.
column5: As an action, see invisible creatures and objects within 90'. The effect lasts for 1 turn, and recharges after 1d4 turns. Invisible objects and creatures are not surprised.
column7: While holding this lens, you can use a bonus action to cast the Detect Magic spell. The lens has 3 charges, and it regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn. Additionally, when you cast the Detect Magic spell using this lens, you can also choose to cast See Invisibility as part of the same action, consuming one additional charge.

column3: Favored by duelists and those who value agility, the Phantom Dancer is often associated with Ionian martial traditions.
column4: Grants attack speed, critical strike chance, and movement speed. Provides a shield when near death.
column5: The wearer moves with unnatural speed (+2 to initiative). On taking a fatal blow, a spectral shield appears, negating the damage and allowing the wearer to flee (teleport 30'). Usable once per day.
column7: While wearing this vestment, your Dexterity score increases by 2, to a maximum of 22. It also grants you the following benefits: You gain a +2 bonus to AC. When you are hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to become invisible until the end of your next turn. Once used, this property can't be used again until the next dawn. Your movement speed increases by 10 feet. If you move at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hit it with a melee weapon attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

column3: Dwarven smiths in the Freljord use enchanted pickaxes to mine True Ice, the only substance capable of forging weapons strong enough to kill a god.
column4: Grants additional attack damage, increasing the wielder's damage output.
column5: Upon striking stone, a roll of 1-3 on a d6 results in uncovering a secret passage. A roll of 4-6 causes the stone to crumble, collapsing the tunnel in 1d4 turns.
column7: This magical pickaxe grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made against objects and structures. When used to mine any metal, the wielder gains advantage on checks made to determine the quality and quantity of the mined ore. Against creatures composed of ice or cold, this pickaxe deals an additional 2d6 fire damage. Once per day, the wielder can cast the 'Shatter' spell (DC 15) centered on a point they can see within 60 feet.

column3: Favored by Demacian soldiers, these boots offer protection against both physical blows and magical assaults.
column4: Reduces incoming damage from basic attacks and increases armor.
column5: Wearer suffers -2 to reaction rolls from loud clanking. Grants +1 AC against metal weapons and reduces damage from blunt weapons by 1 hp. If wearer is struck by magic, they are 20% likely to ignore it.
column7: While wearing these boots, you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons. In addition, you have advantage on saving throws against being frightened or charmed. As a bonus action, you can stomp the ground, creating a shockwave in a 15-foot radius centered on yourself. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

column3: Favored by resourceful captains and cunning merchants to quickly redeploy ships and crews, or escape from dangerous waters.
column4: Places a targetable teleport pad. Allies can use it to teleport to other pads after a short channel.
column5: Creates a temporary magical portal. A second pad must be placed for it to function, allowing near instantaneous travel between the two points.
column7: This small, intricately carved pad allows for near-instantaneous teleportation of seagoing vessels. As an action, you can touch the pad to a ship of Large size or smaller. That ship, along with all creatures and objects aboard, instantly teleports to a predetermined location associated with this pad. The destination must be within 500 miles and a known, fixed location you have visited previously. The Port Pad can only be used once per day, and its destination can be changed by performing a 24-hour ritual at the desired new location.

column3: Likely used by early explorers of Shurima, seeking hidden tombs and resources beneath the sands. Perhaps belonging to a member of the Ascended.
column4: Grants bonus gold when near enemy structures. Reveals nearby wards.
column5: User can sense the presence of precious metals and gems within 30', and detect magical wards. Roll Wisdom to locate, failure means a false reading.
column7: This ring, crafted from sun-baked gold and etched with ancient Shuriman glyphs, grants its wearer advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to navigate deserts and Wisdom (Perception) checks to locate hidden doors, traps, and passages within ruins and tombs. Additionally, once per day, the wearer can cast the Locate Object spell, requiring no components, to find a specific object made of metal or stone within 1 mile. If the ring belonged to an Ascended, it might possess additional, yet dormant, powers waiting to be unlocked.

column3: Favored by Ionian archers seeking to strike with precision and speed, enhancing their ranged attacks.
column4: Grants Energized attacks, providing bonus range and magic damage on the next attack.
column5: Once per turn, +5 to hit with ranged weapons. If attack hits, deal +1d6 lightning damage and push target 5ft away.
column7: This exquisitely crafted longbow hums with latent energy. When you make a ranged attack with this weapon, the bowstring vibrates, enhancing the shot's power. The bow has a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can focus its energy, causing your next successful ranged attack with it to have its range doubled and deal an extra 2d6 lightning damage.

column3: Often found near spirit blossom festivals, rumored to contain essence from the spirit realm enhancing vitality.
column4: Restores health over time. A simple and reliable sustain option.
column5: Drinking restores 1d6 hit points per round for 10 rounds. If undead, suffer 1d4 damage per round for 5 rounds, then must save versus poison or be turned.
column7: When you drink this potion, you regain 8d4 hit points. For the next hour, you gain advantage on saving throws against disease and poison, and your exhaustion level, if any, is decreased by one.

column3: Associated with the Solari, celestial power is imbued within. Grants its user some of this godly strength.
column4: Provides mana regeneration, ability haste, and bonus health to the wielder and nearby allies.
column5: A character with this remnant regenerates MP at double rate, gains +1 AC. Once per day, heal all allies within 30' for 1d8 hit points.
column7: While holding this amulet, you gain a +2 bonus to Strength and Charisma checks and saving throws. Additionally, you can use a bonus action to call upon the celestial power within, granting you advantage on attack rolls for 1 minute. Once this bonus action is used, it cannot be used again until the next dawn.

column3: Enhances the wearer's spells, perhaps linked to ancient Ionian spirit magic or forgotten techniques.
column4: Periodically deals bonus magic damage to nearby enemies upon dealing ability damage.
column5: Once per turn, after casting a spell, unleash a blast of pure energy. Deals 1d6 force damage to all creatures within 10ft. Save vs. spell or be stunned for 1 round.
column7: While wearing this amulet, the first time you cast a spell of 1st level or higher on each of your turns, one target of the spell takes an extra 1d6 thunder damage. This damage increases to 2d6 if the spell requires an attack roll and the attack roll is a critical hit.

column3: Likely crafted by a hemomancer of Noxus, possibly connected to the Black Rose or Vladimir, focusing on blood magic.
column4: Deals magic damage and heals the wielder. Damage increases based on bonus health.
column5: Expend HP to deal arcane damage. Target creature bleeds for 1d4 rounds taking 1hp per round and healing the wielder for that amount.
column7: This ancient Noxian scroll contains a powerful ritual of hemomancy. When cast, using a willing or incapacitated creature, you can sacrifice up to 6 hit dice from it. For each hit die sacrificed, you can choose one of the following effects: Restore hit points to yourself equal to the maximum value of the die; Deal necrotic damage to a creature within 60 feet equal to double the maximum value of the die (no attack roll needed, target makes a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC to halve the damage); Create a blood construct with hit points equal to 5 times the maximum value of the die that obeys your commands for 1 hour; Enhance your weapon attacks with necrotic energy, dealing an extra 1d6 necrotic damage per sacrificed hit die for 1 minute. The scroll is destroyed after use.

column3: Enchanted blade, imbued with spirit magic. Associated with Ionian monks seeking balance and harmony through martial prowess and arcane study.
column4: Converts basic attack damage into magic damage on hit. Grants mana sustain and AoE magic damage.
column5: On a hit, deal +1d6 magic damage. Regain 1 mana on successful attack. The first foe struck unleashes an arcane pulse dealing 1d4 magic damage to any nearby.
column7: This exquisitely crafted glaive hums with Ionian spirit energy. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. Additionally, once per day, as a bonus action, you can imbue the glaive with arcane power for 1 minute. While imbued, the glaive deals an extra 2d6 radiant damage on a hit, and you can use your action to unleash a wave of spirit energy in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Undead and fiends have disadvantage on this saving throw.

column3: The compass may be related to ancient Freljordian navigation techniques or a relic of a lost tribe, possibly connected with Lissandra.
column4: Grants gold and mana regeneration based on proximity to an ally. Transforms into a different item after earning gold.
column5: While near another, the wielder never lacks for coin or spell. Once enough wealth is gathered the compass leads to a place of power, upgrading the user. Chance of attracting unwanted attention.
column7: This ancient compass, etched with Freljordian runes, always points towards the nearest source of powerful elemental magic. The compass has 3 charges and regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn. As an action, you can expend a charge and ask the compass a question related to finding a specific location or object imbued with elemental power. The compass will then guide you towards the answer for the next hour, granting you advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks made to track or navigate towards the source. Furthermore, while holding the compass, you are resistant to cold damage and have advantage on saving throws against being lost or disoriented due to magical effects.

column3: Whispers say it was crafted by an ascetic order devoted to the stars, seeking to emulate celestial benevolence.
column4: Provides a shield to allies who are nearby when you cast your ultimate.
column5: Once per dawn, touch a grievously wounded ally to grant them temporary invulnerability. The savior suffers half the damage themselves; save versus death or be destroyed.
column12: As an action, you touch a creature at 0 hit points. That creature becomes immune to all damage until the end of your next turn. You take damage equal to half the amount it would have taken (rounded down). If this reduces you to 0 hit points, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or die instantly.
