column3: The pup's fiery claws hint at a connection to the volcanic vents deep within the Freljord. Perhaps it is related to a forgotten fire god.
column4: Deals bonus damage on next attack and applies a slow.
column5: Next melee attack deals +1d6 fire damage and target suffers -2 to DEX saves for 1 round. Save vs. paralysis or be rooted to the spot.
column12: The next time you hit with a melee weapon attack before the end of your turn, the target takes an extra 1d6 fire damage and has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws until the end of its next turn. It must also succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier) or its speed becomes 0 until the end of its next turn.

column3: Favored by Noxian admirals and generals, it represents strategic authority and martial strength, often seen in command tents or on flagships.
column4: Grants bonus health, ability haste, and an active effect to boost nearby ally damage.
column5: Once per day, issue a Command. Allies within earshot gain +1 to hit and damage rolls for 1d4 rounds. Undead and constructs are immune.
column12: As a bonus action, you issue a commanding shout. Each ally within 60 feet who can hear you gains a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls for 1d4 rounds. Undead and constructs are unaffected.

column3: Favored by Noxian assassins, its design whispers of a tool crafted to dismantle Demacian battlemages' protective enchantments.
column4: Deals bonus damage to enemy shields. Reduces enemy shield effectiveness for a short duration.
column5: On hit, any magical warding is weakened, negating 2d6 points of protection and making the target easier to curse. May attract the attention of shieldmages.
column7: This dagger grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls. On a hit, if the target has a magical shield or barrier active (such as from the Shield spell or a similar effect), that effect is immediately dispelled. Additionally, the target has disadvantage on saving throws against spells for 1 minute.

column3: Forged in Noxus, rumored to have belonged to a disgraced warlord, its magic offers resilience, but at a cost.
column4: Grants ability power and armor, but reduces damage dealt as health decreases.
column5: Wearer gains +2 to AC and +1 to magical attacks. As HP decreases, attacks deal -1 damage per 10% HP lost. Upon reaching 0 HP, the armguard shatters, dealing 1d6 magical damage to all within 5ft.
column7: While wearing this armguard, you gain a +2 bonus to AC and advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. However, at the end of each long rest, you must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or gain one level of exhaustion. This item is cursed, and becoming attuned to it extends the curse to you. As long as you remain cursed, you are unwilling to part with the armguard.

column3: Said to amplify the will of the wielder, Shurelya's Requiem is rumored to originate from the Solari during a time of great need.
column4: Grants movement speed and empowers allies with bonus damage on their attacks for a short duration.
column5: Blast the Requiem. Allies within 30' move with haste, attacks deal +1 damage. Save vs. Spells or be stunned for 1 round after the effect ends due to psychic overload.
column7: While holding this amulet, you can use an action to grant yourself and all allies within 30 feet a burst of speed. For the next minute, each affected creature's movement speed is doubled, and they gain advantage on Dexterity saving throws. Once used, this property of the amulet cannot be used again until the next dawn. Additionally, while attuned to this amulet, you gain advantage on Wisdom saving throws.

column3: Forged atop Mount Targon, Sightstones are imbued with celestial energy, granting vision where the mortal eye cannot perceive.
column4: Periodically grants wards to place on the map, providing vision in a designated area for a limited time.
column5: Functions as a spyglass revealing hidden threats and secret passages. User can cast 'clairvoyance' once per day; revealing a distant location on the map to the party, or can cast 'detect invisible' in a 30' radius.
column7: This smooth, milky stone pulses with a faint, inner light. While holding the Sightstone, you can cast the 'Detect Magic' spell at will, and you gain advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks relying on sight within 30 feet. As an action, you can expend a charge (recharges 1d4-1 charges at dawn) to cast the 'Clairvoyance' spell, requiring no material components. The stone emits dim light in a 5-foot radius while in use.

column3: Whispers say a hedge wizard in Ionia enchants boots for nimble students, granting bursts of speed. Perhaps a connection to the Kinkou Order?
column4: Slightly increased movement speed. Reduces the cost of upgraded boots.
column5: Wearer moves +10' per round. On a DEX save of 11+, boots reduce material cost of magical upgrades by 25% due to inherent enchantment.
column7: While wearing these supple leather boots, your walking speed increases by 5 feet. Once per short rest, as a bonus action, you can activate the boots to double your walking speed until the end of your turn. If you move at least 20 feet in a straight line using this doubled speed, you can make one melee weapon attack with advantage against a creature within range at the end of your movement.

column3: Bound to restless spirits, it echoes the Shadow Isles' sorrow, perhaps linked to the Ruination or lost souls seeking solace.
column4: Periodically grants a shield when near allies taking damage, then heals based on damage prevented.
column5: Grants ephemeral protection to nearby allies, siphoning their injuries. Upon shield break, the wielder is revitalized by the transferred life force. Save versus Death at zero HP or become a shade.
column7: This heavy, iron anchor radiates a chilling aura. While holding it, you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. As an action, you can slam the Soul Anchor into the ground. For the next minute, all undead creatures within 30 feet of the anchor have disadvantage on attack rolls and must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw to move more than 10 feet away from the anchor on their turn. Once this property is used, it cannot be used again until the next dawn.

column3: Associated with restless spirits and the magic of the Shadow Isles, potentially used to siphon life force or manipulate spectral energies.
column4: Grants gold and vision when damaging enemy champions. Transforms into Harrowing Crescent upon quest completion.
column5: Upon striking a foe, the wielder leeches 1d4 HP, granting temporary sight beyond the veil. Upon leeching a total of 100 HP, it becomes the Harrowing Crescent, permanently granting the ability to see invisible foes.
column7: This sickle, when wielded against an undead creature, deals an extra 2d6 necrotic damage. Additionally, once per long rest, when you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this sickle, you can choose to trap its soul. The creature cannot be resurrected except by a wish spell or similar magic, and you gain advantage on one attack roll, ability check, or saving throw within the next hour.

column3: Favored by those who siphon power from the weak, it may be associated with Lisandra's frostguard, or potentially even a tribe using dark ice.
column4: Grants bonus damage and gold on damaging spells and attacks against enemy champions. Disables gold generation when excessive CSing occurs.
column5: Upon striking a foe, siphon their life force, gaining temporary vigor (+1 to hit) and wealth (1d6 cp). If you attack a minion or other creature beneath your notice, the edge dulls, and the effect ceases for 1 turn.
column7: While holding this dagger, whenever you cast a spell that deals damage, you can choose one creature damaged by the spell to suffer disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes against a spell you cast before the end of your next turn. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until the start of your next turn. Additionally, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DC.

column3: Associated with ancient Ionian monasteries, enhancing spiritual resilience and healing practices. Monks often use it to meditate and enhance their natural Ki.
column4: Increases magic resist, health, and healing received. Boosts regeneration and shield effectiveness.
column5: Wearer gains +2 on saves versus spells and doubles HP restored from any magical or medicinal source. Additionally, grants a +1 bonus to Wisdom checks related to healing or spiritual insight.
column7: While wearing this mask, you have resistance to necrotic damage and you gain advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened. Additionally, whenever you regain hit points from a spell or magical effect, you regain additional hit points equal to 1d6. This bonus increases to 2d6 if you are in your own plane of existence.

column3: Associated with the now-defunct Stark family of Noxus, known for their brutal efficiency in warfare and their fervor in battle.
column4: Aura grants attack speed and lifesteal to nearby allies, while reducing the armor of enemies.
column5: Confers +1 to hit and damage rolls to allies within 30'. Enemies within range suffer -1 to AC. Bearer tests Will each round to avoid berserker rage (disadvantage on further Will saves).
column7: This Noxian warhammer was forged for the Stark family. While wielding this hammer, you gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls. In addition, when you score a critical hit with this weapon, the target must succeed on a DC 17 Constitution saving throw or become stunned until the end of your next turn. Once per long rest, as a bonus action, you can unleash a wave of raw aggression, granting yourself advantage on all attack rolls until the end of your next turn and enemies within 30 feet of you must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you until the end of your next turn.

column3: Favored by Ionian monks and scouts, stealth wards allow for observation and protection.
column4: Grants temporary vision of an area. Invisible to enemies.
column5: Casts 'Eye of the Hidden Path.' Range: 120'. Duration: 1 Turn. Undetectable by normal means. Reveals creatures/objects within a 30' radius.
column7: This small, intricately carved stone can be planted as an action. When placed on the ground, the Stealth Ward becomes invisible and lasts for 8 hours or until destroyed. Any creature that comes within 10 feet of the ward must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom (Perception) check to notice it. If a creature fails this check, the ward silently alerts you to their presence, provided you are within 1 mile of the ward, and it immediately disappears. You can have a maximum of three active Stealth Wards at any given time; placing a fourth causes the oldest one to crumble into dust.

column3: Whispers claim it channels celestial storms, favored by Aspect hosts seeking to overwhelm mortal foes. Connections to the Solari are suspected.
column4: Grants bonus magic damage on hit, and if the target dies you gain move speed.
column5: Upon striking true, inflict an additional 1d6 lightning damage. If the target is slain, move an additional 1d4 hexes this turn. If wielder has Celestial blood, double damage and movement.
column7: This Targon-forged staff crackles with celestial energy. You gain a +3 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DC. Once per day, as an action, you can cast Chain Lightning (8th level) without expending a spell slot. After casting Chain Lightning in this way, roll a d6. On a 1, the staff loses its magic and becomes a nonmagical quarterstaff.

column3: Forged with celestial energies, it might be tied to the Aspect of Twilight or constellations influencing fate. Champions who seek to fight gods would use it.
column4: First attack after casting a spell crits, heals, and grants bonus armor penetration.
column5: Guaranteed hit! Target takes double damage and must save versus CON or be stunned for 1 round. User heals 1d8 HP and gains +2 AC for 3 rounds.
column7: This legendary greatsword hums with celestial energy. Once per day, when you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, you can choose to deal an extra 6d8 radiant damage to the target. The next attack roll made against the target before the end of your next turn has advantage.

column3: Said to be forged from the light of a collapsing star. Prized by the Solari for its celestial power and connection to the Aspects.
column4: Grants bonus attack damage, attack speed and magic resist, increasing with consecutive attacks on champions.
column5: Wielder gains +1 to hit and damage. On a successful attack, roll 1d6. On a 6, gain advantage on saving throws vs. spells and abilities for 1 round.
column7: This radiant longsword pulses with starlight. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. As an action, you can unleash a burst of celestial energy, forcing each creature within 15 feet of you to make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 4d6 radiant damage and is blinded until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't blinded. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

column3: Favored by Noxian gladiators, the Brutalizer is a barbaric tool used to break down opponents. Said to have been forged in the Immortal Bastion's shadow.
column4: Grants attack damage and armor penetration, enhancing physical damage output against armored foes.
column5: Weapon deals +1d4 damage, ignores up to 2 points of AC from armor. On a critical hit, target's AC is permanently reduced by 1 (cumulative).
column7: This menacing battleaxe thirsts for violence. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. When you hit a creature with this axe, the target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn. Additionally, you gain a +2 bonus to Intimidation checks while you wield this weapon.

column3: A parasitic entity from the Shadow Isles, possibly related to the Black Mist or a forgotten spirit. Feeds on the life force of its host.
column4: Periodically leeches health from nearby enemies, granting it to the wielder and damaging the victim.
column5: Bestow this wriggling horror upon a foe and steal 1d4 HP each round. On a fumble, the Parasite consumes you instead!
column7: While attuned to this item, you are immune to being charmed or possessed. Additionally, as an action, you can attempt to drain the life force of a creature within 5 feet of you. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take 3d6 necrotic damage, and you regain hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. While attuned, you have disadvantage on all Charisma checks not directed at undead.

column3: Likely crafted by an ancient Ice Witch, possibly Lissandra, its magic has faded with time, becoming a shadow of its former power.
column4: Grants gold generation and ability power. Provides a bonus to mana regeneration and some health.
column5: Once per day, touch the Frostfang to attempt to Freeze a target in place (Save vs. Magic). Grants +1 to cast magic missiles. Provides 1hp/level, and the holder can cast 'detect magic' once per day.
column7: This dagger is a relic of a bygone age, radiating a faint chill. While holding the dagger, you have resistance to cold damage. As an action, you can expend 1 charge to unleash a burst of frost. Each creature in a 15-foot cone originating from you must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 2d6 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails this save also has its speed reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn. The dagger has 3 charges, and regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

column3: Possibly connected to an ancient Aspect or celestial being of Targon. Its age suggests a forgotten era of cosmic influence.
column4: Grants movement speed, mana regeneration, and ability haste to nearby allies.
column5: Upon activation, nearby party members receive +1 to their Speed factor and recover 1d4 mana per turn for the duration. Potential for catastrophic time paradoxes exists; GM discretion advised.
column7: While wearing this talisman, you gain a +1 bonus to your AC and saving throws. Once per long rest, when you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can choose to be healed for 2d8 + your Wisdom modifier hit points instead. If you do, a beam of faint starlight descends upon you from the heavens. Additionally, you gain advantage on saving throws against being frightened while you are at or above half of your maximum hit points.

column3: The elixir's ingredients are rumored to be sourced from the Spirit Blossom festival, enhancing magical prowess for a brief time.
column4: Grants bonus Ability Power for a short duration upon consumption.
column5: Drink: Next magical attack deals +1d4 damage. Duration: 3 turns. Side effects may include uncontrollable giggling and seeing spirits.
column7: When you drink this elixir, you regain one expended spell slot. The spell slot can be of 3rd level or lower. The elixir has no effect if you have no expended spell slots. For the next hour, you have advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against spells and magical effects. After 1 hour, you suffer one level of exhaustion.

column3: Forged with ancient Ionian techniques, it is said to amplify the wielder's innate abilities. Associated with the spirit realm.
column4: Empowers abilities after use, grants bonus damage, attack speed and movement speed.
column5: On a hit, if the user just cast a spell, roll +Level, on a success, deal +1d6 damage, +1 to speed and attacks for 3 rounds. On a fumble take 1d4 spirit damage.
column7: This magical weapon grants a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. When you hit a creature with this weapon, you can expend 3 ki points to deal an extra 3d10 force damage to the target and regain hit points equal to the force damage dealt. You can only use this ability once per turn.

column3: Likely created in Zaun by Viktor or one of his followers. It appears to be a Hextech device modified with unique chemicals.
column4: Empowers a champion to charge at enemies, dealing damage and creating a damaging nova after a short delay.
column5: Wearer can make one devastating charge attack per encounter, dealing 2d6 damage to all within 10ft on impact. Afterwards, the wearer risks losing control (50% chance) for 1 round.
column7: This device has 3 charges. As an action, you can expend one charge to unleash a burst of energy, creating one of the following effects: 1) Fire a beam that deals 8d6 lightning damage in a 60-foot line, 5 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking half damage on a success. 2) Release a cloud of noxious gas in a 20-foot radius. Each creature in the cloud must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. A poisoned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. 3) Unleash a wave of concussive force, pushing all creatures within 15 feet of you 15 feet away. Creatures must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. The device regains 1d3 charges daily at dawn.

column3: Legends say a tempestuous spirit was bound within it by a forgotten Ionian sect, granting the wielder incredible speed and agility.
column4: On hit, grants movement speed and bonus damage. Stacks up to three times.
column5: Grants +1 to initiative and allows an extra attack. However, after 3 rounds, requires a DC 15 WIS save or become winded (-1 to hit for 1 round).
column7: While wielding Typhoon, you gain the following benefits: Your speed increases by 30 feet. You have advantage on Dexterity saving throws. As a bonus action, you can summon a whirlwind in a 10-foot radius around you. Creatures within the whirlwind have disadvantage on ranged attack rolls. The whirlwind lasts for 1 minute or until you dismiss it as a bonus action. Once you use this bonus action, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

column3: Favored by those who dance among the stars, granting ethereal lightness and swiftness to reach ever higher celestial realms.
column4: Grants bonus movement speed and allows the holder to move unhindered through units.
column5: Wearer moves as if weightless, ignoring difficult terrain. Chance to float upwards when still; roll a d6. On a 6, ascend 10' per round until landing or action is taken.
column7: While wearing this aeropack, you gain a flying speed of 60 feet. Additionally, you can cast the Feather Fall spell at will. As an action, you can activate the aeropack's enhanced thrusters, granting you a flying speed of 120 feet and the ability to hover for 1 minute. After using the enhanced thrusters, the aeropack requires 1 hour to recharge.

column3: Crafted in Demacia, rumored to ward against rogue mages or creatures of the void. The barrier instills courage against magical threats.
column4: Grants magic resistance and ability power, absorbing incoming magic damage with a shield.
column5: Wearer gains +3 to saves vs. magic and a 1-time shield of 1d8 hp vs. magical attacks. Shield recharges after a full day of rest. Detect magic cast upon the wearer has a 25% chance of failing.
column7: While holding this shield, you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. As a reaction when you or a creature within 30 feet of you is targeted by a spell, you can expend 1 of the shield's 3 charges to grant the target advantage on the saving throw against the spell. The shield regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

column3: Used by Demacian scouts to maintain vigilance against Sylas' mageseekers. Also favored by Garen's Dauntless Vanguard for reconnaissance.
column4: Grants vision of an area, revealing invisible units and wards. Lasts until destroyed.
column5: Creates an invisible, immobile sensor. Detects illusions, magical creatures and the invisible. Easily dispelled by magic or a strong wind. Range: 30 ft.
column7: This small, magically-infused stone can be planted as an action. It emits bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet. While active, the ward grants advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks to detect invisible or obscured creatures and objects within its radius. The ward has AC 10, 1 hit point, and is immune to poison and psychic damage. It lasts for 8 hours or until destroyed. A creature can use its action to make a DC 15 Intelligence (Arcana) check to dispel the ward early.

column3: Forged in the heart of Noxus, imbued with relentless aggression. Favored by Darius, it amplifies martial prowess and dominance on the battlefield.
column4: Bonus attack damage and increased regeneration after champion takedowns.
column5: Confers +1 to hit and damage. After slaying a foe, regain 1d4 hit points. A failed save vs. fear after combat may result in aggressive outbursts.
column7: This weapon pulses with barely contained rage. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, when you score a critical hit with this weapon, the target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. On a failed save, you can immediately make one additional weapon attack against the prone target as a reaction.

column3: A brutal weapon favored by Noxian executioners, rumored to be stained with the essence of countless betrayals and dark pacts.
column4: Dealing physical damage grants stacking attack damage and movement speed for a short duration.
column5: On hit: target must SAVE vs DEATH or be reduced to 0 hp and fall to pieces! On a successful save, wielder gains +1 to hit and damage rolls for 1d4 rounds.
column7: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic hatchet. Once per day, when you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with this weapon, you can regain hit points equal to your proficiency bonus. Also, the first time on each of your turns that you hit a creature with an attack using this weapon, the creature takes an extra 1d6 necrotic damage.

column3: Likely crafted by the Iceborn, it resonates with the magic of the Freljord and is tied to increasing one's resilience and defense.
column4: Grants mana, armor, and ability haste. Absorbs damage, and transforms into Fimbulwinter upon reaching a certain mana threshold.
column5: Wearer gains +2 AC and +1 to hit rolls against cold-based attacks. If the wearer's HP is reduced to 0, a barrier of ice forms, granting them temporary invulnerability but inflicting Exhaustion afterwards.
column7: While wearing this amulet, you gain resistance to cold damage. Additionally, you can use an action to summon a blizzard in a 20-foot radius centered on you. The blizzard lasts for 1 minute, lightly obscures the area, and creatures within the blizzard have their movement speed halved. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

column3: Forged atop Mount Targon, it resonates with celestial energy, amplifying bonds between allies and echoing ancient pacts.
column4: Grants bonus health and ability power; heals nearby allies when casting or taking damage.
column5: Heal 1d6 hit points to all allies within 30ft when you expend a spell slot or take more than 5 damage in a single turn. Usable 3 times per day.
column7: This amulet has 3 charges. As an action, you can expend 1 charge to grant one creature you can see within 30 feet of you the benefits of the *Bless* spell for 1 minute (no concentration required). Additionally, if you or an ally within 30 feet of you is reduced to 0 hit points, you can expend 2 charges as a reaction to instead drop to 1 hit point. The amulet regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

column3: Said to ward off spirits, Wriggle's Lantern was once used by sentinels to navigate the Shadow Isles. It is now lost.
column4: Provides attack damage, armor, life steal, and a chance to ward on attack.
column5: Lantern allows sight through magical darkness, +1 AC, and drains 1 HD worth of life force from anything struck by the wielder's melee attacks.
column7: This lantern sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. While holding the lantern, you have advantage on saving throws against being frightened or possessed by undead. As an action, you can target a creature within 60 feet of you that is invisible, ethereal, or shapechanged. That creature must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become visible, corporeal, or revert to its true form for 1 minute. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

column3: Worn by elite Kinkou Order trainees. Enhances agility and grounding, essential for maintaining balance in spiritual and physical combat.
column4: Reduces the duration of slows. Grants tenacity, reducing the duration of crowd control effects.
column5: Wearer ignores difficult terrain. +1 save vs. spells affecting movement or balance. A failed save causes disadvantage on attack rolls for 1 round.
column7: While wearing these boots, your Dexterity score increases by 2, to a maximum of 22. Additionally, you have advantage on saving throws against being knocked prone or moved against your will.

column3: Likely tied to the spirit of Youmuu, a restless soul haunting the Shadow Isles, seeking vengeance.
column4: Provides lethality and movement speed, increasing damage and mobility.
column5: Wearer becomes harder to hit (-2 AC), moves faster (+10' movement), and deals +2 damage to those who have wronged them. But attracts spectres that drain 1 HP per turn.
column7: This spectral blade hums with restless energy. Once per long rest, as a bonus action, you can unleash Youmuu's Wrath for 1 minute. While Youmuu's Wrath is active, your movement speed is doubled, and you gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls. At the end of Youmuu's Wrath, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of exhaustion.

column3: Favored by Ionian duelists valuing swiftness, embodying balance between speed and precision, reflecting Ionian martial philosophies.
column4: Increases movement speed and critical strike chance.
column5: Bestows +1 to initiative and a +1 bonus to hit when charging or retreating. Once per day, reroll a missed attack roll.
column7: While attuned to this item, your base walking speed increases by 10 feet. Additionally, you gain a +1 bonus to your AC and Dexterity saving throws as long as you are not wearing heavy armor or using a shield. As a reaction when you are targeted by a melee attack, you can move up to your speed away from the attacker, negating the attack.

column3: Potentially forged by the Ice Witch, or granted to followers of the Three Sisters. Grants frost powers.
column4: Binds you and an ally, granting bonus damage on attacks and slowing enemies you attack.
column5: The wearer can cast "Frost Armor" on an ally. AC is improved by 2, and melee attackers must save vs. Paralysis or be slowed for 1d4 rounds.
column7: While wearing this herald, you gain resistance to cold damage. As an action, you can unleash a wave of frost, forcing each creature in a 30-foot cone to make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 6d8 cold damage and has its speed reduced by half until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and doesn't have its speed reduced. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until the next dawn.

column3: Presumably crafted by, or in honor of, the ancient Shuriman artificer, Zhonya. In theory, it's a device that can stop time.
column4: Renders the champion invulnerable and untargetable for a short duration, but prevents them from taking actions.
column5: User becomes immune to all damage but is turned to gold and cannot act. Lasts 2d4 combat rounds. Requires DC 18 WIS save to activate, on failure, target is turned to gold permanently.
column7: This intricate golden device allows you to briefly manipulate time. As an action, you can activate Zhonya's Paradox, encasing yourself in a temporal stasis for 1 round. During this time, you are petrified, and you are immune to all damage and effects, but you also cannot take any actions, move, or be moved. After the round ends, you return to normal. Once used, Zhonya's Paradox cannot be used again until 7 days have passed.

column3: Likely tied to ancient Shuriman constructs or void-touched experiments gone awry. May be a relic of the Rune Wars.
column4: Periodically spawns Voidspawn to push lanes. Grants bonus armor and magic resist near turrets.
column5: Once per day, summon a CR 1/2 Voidling that lasts 1d4 turns. While within 30' of a structure, gain +2 AC and +2 to saves vs. magic.
column7: This fist-sized stone pulsates with otherworldly energy. As an action, you can place the Zz'Rot Portal on any unoccupied space within 10 feet. The portal lasts for 1 minute, or until destroyed (AC 15, 30 hit points, immune to psychic and poison damage). Each round, at the start of your turn, the portal summons 1d3 Voidmites. These creatures are loyal to you and obey your commands. After the portal disappears, it crumbles to dust and cannot be used again.
